ref: Verily, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of the mankind believe not.
draft: But most people do not believe.
hil: But most people do not believe.
compare: But most people do not believe.

src: Aber es glaubten Musa nur junge Leute aus seinem Volk, trotz ihrer Furcht vor Fir'aun und ihrer führenden Schar, davor, daß er sie verfolgen würde.
ref: But none believed in Moses except some children of his people, for fear that Pharaoh and his chiefs would persecute them.
draft: But only young people from his own people believed in Musa, despite their fear of Pharaoh and his leading troops that he would chase them.
hil: But only the young people from his own people believed in Musa, despite their fear of Fir'aun and his leading troop chasing them.
compare: But only the young people from his own people believed in Musa, despite their fear of Fir'aun and his leading troop chasing them.

src: Darum gewähre nun den Ungläubigen Aufschub, ein klein wenig Aufschub.
ref: So bear with unbelievers with patience, and give them respite for a while.
draft: Therefore, grant the unbelievers a little respite, a small respite.
hil: Therefore grant the unbelievers a little respite, a small respite.
compare: Therefore, grant the unbelievers a little respite, a small respite.

src: Und du wirst im Verfahren Gottes keine Veränderung finden.
ref: And you will not find any change in the Way of Allah.
draft: And you will find no change in the process of God.
hil: And in the way of God you will find no change.
compare: And in the way of God you will find no change.

src: Gewiß, WIR ließen dir Wahy zuteil werden, wie WIR Wahy Nuh und den Propheten nach ihm zuteil werden ließen. Ebenso ließen WIRWahy zuteil werden Ibrahim, Isma'il, Ishaq, Ya'qub, den Stämmen Israils, 'Isa, Ayyub, Yunus, Harun und Sulaiman. Auch ließen WIR Dawud Zabur zukommen.
ref: We have sent revelations to you as We sent revelations to Noah and the prophets (who came) after him; and We sent revelations to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob, and their offspring, and to Jesus and Job, and to Jonah and Aaron and Solomon, and to David We gave the Book of Psalms,
draft: Certainly, WE gave you revelation as WE gave revelation to Nuh and the prophets after him. Similarly, WE granted revelation to Ibrahim, Isma'il, Ishaq, Ya'qub, the tribes of Israel, 'Isa, Ayyub, Yunus, Harun, and Sulaiman. Also, WE bestowed upon Dawud the Zabur.
hil: Certainly, We revealed to you as We revealed to Nuh and the prophets after him. We also revealed to Ibrahim, Ismael, Isaac, Jacob, the descendants of Israel, Jonah, Job, Aaron, Solomon, and to Dawud, the Book.
compare: Certainly, WE gave you revelation as WE gave revelation to Nuh and the prophets after him. Similarly, WE granted revelation to Ibrahim, Isma'il, Ishaq, Ya'qub, the tribes of Israel, 'Isa, Ayyub, Yunus, Harun, and Sulaiman. Also, WE bestowed upon Dawud the Zabur.

src: ER wird denjenigen, die Schlechtes taten, doch das vergelten, was sie taten, und ER wird denjenigen, die Ihsan taten, mit dem Besseren vergelten.
ref: He will repay those who do evil according to their deeds, and recompense those who do good with the best.
draft: He will repay those who did bad things with what they did, and he will repay those who did good things with something better.
hil: He will repay those who did bad things with what they did, and he will repay those who did good things with something better.
compare: He will repay those who did bad things with what they did, and he will repay those who did good things with something better.

src: (Erwähne) den Tag, an dem ALLAH die Gesandten versammelt, dann sagt: "Welche Antwort wurde euch gegeben?!"
ref: The day God will gather the apostles and ask: "What answer was made to you?"
draft: (Mention) the day when ALLAH will gather the Messengers and say, "What answer was given to you?!"
hil: Mention the day when Allah will gather the Messengers and say, 'What answer was given to you?!'
compare: (Mention) the day when ALLAH will gather the Messengers and say, "What answer was given to you?!"

src: Und wenn WIR es wollten, gewiß hätten WIR dir sie gezeigt, dann wirst du sie sicher an ihren Merkmalen erkennen. Und du erkennst sie doch an der Andeutung mit dem Gesagten. Und ALLAH kennt eure Handlungen.
ref: And if We will, We can show them to you so that you may recognise them by their faces; and you will surely recognise them by the way they talk; and Allah knows your deeds.
draft: And if WE wanted to, WE would certainly have shown them to you, then you will recognize them for sure by their characteristics. And you recognize them by the hint of what has been said. And ALLAH knows your actions.
hil: "Our Lord can certainly show you the way if He wants to, and you will surely recognize it by its characteristics. And you can recognize it through the hint of what was said. And Allah knows your actions."
compare: "Our Lord can certainly show you the way if He wants to, and you will surely recognize it by its characteristics. And you can recognize it through the hint of what was said. And Allah knows your actions."

src: Und beleidigt euch nicht gegenseitig durch Gesten und bewerft euch nicht gegenseitig mit (häßlichen) Beinamen.
ref: Do not slander one another, nor give one another nick-names.
draft: And don't insult each other through gestures and don't throw (ugly) nicknames at each other.
hil: And do not insult each other with gestures, and do not throw (ugly) nicknames at each other.
compare: And don't insult each other through gestures and don't throw (ugly) nicknames at each other.

src: An ihnen habt ihr sonst allerlei Nutzen. Und damit ihr, auf ihnen reitend, etwas, was ihr in eurer Brust hegt und anstrebt, erreichen könnt.
ref: And in them you have other benefits as well, and through them you satisfy your needs.
draft: You otherwise have all kinds of benefits from them. And so that you can achieve something that you cherish and strive for in your heart by riding on them.
hil: They otherwise have all kinds of benefits for you. And so that you can achieve something that you cherish and strive for in your heart by riding on them.
compare: They otherwise have all kinds of benefits for you. And so that you can achieve something that you cherish and strive for in your heart by riding on them.

src: Auch Derjenige, Der vom Himmel Wasser nach Bestimmung fallen ließ, dann ließen WIR damit eine tote Landschaft erstehen. Solcherart werdet ihr hervorgebracht.
ref: Who sent down water in due measure from the sky, then quickened a region that was dead -- So shall We bring you forth --
draft: Also the one who let water fall from the sky according to a plan, we let a dead landscape emerge with it. In this way you will be brought forth.
hil: And He who caused water to descend from the sky according to a determined measure, then with it We revived a dead land. Likewise will you also be brought forth.
compare: And He who caused water to descend from the sky according to a determined measure, then with it We revived a dead land. Likewise will you also be brought forth.

src: ER weiß, was in die Erde hineingeht, was aus ihr herauskommt, und was vom Himmel hinabkommt, und in ihn hinaufsteigt. Und ER ist Der Allgnädige, Der Allvergebende.
ref: He knows all that goes into the earth and all that comes out of it, and all that descends from the skies and all that ascends into it; and only He is the Most Merciful, the Oft Forgiving.
draft: "He knows what goes into the earth, what comes out of it, what comes down from heaven, and what ascends into it. And He is the Most Merciful, the Most Forgiving."
hil: He knows what goes into the earth, what comes out of it, what comes down from heaven, and what ascends into it. And He is the Most Merciful, the Most Forgiving.
compare: "He knows what goes into the earth, what comes out of it, what comes down from heaven, and what ascends into it. And He is the Most Merciful, the Most Forgiving."

src: Und WIR machten sie zur Rechtleitung für die Kinder Israils.
ref: And We appointed it to be a guidance unto the Children of Is'rail.
draft: And WE made it a guidance for the Children of Israel.
hil: And WE made it a guidance for the Children of Israel.
compare: And WE made it a guidance for the Children of Israel.

src: Gibt es denn einen (anderen) Gott neben Gott? Nein, ihr seid ja Leute, die (Gott andere) gleichsetzen.
ref: Nay, but they are a people who assign to Him equals!
draft: Is there any other God besides God? No, you are people who equate (God with others).
hil: Is there any other God beside God? No, you are people who equate (God with others).
compare: Is there any other God besides God? No, you are people who equate (God with others).

src: Und gewiß, von seiner Gefolgschaft ist doch Ibrahim.
ref: And Abraham indeed was of his inducement,
draft: And surely, Ibrahim is among his followers.
hil: And indeed, Ibrahim is part of his entourage.
compare: And surely, Ibrahim is among his followers.

src: Geht also in die Häuser durch ihre Türen.
ref: Enter the house through the main gate, and obey God.
draft: So go into the houses through their doors.
hil: So go into the houses through their doors.
compare: So go into the houses through their doors.

src: dir unterliegt von der Angelegenheit nichts - oder ihnen vergibt oder sie peinigt.
ref: It is no concern of yours whether He redeems them or punishes them.
draft: There is nothing about the matter that is subject to you - either it forgives you or it torments you.
hil: There is nothing about the matter that concerns you - either it forgives you or it torments you.
compare: There is nothing about the matter that concerns you - either it forgives you or it torments you.

src: Gewiß, ALLAH vergibt die Verfehlungen - allesamt.
ref: Surely God forgives all sins.
draft: Certainly, Allah forgives the misconduct - all of them.
hil: Certainly, Allah forgives the misdeeds - all of them.
compare: Certainly, Allah forgives the misconduct - all of them.

src: Wer das tut, hat keine Gemeinschaft mit Gott, es sei denn, ihr hütet euch wirklich vor ihnen.
ref: Whoever does that has nothing to do with God, unless it is to protect your own selves against them.
draft: Whoever does that has no fellowship with God, unless you really guard yourselves against them.
hil: The one who does that has no fellowship with God unless you truly guard yourself against them.
compare: The one who does that has no fellowship with God unless you truly guard yourself against them.

src: Allah gebietet Gerechtigkeit, gütig zu sein und den Verwandten zu geben; Er verbietet das Schändliche, das Verwerfliche und die Gewalttätigkeit.
ref: Verily God has enjoined justice, the doing of good, and the giving of gifts to your relatives; and forbidden indecency, impropriety and oppression.
draft: "Allah commands justice, kindness towards relatives, forbids shameful deeds, injustice, and rebellion."
hil: Allah commands justice, kindness towards relatives, and forbids shameful deeds, injustice, and violence.
compare: Allah commands justice, kindness towards relatives, and forbids shameful deeds, injustice, and violence.

src: Und ALLAH ist allwissend über die Unrecht-Begehenden.
ref: And Allah is the Knower of he wrong-doers.
draft: And Allah is omniscient about those who commit injustice.
hil: And Allah is knowledgeable about those who commit injustice.
compare: And Allah is omniscient about those who commit injustice.

src: Sag: Was meint ihr, wenn er doch von Allah stammt und ihr ihn hierauf verleugnet?
ref: Say: "See ye if the (Revelation) is (really) from Allah, and yet do ye reject it?
draft: Say: What do you mean when he comes from Allah and you deny him?
hil: Say, what do you mean when he comes from Allah and you deny him?
compare: Say, what do you mean when he comes from Allah and you deny him?

src: ALLAH hat für sie Dschannat vorbereitet, die von Flüssen durchflossen werden. Darin werden sie ewig bleiben. Dies ist der unermeßliche Gewinn.
ref: Allah has kept ready for them Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding in it forever; this is the greatest success.
draft: "ALLAH has prepared Paradise for them, which is traversed by rivers. Therein they will remain forever. This is the immeasurable gain."
hil: God has prepared gardens with streams of running water for them, wherein they will abide forever. This is the immeasurable gain.
compare: "ALLAH has prepared Paradise for them, which is traversed by rivers. Therein they will remain forever. This is the immeasurable gain."

src: Als (der Überbringer) zu Salomo kam, sagte (dieser): "Schüttet ihr Reichtümer über mich aus?
ref: So, when the envoys came to Solomon he said: "Do you wish to increase my wealth?
draft: When (the messenger) came to Solomon, he said: "Are you pouring out your riches upon me?"
hil: When (the messenger) came to Solomon, he said: 'Are you pouring out your riches upon me?'
compare: When (the messenger) came to Solomon, he said: 'Are you pouring out your riches upon me?'

src: Gewiß, ALLAHs Androhung ist wahr. So lasst das diesseitige Leben euch nicht täuschen, und lasst keineswegs das Täuschende euch in ALLAH täuschen!
ref: Surely God's promise is true; so let not the present life delude you, and let not the Deluder delude you concerning God.
draft: Certainly, Allah's threat is true. So do not let the worldly life deceive you, and by no means let the Deceiver deceive you in Allah!
hil: Surely, Allah's threat is true. Don't let this worldly life deceive you, and by no means let the Deceiver mislead you about Allah!
compare: Surely, Allah's threat is true. Don't let this worldly life deceive you, and by no means let the Deceiver mislead you about Allah!

src: Und als ihnen Unsere Ayat verdeutlicht vorgetragen wurden, haben diejenigen, die Unsere Begegnung nicht erhoffen, gesagt: "Bringe einen Quran außer diesem oder forme ihn um!" Sag: "Mir steht es nicht zu, ihn nach meinem Gutdünken umzuformen. Ich folge nur dem, was mir an Wahy zuteil wird! Ich fürchte, sollte ich meinem HERRN widersprechen, die Peinigung eines gewaltigen Tages!"
ref: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, the people who do not expect to meet Us say, “Bring a Qur’an other than this one, or change it”; say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “I do not have the right to change it on my own; I only follow what is divinely revealed to me; if I were to disobey my Lord*, then I fear the punishment of the Great Day (of Resurrection). (* Which is impossible.)
draft: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it." Say, [O Muhammad], "It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
hil: And when Our clear verses were recited to them, those who do not expect Our meeting said, 'Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it.' Say, 'It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed, I fear if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
compare: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it." Say, [O Muhammad], "It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."

src: Und WIR erschufen den Himmel, die Erde und das, was zwischen ihnen ist, doch nicht aus sinnlosem Treiben.
ref: We have not created the heavens and the earth, and all that lies between them, out of fun.
draft: And WE created the heavens, the earth and that which is between them, but not in vain sport.
hil: And WE created the skies, the earth, and what is between them, not out of play.
compare: And WE created the heavens, the earth and that which is between them, but not in vain sport.

src: Wäre nicht zuvor ein Wort von deinem Herrn ergangen, wäre gewiß zwischen ihnen entschieden worden; aber wahrhaftig, sie befinden sich in beunruhigendem Zweifel über ihn (den Quran)
ref: If the Word of your Lord had not preceded it the matter would have been settled between them. They are still in doubt about it and uneasy.
draft: If a word had not come forth from thy Lord, their fate would have been determined between them - and already there has come to them a clear sign; but most of them do not believe.
hil: If a word had not come forth from your Lord, the matter would have been decided among them. And indeed, they are in a disturbing doubt about it (the Quran).
compare: If a word had not come forth from thy Lord, their fate would have been determined between them - and already there has come to them a clear sign; but most of them do not believe.

src: Als die Zauberer kamen, sagte Mose zu ihnen: «Werft, was ihr werfen wollt.»
ref: So when the magicians arrived, Moses said to them: "Cast whatever (spell) you have to cast."
draft: When the wizards arrived, Moses said to them: "Throw whatever you want to throw."
hil: When the magicians came, Moses said to them: 'Throw whatever you want to throw.'
compare: When the wizards arrived, Moses said to them: "Throw whatever you want to throw."

src: Hat sie nicht die Kunde von denen erreicht, die vor ihnen waren vom Volke Noahs, von `Ad und Tamud und vom Volke Abrahams und den Bewohnern Madyans und der zusammengestürzten Städte? Ihre Gesandten kamen mit deutlichen Zeichen zu ihnen. Allah also wollte ihnen kein Unrecht tun, doch sie taten sich selber Unrecht.
ref: Has not the news of those before them come to them; of the people of Nuh and Ad and Samood, and the people of Ibrahim and the dwellers of Madyan and the overthrown cities; their apostles came to them with clear arguments; so it was not Allah Who should do them injustice, but they were unjust to themselves.
draft: Has not the news reached them of those before them - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud, the people of Abraham and the companions of Midian and the towns overthrown? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would never have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.
hil: Has not the news reached them of those before them - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud, the people of Abraham and the companions of Midian and the towns overthrown? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would never have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.
compare: Has not the news reached them of those before them - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud, the people of Abraham and the companions of Midian and the towns overthrown? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would never have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.

src: Sie haben ja kein Wissen darüber. Sie stellen nur Schätzungen an.
ref: They do not know its truth at all; they only make guesses.
draft: You don't have any knowledge about it. You are just making guesses.
hil: They do not have any knowledge about it. They are just making guesses.
compare: You don't have any knowledge about it. You are just making guesses.

src: Mir wird offenbart, daß euer Gott ein Einziger Gott ist; so seid aufrichtig gegen Ihn und bittet Ihn um Vergebung." Und wehe den Götzendienern
ref: To me it has been revealed that your God is One God; so go straight with Him, and ask for His forgiveness; and woe to the idolaters
draft: "I am being revealed that your God is the only God; so be sincere towards Him and ask Him for forgiveness." And woe to the idolaters.
hil: "I am being revealed that your God is the only God; so be sincere towards Him and ask Him for forgiveness." And woe to the idolaters.
compare: "I am being revealed that your God is the only God; so be sincere towards Him and ask Him for forgiveness." And woe to the idolaters.

src: Er warf die Tafeln hin und ergriff seinen Bruder beim Kopf, indem er ihn an sich zog.
ref: And he cast aside the tablets, and pulled his brother by the hair.
draft: He threw the tablets and took hold of his brother's head, pulling him towards himself.
hil: He threw the tablets and took hold of his brother's head, pulling him towards himself.
compare: He threw the tablets and took hold of his brother's head, pulling him towards himself.

src: Allahs Gesandter sagte zu ihnen: "(Achtet auf) Allahs Kamelstute und ihre Trinkzeit."
ref: And the apostle of God had to tell them: "This is God's she-camel, let her drink."
draft: "Allah's messenger said to them: "(Pay attention to) Allah's she-camel and her drinking time.""
hil: Allah's messenger said to them, 'Pay attention to Allah's she-camel and her drinking time.'
compare: "Allah's messenger said to them: "(Pay attention to) Allah's she-camel and her drinking time.""

src: Und so haben Wir euch zu einer Gemeinschaft der Mitte gemacht, damit ihr Zeugen über die (anderen) Menschen seiet und damit der Gesandte über euch Zeuge sei. Wir hatten die Gebetsrichtung, die du einhieltest, nur bestimmt, um zu wissen, wer dem Gesandten folgt und wer sich auf den Fersen umkehrt.
ref: Thus, have We made of you an Ummat justly balanced, that ye might be witnesses over the nations, and the Messenger a witness over yourselves; and We appointed the Qibla to which thou wast used, only to test those who followed the Messenger from those who would turn on their heels (From the Faith).
draft: And thus We have made you a just community that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except that We might make evident who would follow the Messenger from who would turn back on his heels.
hil: And thus we have made you a midmost community that you may be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not appoint the direction which you were facing except to know who followed the Messenger from who turned back on his heels; and this was truly difficult, except for those whom God has guided. And God would never leave your faith to waste; truly, God is all-gentle with the people, all-compassionate.
compare: And thus We have made you a just community that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except that We might make evident who would follow the Messenger from who would turn back on his heels.

src: Nein! Vielmehr sind sie lebendig; aber ihr nehmt es nicht wahr.
ref: In fact, they are alive but you do not perceive that life.
draft: No! Rather they are alive; but you don't perceive it.
hil: No, rather they are alive, but you don't perceive it.
compare: No, rather they are alive, but you don't perceive it.

src: Sag: Jeder handelt nach seiner Weise.
ref: Say, “Each does according to his disposition.
draft: Say: Everyone acts according to their own way.
hil: Say, 'Each one acts according to their own way.'
compare: Say, 'Each one acts according to their own way.'

src: Und des Abraham, der (seine Pflichten) erfüllte?
ref: And of Abraham who fulfilled his trust? --
draft: And what of Abraham, who fulfilled his duties?
hil: And what of Abraham, who fulfilled his duties?
compare: And what of Abraham, who fulfilled his duties?

src: Gewiß, diejenigen, denen ihr anstelle von ALLAH dient, haben für euch kein Rizq, so strebt das Rizq bei ALLAH an, dient Ihm und erweist euch Ihm gegenüber dankbar!
ref: Surely those you worship other than God have no power over your means of livelihood. So seek your sustenance from God, and worship Him and give Him thanks.
draft: Certainly, those whom you worship besides Allah have no provision for you, so seek your provision from Allah, worship Him and be grateful to Him.
hil: Certainly, those whom you worship instead of Allah have no provision for you, so seek your provision from Allah, worship Him and be grateful to Him.
compare: Certainly, those whom you worship besides Allah have no provision for you, so seek your provision from Allah, worship Him and be grateful to Him.

src: Doch wahrlich, er (Jesus) ist ein Vorzeichen der Stunde. So bezweifelt sie nicht, sondern folgt Mir. Das ist ein gerader Weg.
ref: And indeed Eisa is a sign* of the Last Day, therefore do not ever doubt in the Last Day, and obey Me**; this is the Straight Path. (* The advent of Prophet Eisa to earth for the second time. ** By obeying the Noble Messenger.)
draft: But verily, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour. So do not doubt, but follow me.
hil: Verily, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour. So do not doubt, but follow me. This is a straight path.
compare: But verily, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour. So do not doubt, but follow me.

src: (Es gibt) keine Zuflucht.
ref: There is no refuge!
draft: No refuge.
hil: There is no refuge.
compare: There is no refuge.

src: Darin sind wahrlich Zeichen für die Betrachtenden.
ref: Herein are really signs for those who discern.
draft: There are truly signs in it for those who reflect.
hil: Verily, in it are signs for those who reflect.
compare: There are truly signs in it for those who reflect.

src: Die Frau Fir'auns sagte: "(Er wird) für mich und dich ein Grund zur Freude sein. Tötet ihn nicht. Vielleicht nützt er uns oder wir nehmen ihn als Kind an." Dabei merkten sie nicht (, was sie taten).
ref: And the wife of Fir'awn said: a comfort unto me and thee slay him not; belike he shall be of benefit to us or we might like him for a son; and they perceived not.
draft: The woman of Pharaoh said, "He will be a joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Perhaps he will benefit us, or we will adopt him as a child." They did not realize what they were doing.
hil: The wife of Pharaoh said, 'He will be a joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Perhaps he will benefit us, or we will adopt him as a child.' They did not realize what they were doing.
compare: The woman of Pharaoh said, "He will be a joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Perhaps he will benefit us, or we will adopt him as a child." They did not realize what they were doing.

src: An ihnen habt ihr sonst allerlei Nutzen.
ref: You may also obtain other benefits from them.
draft: You otherwise have various benefits from them.
hil: You have all kinds of benefits from them otherwise.
compare: You have all kinds of benefits from them otherwise.

src: Ihr sollt Gott allein dienen. Ich fürchte für euch die Pein eines schmerzvollen Tages.»
ref: Do not worship anyone but God; for I fear the punishment of a dreadful day for you."
draft: "You shall serve God alone. I fear for you the agony of a painful day."
hil: You should serve God alone. I fear for you the torment of a painful day.
compare: You should serve God alone. I fear for you the torment of a painful day.

src: Seid nicht wie diejenigen, die Kufr betrieben haben und zu ihren Brüdern sagten, als diese sich auf Handelsreisen oder Feldzügen befanden: "Wären sie bei uns geblieben, wären sie weder gestorben, noch getötet worden." (Sagt es nicht), damit ALLAH dies als Bitterkeit (nur) in ihren Herzen bleiben läßt.
ref: Be not like those who disbelieve (hypocrites) and who say to their brethren when they travel through the earth or go out to fight: "If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed," so that Allah may make it a cause of regret in their hearts.
draft: Do not be like those who committed Kufr and said to their brothers when they were on trade expeditions or military campaigns, "If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say this) so that Allah may leave this as bitterness (only) in their hearts.
hil: Do not be like those who committed Kufr and said to their brothers when they were on trade expeditions or military campaigns, "If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say this) so that Allah may leave this as bitterness (only) in their hearts.
compare: Do not be like those who committed Kufr and said to their brothers when they were on trade expeditions or military campaigns, "If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say this) so that Allah may leave this as bitterness (only) in their hearts.

src: Und Er hat euch in der Religion keine Bedrängnis auferlegt; so ist die Glaubensrichtung eures Vaters Abraham. Er hat euch Muslime genannt, früher und (nunmehr) in diesem (Buch), auf daß der Gesandte Zeuge über euch sei und ihr Zeugen über die Menschen seid.
ref: He has chosen you (to convey His Message of Islamic Monotheism to mankind by inviting them to His religion, Islam), and has not laid upon you in religion any hardship, it is the religion of your father Ibrahim (Abraham) (Islamic Monotheism).
draft: And He has not laid upon you in religion any hardship; [it is] the faith of your father, Abraham. Allah named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people.
hil: And He did not impose upon you any difficulty in religion. [It is] the faith of your father, Abraham. Allah named you Muslims before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation], that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people.
compare: And He has not laid upon you in religion any hardship; [it is] the faith of your father, Abraham. Allah named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people.

src: Sag: Wollt ihr denn Allah kundtun, was Er nicht kennt, weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde? Preis sei Ihm!
ref: You inform Allah of something which in His knowledge does not exist in the heavens or in the earth?” Purity and Supremacy are to Him, above their association. (* Some things like the sun, stars, trees are useful but they too are created by Allah.
draft: Say: Do you want to inform Allah of what He knows not in the heavens or on the earth? Exalted is He!
hil: Say: Do you want to inform Allah of what He knows not in the heavens or on the earth? Exalted is He!
compare: Say: Do you want to inform Allah of what He knows not in the heavens or on the earth? Exalted is He!

src: Habe Ich euch, ihr Kinder Adams, nicht geboten, nicht Satan zu dienen - denn er ist euer offenkundiger Feind -
ref: Did I not commit you, O children of Adam, not to worship Satan who is your acknowledged foe,
draft: Have I not commanded you, O children of Adam, not to serve Satan - for he is your manifest enemy?
hil: Have I not commanded you, O children of Adam, not to serve Satan - for he is your clear enemy?
compare: Have I not commanded you, O children of Adam, not to serve Satan - for he is your manifest enemy?

src: Was aber diejenigen angeht, die ungläubig sind, so sagen sie: "Was will denn Allah damit als Gleichnis?" Er läßt damit viele in die Irre gehen und leitet viele damit recht, doch läßt Er damit nur die Frevler in die Irre gehen,
ref: He misleads many thereby, and He guides many thereby; and with it He misleads only those who are rebellious.
draft: As for those who disbelieve, they say, "What does Allah intend by this as an example?" He misleads many thereby and guides many thereby. And He misleads not except the defiantly disobedient,
hil: As for those who disbelieve, they say, "What does Allah intend by this as an example?" He misleads many thereby and guides many thereby. And He misleads not except the defiantly disobedient.
compare: As for those who disbelieve, they say, "What does Allah intend by this as an example?" He misleads many thereby and guides many thereby. And He misleads not except the defiantly disobedient,

src: Und als ihm Unsere Ayat vorgetragen wurden, kehrte er den Rücken in Arroganz um, als ob er sie nicht hörte, als ob in seinen Ohren Schwerhörigkeit wäre.
ref: When Our verses are recited before them they turn away haughtily as though they did not hear them, as if a deafness had come into their ears.
draft: And when Our verses were recited to him, he turned away in arrogance as if he had not heard them, as if there was deafness in his ears.
hil: He turned away haughtily as if he did not hear them when Our verses were recited to him, as if there was deafness in his ears.
compare: And when Our verses were recited to him, he turned away in arrogance as if he had not heard them, as if there was deafness in his ears.

src: Tragen werden sie aber nichts von ihren Verfehlungen, denn sie sind fürwahr Lügner.
ref: Surely, they are liars.
draft: They will not bear anything for their misdeeds, for they are truly liars.
hil: They will not bear anything for their misdeeds, for they are truly liars.
compare: They will not bear anything for their misdeeds, for they are truly liars.

src: Aber ihr liebt die nicht, die gut raten.»
ref: (The people in the graves can hear the speech of those who are on earth.)
draft: "But you do not love those who give good advice."
hil: But you do not love those who give good advice.
compare: "But you do not love those who give good advice."

src: Bereits war es eine Aya für euch in zwei Gruppierungen, die aufeinander trafen, eine Gruppe kämpfte fi-sabilillah, und eine andere war kufr-betreibend. (Die Mumin) sahen sie augenscheinlich in doppelter Anzahl.
ref: There was a token for you in the two armies which clashed (in the battle of Badr), one fighting for God, the other of unbelievers who saw with their own eyes the faithful to be two times as many as they, for God reinforces with His help whomsoever He will.
draft: Already there was an occasion for you in two groups that encountered each other, one group fought for the sake of Allah, and the other was disbelieving. (The believers) saw them visibly double in number.
hil: Indeed there was a sign for you in the two groups that clashed; one army fighting in Allah's cause, against the other of disbelievers, whom they saw with their eyes as twice their own number; and Allah strengthens with His help whomever He wills; indeed in this is a lesson for the intelligent, to be learnt by observing.
compare: Indeed there was a sign for you in the two groups that clashed; one army fighting in Allah's cause, against the other of disbelievers, whom they saw with their eyes as twice their own number; and Allah strengthens with His help whomever He wills; indeed in this is a lesson for the intelligent, to be learnt by observing.

src: Was ist mit euch, daß ihr Allah nicht (in der Ihm gebührenden Weise) ehrt
ref: What has come upon you that you do not fear the majesty of God,
draft: What's wrong with you that you don't honor Allah (in the way He deserves)?
hil: What is wrong with you that you do not honor Allah (in the way He deserves)?
compare: What's wrong with you that you don't honor Allah (in the way He deserves)?

src: Der Satan droht euch Armut an und befiehlt euch Schändliches. Gott verheißt euch Vergebung von seiner Seite und Huld. Gott umfaßt und weiß alles.
ref: The devil scares you of poverty and bids you to the shameful; and Allah promises you forgiveness from Him, and munificence; and Allah is Most Capable, All Knowing.
draft: Satan threatens you with poverty and commands you to do shameful deeds. God promises you forgiveness from His side and grace. God encompasses and knows everything.
hil: "Allah threatens you with poverty and commands you to do shameful deeds. God promises you forgiveness from His side and grace. God encompasses and knows everything."
compare: Satan threatens you with poverty and commands you to do shameful deeds. God promises you forgiveness from His side and grace. God encompasses and knows everything.

src: Beinahe werde ICH sie enthüllen, damit jeder Seele nach ihrem Bestreben vergolten wird.
ref: I keep it secret that every soul may be rewarded for its endeavour.
draft: Almost I will reveal them, so that every soul will be rewarded according to its desires.
hil: Almost I will reveal them, so that every soul will be rewarded according to its desires.
compare: Almost I will reveal them, so that every soul will be rewarded according to its desires.

src: Und (Wir sandten) zu Madyan ihren Bruder Shuayb.
ref: Remember, We sent to Midian their brother Shu'aib.
draft: And (We sent) their brother Shuayb to Midian.
hil: And unto Midian, We sent their brother Shu'ayb.
compare: And (We sent) their brother Shuayb to Midian.

src: Mache Da"wa zum Weg deines HERRN mit Weisheit und schöner Ermahnung, und disputiere mit ihnen auf die beste Art. Gewiß, dein HERR ist es, der Wissen darüber hat, wer von Seinem Weg abgekommen ist.
ref: Call them unto the way of thy Lord with Wisdom and goodly exhortation, and argue with them with that which is best. Verily thy Lord!
draft: "Make Da'wah to the path of your LORD with wisdom and beautiful advice, and debate with them in the best way. Surely, your LORD is the One who knows best who has strayed from His path."
hil: Make Da'wah to the path of your LORD with wisdom and beautiful advice, and debate with them in the best way. Surely, your LORD is the One who knows best who has strayed from His path.
compare: "Make Da'wah to the path of your LORD with wisdom and beautiful advice, and debate with them in the best way. Surely, your LORD is the One who knows best who has strayed from His path."

src: Weiß er denn nicht?
ref: So does he not know?
draft: Does he not know?
hil: Does he not know?
compare: Does he not know?

src: Und Wir haben einige der Propheten vor den anderen bevorzugt. Und Wir haben David eine Schrift zukommen lassen.
ref: We exalted some of the prophets over the others; and to David We gave the Book of Psalms.
draft: And We have preferred some of the prophets over others. And We have sent down to David a scripture.
hil: We have exalted some of the prophets over others. And We have given David a scripture.
compare: And We have preferred some of the prophets over others. And We have sent down to David a scripture.

src: Würden sie doch, wenn sie euch besiegten, weder Bindungen noch Verpflichtungen euch gegenüber einhalten! Sie würden euch mit dem Munde gefällig sein, indes ihre Herzen sich weigerten; und die meisten von ihnen sind Frevler.
ref: If they get the better of you, they will not observe towards you any bond or treaty, giving you satisfaction with their mouths but in their hearts refusing; and the most of them are ungodly.
draft: If they were to defeat you, they would not keep any ties or obligations towards you! They would be pleasing to you with their mouths while their hearts refused; and most of them are wicked.
hil: If they were to defeat you, they wouldn't keep any ties or obligations towards you! They would be pleasing to you with their mouths while their hearts refused; and most of them are wicked.
compare: If they were to defeat you, they would not keep any ties or obligations towards you! They would be pleasing to you with their mouths while their hearts refused; and most of them are wicked.

src: (Sie sind) verflucht. Wo immer sie (im Kampf) angetroffen werden, werden sie ergriffen und allesamt getötet.
ref: Accursed, they would be seized wherever found, and slain mercilessly.
draft: (Cursed are) They are cursed. Wherever they are encountered (in battle), they are captured and all killed.
hil: They are cursed. Wherever they are encountered (in battle), they are captured and all killed.
compare: (Cursed are) They are cursed. Wherever they are encountered (in battle), they are captured and all killed.

src: Und es hielt Uns nichts zurück, Gesandte mit den Ayat zu entsenden, außer daß die Früheren sie als Lüge erklärten. Und WIR ließen Thamud das Kamelweibchen als Erläuterung zuteil werden, so begingen sie mit ihm Unrecht.
ref: Naught prevented Us from sending the signs but that the ancients cried lies to them; and We brought Thamood the She-camel visible, but they did her wrong.
draft: And nothing held Us back from sending messengers with clear proofs, except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they did her wrong.
hil: And nothing prevented Us from sending messengers with clear proofs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they did wrong by her.
compare: And nothing held Us back from sending messengers with clear proofs, except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they did her wrong.

src: Vielmehr hat Allah ihn zu Sich erhoben. Allah ist Allmächtig und Allweise.
ref: Allah took him up to Himself; and Allah is Mighty, Wise.
draft: Rather, Allah has exalted him to Himself. Allah is Almigty and All-wise.
hil: Allah has raised him up (in position) and closer to Himself. Allah is all-mighty and all-wise.
compare: Rather, Allah has exalted him to Himself. Allah is Almigty and All-wise.

src: (Von ihnen) sagen wir uns vor Dir los.
ref: We led them astray, as we were astray ourselves. We declare our innocence (from them) before You.
draft: We say goodbye to you in front of you.
hil: We say goodbye to you in front of you.
compare: We say goodbye to you in front of you.

src: Nicht Wir taten ihnen Unrecht, sondern sie taten sich selber Unrecht an; und ihre Götter, die sie statt Allah anriefen, nützten ihnen überhaupt nichts, als der Befehl deines Herrn eintraf; sie stürzten sie nur noch mehr ins Verderben.
ref: We did not wrong them; they wronged themselves. When your Lord's chastisement descended upon them, their gods, on whom they called apart from God, were not of the least avail, and all they did was only to add to their destruction.
draft: We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves; and their gods, whom they invoked besides Allah, benefitted them not at all, when the command of thy Lord came to pass; they only increased their ruin.
hil: We did not wrong them, but they did wrong to themselves, and their gods, whom they invoked besides Allah, brought them no benefit at all, when the command of your Lord came, they only increased their ruin.
compare: We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves; and their gods, whom they invoked besides Allah, benefitted them not at all, when the command of thy Lord came to pass; they only increased their ruin.

src: Wahrlich, Allah hat Macht über alle Dinge.
ref: Indeed God has power over everything.
draft: Truly, Allah has power over all things.
hil: Truly, Allah has power over all things.
compare: Truly, Allah has power over all things.

src: Und es dann zu grauer Spreu macht.
ref: Then reduces them to rusty rubbish.
draft: And then turns it into gray chaff.
hil: And turns it into gray chaff.
compare: And turns it into gray chaff.

src: Ihr werdet doch, inscha-allah, Almasdschidil-haram betreten, sicher mit rasierten Häuptern oder mit kurzgeschnittenen (Haaren).
ref: If Allah so wills you shall certainly enter the Inviolable Mosque, in full security, you will shave your heads and cut your hair short, and do so without any fear.
draft: You will surely, God willing, enter the Masjid al-Haram, with shaved heads or with short-cut hair.
hil: You will surely, God willing, enter the Masjid al-Haram, with shaved heads or with short-cut hair.
compare: You will surely, God willing, enter the Masjid al-Haram, with shaved heads or with short-cut hair.

src: Diese werden freigesprochen von dem, was man (über sie) redet.
ref: Those are acquitted of what they say.
draft: They are acquitted of what is being said (about them).
hil: They are absolved from what is said about them.
compare: They are absolved from what is said about them.

src: Und wenn das Wort über sie fällig wird, bringen Wir ihnen ein Tier aus der Erde hervor, das zu ihnen spricht; (dies), weil die Menschen von Unseren Zeichen nicht überzeugt sind.
ref: When the sentence will have been passed against them, We shall bring forth beastly brutes from the earth who will torment them, for men certainly do not believe Our signs.
draft: And when the word is fulfilled upon them, We will bring forth for them a beast from the earth speaking to them, [saying] that the people were, of Our verses, not certain.
hil: When the word is fulfilled upon them, We will bring forth for them a beast from the earth speaking to them, [saying] that the people were, of Our verses, not certain.
compare: And when the word is fulfilled upon them, We will bring forth for them a beast from the earth speaking to them, [saying] that the people were, of Our verses, not certain.

src: Und ich bin nicht Diener Dessen, was ihr gedient habt,
ref: Nor will I worship what you worship,
draft: And I am not a servant of that which you have served.
hil: And I am not a servant of that which you have served.
compare: And I am not a servant of that which you have served.

src: ALLAH hat für sie Dschannat vorbereitet, die von Flüssen durchflossen werden.
ref: Allah has prepared for them Gardens beneath which rivers flow.
draft: ALLAH has prepared Jannah for them, which is flowed by rivers.
hil: "God has provision for them of gardens with streams of running water, where they will abide ever."
compare: "God has provision for them of gardens with streams of running water, where they will abide ever."

src: Bei dem Morgen
ref: I CALL TO witness the early hours of morning,
draft: "At the morning".
hil: "In the morning".
compare: "In the morning".

src: Aber die Antwort seines Volkes war nur, daß sie sagten: "Tötet ihn oder verbrennt ihn." Da rettete Allah ihn aus dem Feuer.
ref: The people (of Abraham) had no answer except: "Kill him or burn him;" but God saved him from the fire.
draft: But the response of his people was only that they said, "Kill him or burn him." So Allah saved him from the fire.
hil: But the response of his people was only that they said, "Kill him or burn him." So Allah saved him from the fire.
compare: But the response of his people was only that they said, "Kill him or burn him." So Allah saved him from the fire.

src: Und ein Zauberer soll keinen Erfolg haben, woher er auch kommen mag."
ref: That which they have made is only a magician's trick, and the magician will never be successful, no matter whatever amount (of skill) he may attain."
draft: "And a wizard shall have no success, no matter where he comes from."
hil: And no wizard shall have success, no matter where he comes from.
compare: "And a wizard shall have no success, no matter where he comes from."

src: Vortreffliche, die (alles) aufschreiben,
ref: Illustrious scribes
draft: Excellent people who write (everything) down,
hil: Excellent people who write (everything) down,
compare: Excellent people who write (everything) down,

src: Er sagte: "Es (die Schätze) wurde mir nur um des Wissens willen, das ich besitze, gegeben."
ref: He said: "This has come to me through my own acumen."
draft: He said, "It (the treasures) was only given to me for the sake of the knowledge I possess."
hil: He said, "It (the treasures) was only given to me for the sake of the knowledge I possess."
compare: He said, "It (the treasures) was only given to me for the sake of the knowledge I possess."

src: Das Verschieben (eines Haram-Monats) ist eine Steigerung von Kufr. Damit werden diejenigen irregeleitet, die Kufr betrieben haben. Sie erklären ihn in einem Jahr für einen Nicht-Haram-Monat und in einem anderen Jahr für einen Haram-Monat, um der Anzahl der von ALLAH festgelegten Haram-Monate zu entsprechen und dann für halal zu erklären, was ALLAH für haram erklärte. Ihnen wurde das Schlechte ihrer Handlungen als schön dargeboten. ALLAH leitet die Kafir-Leute nicht recht.
ref: Their postponing of the months is nothing but furtherance in disbelief – the disbelievers are misled by it – they decree it lawful in one year and regard it forbidden in another year, in order to equate to the number of the months which Allah has made sacred, and to make lawful what Allah has forbidden; their evil deeds seem good in their sight; and Allah does not guide the disbelievers.
draft: The postponement (of a Haram month) is an increase in Kufr. This misleads those who have committed Kufr. They declare it as a non-Haram month in one year and as a Haram month in another year, in order to correspond to the number of Haram months set by ALLAH and then to declare as halal what ALLAH declared as haram. The evil of their deeds was presented to them as beautiful. ALLAH does not guide the disbelieving people correctly.
hil: The postponement (of a Haram month) is an increase in Kufr. This misleads those who have committed Kufr. They declare it as a non-Haram month in one year and as a Haram month in another year in order to correspond to the number of Haram months set by ALLAH and then to declare as halal what ALLAH declared as haram. The evil of their deeds was presented to them as beautiful. ALLAH does not guide the disbelieving people correctly.
compare: The postponement (of a Haram month) is an increase in Kufr. This misleads those who have committed Kufr. They declare it as a non-Haram month in one year and as a Haram month in another year, in order to correspond to the number of Haram months set by ALLAH and then to declare as halal what ALLAH declared as haram. The evil of their deeds was presented to them as beautiful. ALLAH does not guide the disbelieving people correctly.

src: Er sprach: "O mein Volk, (ihr) seht nicht ein, daß ich einen klaren Beweis von meinem Herrn habe; und Er hat mir Seine Barmherzigkeit gewährt, die euch aber verborgen geblieben ist.
ref: He said: "O my people! Tell me, if I have a clear proof from my Lord, and a Mercy (Prophethood, etc.) has come to me from Him, but that (Mercy) has been obscured from your sight.
draft: He said: "O my people, you do not realize that I have a clear proof from my Lord, and He has granted me His mercy, which has been hidden from you.
hil: He said, "O my people, do you not realize that I have a clear proof from my Lord, and He has bestowed His mercy upon me, which is hidden from you."
compare: He said, "O my people, do you not realize that I have a clear proof from my Lord, and He has bestowed His mercy upon me, which is hidden from you."

src: Gewiß, WIR entsandten dich mit der Wahrheit als Überbringer froher Botschaft und als Warner.
ref: We have sent you with the truth, to give glad tidings and to warn.
draft: Certainly, WE sent you as a bearer of good news and a warner with the truth.
hil: Verily, We have sent you with the truth as a giver of good news and a Warner. And in every community, there is a herald of warning.
compare: Verily, We have sent you with the truth as a giver of good news and a Warner. And in every community, there is a herald of warning.

src: Selbst wenn ich zu meinem Herrn zurückgebracht werde, so werde ich ganz gewiß einen besseren Aufenthalt als diesen finden."
ref: And even if I am returned to my Lord, I will find something better than this in return.”
draft: "Even if I am brought back to my Lord, I will surely find a better dwelling than this one."
hil: Even if I am brought back to my Lord, I will surely find a better dwelling than this one.
compare: "Even if I am brought back to my Lord, I will surely find a better dwelling than this one."

src: Und Allahs ist, was in den Himmeln und was auf der Erde ist; Er verzeiht, wem Er will, und straft, wen Er will, und Allah ist Allverzeihend und Barmherzig.
ref: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth: He may pardon whom He please and punish whom He will. Yet God is forgiving and kind.
draft: "And Allah's is whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills, and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
hil: To God belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills, and punishes whom He wills, and God is Forgiving and Merciful.
compare: "And Allah's is whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills, and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."

src: Dabei hatten sie sich vorher Gott gegenüber verpflichtet, sie würden nicht den Rücken kehren. Über die Verpflichtung Gott gegenüber wird Rechenschaft gefordert.
ref: Whereas earlier they had made a promise to God that they would never turn their backs; and a promise made to God is answerable.
draft: They had previously pledged themselves to God not to turn their backs. Accountability is demanded for the commitment to God.
hil: They had previously pledged themselves to God not to turn their backs. Accountability is demanded for the commitment to God.
compare: They had previously pledged themselves to God not to turn their backs. Accountability is demanded for the commitment to God.

src: Bereits haben sie doch Musa um Größeres als dieses gebeten, sie sagten: "Zeige uns ALLAH offenkundig!" Dann erschlug sie der Blitz wegen ihrer Übertretung, dann nahmen sie sich das Kalb (als Götzen), nachdem zu ihnen die deutlichen Zeichen gekommen waren, dann haben WIR ihnen dies vergeben und ließen Musa einen eindeutigen Beweis zuteil werden.
ref: Of Moses they asked greater than that, they said to him: 'Show us Allah openly' And a thunderbolt took them for their evil doing. Then they took to themselves the calf, after the clear proofs had come to them, yet We forgave that and We gave Moses clear authority.
draft: Already they have asked Musa for something greater than this, they said: "Show us ALLAH manifestly!" Then the lightning struck them because of their transgression, then they took the calf (as an idol), after the clear signs had come to them, then WE forgave them for this and made Musa receive a clear proof.
hil: Already they have asked Musa for something greater than this, they said: "Show us ALLAH manifestly!" Then the lightning struck them because of their transgression, then they took the calf (as an idol), after the clear signs had come to them, then WE forgave them for this and made Musa receive a clear proof.
compare: Already they have asked Musa for something greater than this, they said: "Show us ALLAH manifestly!" Then the lightning struck them because of their transgression, then they took the calf (as an idol), after the clear signs had come to them, then WE forgave them for this and made Musa receive a clear proof.

src: Und so erweckten Wir sie auf, damit sie sich gegenseitig fragten.
ref: Even so We roused them that they may question one another.
draft: And so we awakened them so that they could ask each other.
hil: And thus We awakened them so that they asked each other.
compare: And thus We awakened them so that they asked each other.

src: Was ist Al-Haqqa?
ref: What is the concrete reality?
draft: What is Al-Haqqa?
hil: What is Al-Haqqa?
compare: What is Al-Haqqa?

src: ER sagte: "In Kürze werden sie es doch noch bereuen."
ref: Answered (the Lord): "They shall wake up repenting soon."
draft: He said, "Soon they will regret it."
hil: He said, "Soon they will regret it."
compare: He said, "Soon they will regret it."

src: Und wenn ein Teil von euch an das glauben sollte, womit ich gesandt worden bin, ein anderer Teil aber nicht glauben sollte, so geduldet euch, bis Allah zwischen uns richtet. Er ist der Beste derer, die richten."
ref: If some of you believe what has been sent through me, and some of you do not, have patience until God decide between us, for He is the best of all judges."
draft: "And if a part of you should believe in what I have been sent with and another part should not believe, then wait patiently until Allah judges between us. He is the Best of judges."
hil: And if some of you should believe in what I have been sent with, and others might disbelieve, then be patient until Allah judges between us. He is the Best of judges.
compare: "And if a part of you should believe in what I have been sent with and another part should not believe, then wait patiently until Allah judges between us. He is the Best of judges."

src: Verkündet ihr mir daß ich auferstehen soll, obwohl schon vor mir Geschlechter dahingegangen sind?" und (der ihnen, wenn) sie beide Allah zu Hilfe rufen (und zu ihm sagen): "Wehe dir, glaube!
ref: You promise me that I will be raised again whereas generations have passed away before me?” And they both seek Allah’s help and say to him, “May you be ruined, accept faith!
draft: "Are you announcing to me that I should rise, although generations have passed away before me?" and (to whom) if they both call Allah for help (and say:) "Woe unto you, believe!
hil: "Are you announcing to me that I should rise, although generations have passed away before me?" And (to whom) if they both call Allah for help (and say): "Woe unto you, believe!
compare: "Are you announcing to me that I should rise, although generations have passed away before me?" and (to whom) if they both call Allah for help (and say:) "Woe unto you, believe!

src: Es gibt für den Blinden keinen Grund zur Bedrängnis, es gibt für den Hinkenden keinen Grund zur Bedrängnis, es gibt für den Kranken keinen Grund zur Bedrängnis, sowie auch für euch nicht, in euren (eigenen) Häusern zu essen oder in den Häusern eurer Väter, den Häusern eurer Mütter, den Häusern eurer Brüder, den Häusern eurer Schwestern, den Häusern eurer Onkel väterlicherseits, den Häusern eurer Tanten väterlicherseits, den Häusern eurer Onkel mütterlicherseits, den Häusern eurer Tanten mütterlicherseits, (in einem Haus,) dessen Schlüssel ihr besitzt, oder (im Haus) eures Freundes.
ref: No restriction is there upon the blind, nor is there the restriction upon a lame, nor is there a restriction upon the sick. nor upon yourselves that ye eat in your houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your fathers brothers or the houses of your fathers sisters or the houses of your mothers brothers or the houses of your mothers sisters or from that house where of ye own the keys or from the house of a friend.
draft: For the blind there is no reason for distress, for the lame there is no reason for distress, for the sick there is no reason for distress, and also not for you to eat in your own homes or in the homes of your fathers, the homes of your mothers, the homes of your brothers, the homes of your sisters, the homes of your paternal uncles, the homes of your paternal aunts, the homes of your maternal uncles, the homes of your maternal aunts, (in a house) whose key you possess, or (in the house) of your friend.
hil: There is no reason for distress for the blind, there is no reason for distress for the lame, there is no reason for distress for the sick, and also not for you to eat in your own homes or in the homes of your fathers, the homes of your mothers, the homes of your brothers, the homes of your sisters, the homes of your paternal uncles, the homes of your paternal aunts, the homes of your maternal uncles, the homes of your maternal aunts, (in a house) whose key you possess, or (in the house) of your friend.
compare: For the blind there is no reason for distress, for the lame there is no reason for distress, for the sick there is no reason for distress, and also not for you to eat in your own homes or in the homes of your fathers, the homes of your mothers, the homes of your brothers, the homes of your sisters, the homes of your paternal uncles, the homes of your paternal aunts, the homes of your maternal uncles, the homes of your maternal aunts, (in a house) whose key you possess, or (in the house) of your friend.

src: Gewiß, WIR sandten dir die Schrift für die Menschen der Wahrheit gemäß hinab. Wer also Rechtleitung findet, (tut es allein) für sich selbst, und wer irregeht, (tut es ausschließlich) gegen sich selbst. Und du bist über sie kein Wakil.
ref: We have indeed sent down this Book to you with the truth, in order to guide mankind; so whoever attains guidance has attained it is for his own good, and whoever strays, has strayed for his own harm; and you are not at all responsible for them.
draft: Certainly, WE have sent down the Scripture to you in truth for mankind. So whoever is guided is (guided) for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager over them.
hil: Certainly, WE have sent down the Scripture to you in truth for mankind. So whoever is guided is (guided) for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager over them.
compare: Certainly, WE have sent down the Scripture to you in truth for mankind. So whoever is guided is (guided) for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager over them.

src: Doch wenn sie sich abkehren, so wisse, daß Allah sie für einen Teil ihrer Sünden treffen will. Viele von den Menschen sind fürwahr Frevler.
ref: If they turn away, then know that God is sure to punish them for some of their sins; and many of them are transgressors.
draft: But if they turn away, know that Allah intends to punish them for some of their sins. Many people are indeed transgressors.
hil: But if they turn away, know that Allah intends to punish them for some of their sins. Many people are indeed transgressors.
compare: But if they turn away, know that Allah intends to punish them for some of their sins. Many people are indeed transgressors.

src: Darin lag wahrhaftig eine schwere Prüfung von eurem HERRN!
ref: In this was a great trial from your Lord."
draft: Surely, therein lay a severe trial from your LORD!
hil: Surely, therein lay a severe trial from your LORD!
compare: Surely, therein lay a severe trial from your LORD!

src: Dein Herr ist schnell im Bestrafen, und Er ist voller Vergebung und barmherzig.
ref: Indeed your Lord's retribution is swift, yet He is forgiving and kind.
draft: Your Lord is quick in punishment, and He is full of forgiveness and mercy.
hil: Your Lord is quick in punishment, and He is full of forgiveness and mercy.
compare: Your Lord is quick in punishment, and He is full of forgiveness and mercy.

src: Hätte es doch aus den Generationen vor euch manche gegeben, die einsichtig waren, welche Verderben auf Erden verboten! Ausgenommen davon sind die Wenigen aus denen, die WIR erretteten.
ref: If only there had been men endued with virtue in the ages before you, who could preserve men from doing evil in the world, other than the few We saved from among them.
draft: If only there had been some from the generations before you who were insightful about which destructions were prohibited on Earth! The few from whom WE saved are exempt from this.
hil: If only there had been some from the generations before you who were insightful about which destructions were prohibited on Earth! The few from whom WE saved are exempt from this.
compare: If only there had been some from the generations before you who were insightful about which destructions were prohibited on Earth! The few from whom WE saved are exempt from this.

src: Und Allah gehört die Herrschaft der Himmel und der Erde und dessen, was dazwischen ist, und zu Ihm ist der Ausgang.
ref: For to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is between them; to Him is the homecoming.
draft: "And Allah's is the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and that which is between them, and to Him is the [final] destination."
hil: And Allah's is the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and that which is between them, and unto Him is the destination.
compare: "And Allah's is the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and that which is between them, and to Him is the [final] destination."

src: Wenn sie es aber aus der Nähe sehen, dann werden die Gesichter derer, die ungläubig sind, schlimm betroffen. Und es wird gesprochen: «Das ist das, was ihr herbeizurufen suchtet.»
ref: So when they will see it close, the faces of the disbelievers will become ghastly, and it will be declared, “This is what you were demanding.”
draft: If they see it up close, then the faces of those who are unbelievers will be greatly affected. And it will be said, "This is what you sought to bring about."
hil: If they see it up close, then the faces of those who are unbelievers will be greatly affected. And it will be said, "This is what you sought to bring about."
compare: If they see it up close, then the faces of those who are unbelievers will be greatly affected. And it will be said, "This is what you sought to bring about."

src: Und gewiß, bereits schickten WIR vor dir Gesandte zu ihren Leuten, dann kamen sie zu ihnen mit den klaren Zeichen, dann übten WIR Vergeltung an denjenigen, die schwere Verfehlungen begingen.
ref: Verily We sent many apostles before you to their people, who brought clear signs with them. Then We retributed those who were sinful.
draft: And indeed, before you, we sent messengers to their people, and they came to them with clear signs, then we inflicted retribution upon those who committed grave sins.
hil: And indeed, before you, We have sent messengers to their people, and they came to them with clear signs. Then, We inflicted retribution upon those who committed grave sins.
compare: And indeed, before you, we sent messengers to their people, and they came to them with clear signs, then we inflicted retribution upon those who committed grave sins.

src: Aber diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, erdichten Lügen gegen Gott, und die meisten von ihnen haben keinen Verstand.
ref: The unbelievers fabricate lies of God, for many of them are devoid of sense.
draft: But those who are unbelievers invent lies about God, and most of them have no understanding.
hil: But those who disbelieve fabricate lies against God, and most of them lack understanding.
compare: But those who are unbelievers invent lies about God, and most of them have no understanding.

src: Er (Moses) sagte: " Er ist euer Herr und der Herr eurer Vorväter."
ref: (Moses continued): "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers before you."
draft: He (Moses) said: "He is your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors."
hil: He said, "He is your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors."
compare: He (Moses) said: "He is your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors."

src: Sag: "Sterbt mit eurer Wut."
ref: Say: "Die of your rage.
draft: Say, "Die with your anger."
hil: Say, 'Die with your anger.'
compare: Say, 'Die with your anger.'

src: Doch ihr seid selten dankbar.
ref: Little thanks you give.
draft: But you are rarely grateful.
hil: But you are rarely grateful.
compare: But you are rarely grateful.

src: Es hielt auf dem Djudi an. Und es wurde gesprochen: «Weg mit den Leuten, die Unrecht tun!»
ref: The ark came to rest on Judi (Mount Ararat), and it was said: "Away with the cursed people!"
draft: It stopped at the Djudi. And it was said: "Away with the people who do wrong!"
hil: It stopped at Djudi. And it was said, 'Away with the people who do wrong!'
compare: It stopped at the Djudi. And it was said: "Away with the people who do wrong!"

src: Dazu hat Er sie erschaffen. Und so erfüllt sich das Wort deines Herrn: "Ich werde die Hölle ganz gewiß mit den Ginn und den Menschen allesamt füllen."
ref: To that end He created them, and perfectly is fulfilled the word of thy Lord: 'I shall assuredly fill Gehenna with jinn and men all together.'
draft: To this end, He created her. And thus is fulfilled the word of your Lord: "I will certainly fill hell with jinn and all mankind."
hil: He created her for that purpose, and thus the word of your Lord is fulfilled: "I will certainly fill hell with jinn and all mankind."
compare: He created her for that purpose, and thus the word of your Lord is fulfilled: "I will certainly fill hell with jinn and all mankind."

src: Die Sonne und der Mond (laufen) nach Berechnung.
ref: The sun and moon revolve to a computation;
draft: The sun and the moon (run) according to calculation.
hil: The sun and the moon run according to calculation.
compare: The sun and the moon (run) according to calculation.

src: Und wer (dies) nicht aufbringen kann, fastet an zwei aufeinanderfolgenden Monaten als Reue vor ALLAH.
ref: Then whosoever findeth not the wherewithal, on him is the fasting for two months in succession: a penance from Allah.
draft: And whoever cannot manage to do so, must fast for two consecutive months, in repentance to Allah.
hil: And whoever cannot manage to do so, must fast for two consecutive months, in repentance to Allah.
compare: And whoever cannot manage to do so, must fast for two consecutive months, in repentance to Allah.

src: Und Wir ließen die Kinder Israels das Meer überqueren.
ref: And We led the Children of Isra'il across the sea.
draft: And we let the Children of Israel cross the sea.
hil: And We caused the Children of Israel to cross the sea.
compare: And we let the Children of Israel cross the sea.

src: Allah weiß, daß ihr an sie denken werdet.
ref: God knows that you will be thinking about them.
draft: Allah knows that you will think of them.
hil: Allah knows that you will remember them.
compare: Allah knows that you will remember them.

src: Darin werden sie auf ewig weilen.
ref: They will abide in them for ever.
draft: They will dwell there forever.
hil: They will abide therein eternally.
compare: They will dwell there forever.

src: Meint ihr etwa, ihr würdet verlassen sein, wo Allah doch noch nicht jene von euch gezeichnet hat, die (in Seiner Sache) kämpfen und sich keinen zum Vertrauten nehmen außer Allah und Seinen Gesandten und die Gläubigen?
ref: Do you think you will get away before God knows who among you fought and did not take anyone but God, His Apostle and the faithful, as their friends?
draft: Do you think you would be abandoned while Allah has not yet tested those among you who strive (in His cause) and do not take anyone as allies besides Allah, His Messenger, and the believers?
hil: Do you think you would be abandoned while Allah has not yet tested those among you who strive (in His cause) and do not take anyone as allies besides Allah, His Messenger, and the believers?
compare: Do you think you would be abandoned while Allah has not yet tested those among you who strive (in His cause) and do not take anyone as allies besides Allah, His Messenger, and the believers?

src: Als das Land dann trotz seiner Weite ihnen eng erschien, ihre Seelen unter Beklemmung litten und sie wußten, daß es keine Zuflucht vor ALLAH gibt außer (der reuigen Umkehr) zu Ihm, dann verhalf ER ihnen zur Reue, damit sie bereuen.
ref: Then, when the earth, as vast as it is, closed in on them, and their very souls closed in on them, and they realized that there was no refuge from God, except in Him, He redeemed them, so that they may repent.
draft: When the country then seemed narrow to them despite its vastness, their souls suffered from constriction, and they knew that there was no refuge from Allah except (in repentance) to Him, then He gave them repentance so that they may repent.
hil: When the country then seemed narrow to them despite its vastness, their souls suffered from constriction, and they knew that there was no refuge from Allah except (in repentance) to Him, then He gave them repentance so that they may repent.
compare: When the country then seemed narrow to them despite its vastness, their souls suffered from constriction, and they knew that there was no refuge from Allah except (in repentance) to Him, then He gave them repentance so that they may repent.

src: ER gewährt Weisheit, wem ER will.
ref: He gives wisdom to whomever He wills.
draft: HE grants wisdom to whom HE wills.
hil: HE grants wisdom to whom HE wills.
compare: HE grants wisdom to whom HE wills.

src: Die Entscheidung liegt nur bei Allah. Er legt die Wahrheit dar, und Er ist der beste Richter."
ref: He relates the truth, and He is the Best of deciders.'
draft: "The decision lies only with Allah. He presents the truth, and He is the best judge."
hil: The judgement belongs only to Allah; He expounds the truth and He is the best of judges.
compare: "The decision lies only with Allah. He presents the truth, and He is the best judge."

src: Das ist eine Erinnerung für die, die (Gottes) gedenken.
ref: This is a reminder for those who are observant.
draft: This is a reminder for those who remember (God).
hil: This is a reminder for those who remember (God).
compare: This is a reminder for those who remember (God).

src: Also erbärmlich ist die Bleibe der Arroganten."
ref: How grievous a destination for the haughty!
draft: "Also pathetic is the abode of the arrogant."
hil: Also pitiful is the abode of the arrogant.
compare: "Also pathetic is the abode of the arrogant."

src: Und Wir ließen einen Regen auf sie niedergehen; wie böse war der Regen für diejenigen, die gewarnt worden waren!
ref: And rained on them a shower (of Stones). How terrible was the rain (that fell) on those who had been warned!
draft: And We caused a rain [of stones] to descend upon them, and how wretched was the rain of those who had been warned.
hil: And We caused a rain to descend upon them, and how wretched was the rain of those who had been warned!
compare: And We caused a rain [of stones] to descend upon them, and how wretched was the rain of those who had been warned.

src: Keineswegs! Beim Mond
ref: I say the truth, and call the moon to witness,
draft: Not at all! At the moon.
hil: Never! At the moon.
compare: Never! At the moon.

src: Hast du nicht gesehen, daß Allah Wasser vom Himmel herniedersendet?
ref: Have you not seen that it is Allah Who causes the water to descend from the sky?
draft: Have you not seen that Allah sends down water from the sky?
hil: Did you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky?
compare: Did you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky?

src: Dann verbarg er Furcht vor ihnen. Sie sagten: "Fürchte dich nicht!"
ref: (When they did not eat), He conceived a fear of them.
draft: Then he concealed fear from them. They said: "Do not be afraid!"
hil: Then he concealed fear from them. They said, 'Do not fear!'.
compare: Then he concealed fear from them. They said, 'Do not fear!'.

src: Nennt sie nach ihren Vätern; das ist gerechter vor Allah.
ref: Call them by the names of their fathers. This is the right course in the sight of God.
draft: Call them by their fathers' names; that is more just in the sight of Allah.
hil: Call them by their fathers' names; that is more just in the sight of Allah.
compare: Call them by their fathers' names; that is more just in the sight of Allah.

src: Ich habe ihnen nichts gesagt außer dem, womit DU mich beauftragt hast: Dient ALLAH, meinem HERRN und eurem HERRN. Und ich war Zeuge über sie, solange ich unter ihnen weilte.
ref: I only said to them what Thou didst command me: "Serve God, my Lord and your Lord."
draft: I have not told them anything except what YOU have commanded me: Serve ALLAH, my LORD and your LORD. And I was a witness over them as long as I dwelt among them.
hil: I have not told them anything except what YOU have commanded me: Serve ALLAH, my LORD and your LORD. And I was a witness over them as long as I dwelt among them.
compare: I have not told them anything except what YOU have commanded me: Serve ALLAH, my LORD and your LORD. And I was a witness over them as long as I dwelt among them.

src: Auch wenn ein Koran käme, mit dem die Berge versetzt oder die Erde zerstückelt oder zu den Toten gesprochen werden könnte... Nein, bei der ganzen Angelegenheit hat Gott allein zu entscheiden. Wissen denn diejenigen, die glauben, nicht, daß Gott, wenn Er wollte, die Menschen alle rechtleiten würde? Diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, wird immer eine Katastrophe treffen für das, was sie gemacht haben, oder sie wird in der Nähe ihrer Wohnstätten niedergehen, bis das Versprechen Gottes eintrifft. Und Gott bricht das Versprechen nicht.
ref: And were such a Qur’an to come that would cause the mountains to move, or the earth to split asunder, or the dead to speak, even then these disbelievers would not believe; in fact, all matters are only at Allah’s discretion; so have not the Muslims despaired in that, had Allah willed, He would have guided all mankind? Disasters shall continue to strike the disbelievers on account of their deeds, or descend near their homes until Allah’s promise comes; indeed Allah does not break the promise.
draft: Even if a Quran came that would move the mountains or cleave the earth or speak to the dead... No, in the matter, God alone has the decision. Do those who believe not know that if God had willed, He would have guided all mankind? And disaster will not cease to strike those who disbelieve for what they have done or it will dwell close to their homes until the promise of God comes. And God does not fail in His promise.
hil: Even if a Quran came that would move the mountains or cleave the earth or speak to the dead... No, in the matter, God alone has the decision. Do those who believe not know that if God had willed, He would have guided all mankind? And disaster will not cease to strike those who disbelieve for what they have done or it will dwell close to their homes until the promise of God comes. And God does not fail in His promise.
compare: Even if a Quran came that would move the mountains or cleave the earth or speak to the dead... No, in the matter, God alone has the decision. Do those who believe not know that if God had willed, He would have guided all mankind? And disaster will not cease to strike those who disbelieve for what they have done or it will dwell close to their homes until the promise of God comes. And God does not fail in His promise.

src: Und (eines Tages) trat er in die Stadt, ohne von ihren Einwohnern bemerkt zu werden, dann fand er zwei Männer, die gegeneinander kämpften, dieser gehörte seiner Partei an und jener war von seinen Feinden, dann bat ihn derjenige, der seiner Partei angehörte, um Hilfe gegen denjenigen, der von seinen Feinden war, dann schlug Musa mit der Faust auf ihn, dann tötete er ihn. Er sagte: "Dies ist vom Werk des Satans, gewiß, er ist ein verleitender, entschiedener Feind."
ref: And he entered the city when its inhabitants were sleeping unaware in the afternoon – he therefore found two men fighting; one was from Moosa’s group, and the other from among his enemies; so the one who was of Moosa’s group pleaded to Moosa for help against him who was of his enemies – therefore Moosa punched him thereby finishing him; he said, “This act was from the devil*; indeed he is an open enemy, a misleader.” (* The act of oppressing the man from Bani Israel).
draft: And (one day) he entered the city, without being noticed by its inhabitants, then he found two men who were fighting each other, one belonged to his party and the other was from his enemies, then the one who belonged to his party asked him for help against the one who was from his enemies, then Musa hit him with his fist, then he killed him. He said, "This is from the work of Satan, surely he is a misleading, determined enemy."
hil: And (one day) he entered the city, without being noticed by its inhabitants, then he found two men who were fighting each other, one belonged to his party and the other was from his enemies, then the one who belonged to his party asked him for help against the one who was from his enemies, then Musa hit him with his fist, then he killed him. He said, "This is from the work of Satan, surely he is a misleading, determined enemy."
compare: And (one day) he entered the city, without being noticed by its inhabitants, then he found two men who were fighting each other, one belonged to his party and the other was from his enemies, then the one who belonged to his party asked him for help against the one who was from his enemies, then Musa hit him with his fist, then he killed him. He said, "This is from the work of Satan, surely he is a misleading, determined enemy."
