ref: Those who disobey God and the Prophet and exceed the bounds of law, will be taken to Hell and abide there for ever and shall suffer despicable punishment.
draft: But whoever contradicts Allah and His Messenger and exceeds Allah's limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating punishment.
hil: But whoever contradicts Allah and His Messenger and exceeds Allah's limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating punishment.
compare: But whoever contradicts Allah and His Messenger and exceeds Allah's limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating punishment.

src: Und Er hat eure Gattinnen, von denen ihr euch durch den Rückenschwur trennt, nicht (wirklich) zu euren Müttern gemacht. Und Er hat eure angenommenen Söhne nicht (wirklich) zu euren Söhnen gemacht.
ref: Neither has He made your wives whom you declare to be like your mothers' backs, your real mothers. [AzZihar is the saying of a husband to his wife, "You are to me like the back of my mother" i.e. You are unlawful for me to approach.], nor has He made your adopted sons your real sons.
draft: And He has not made your wives, from whom you keep away by saying, "Be as my mother's back," truly your mothers; nor has He made your adopted sons [as] your [biological] sons.
hil: And He did not truly make your wives, from whom you keep separate by [Saying], 'Be as my mother's back,' your mothers; nor did He make your adopted sons your [true] sons.
compare: And He did not truly make your wives, from whom you keep separate by [Saying], 'Be as my mother's back,' your mothers; nor did He make your adopted sons your [true] sons.

src: Und ALLAH genügt als Allwissender.
ref: God suffices as Knower.
draft: And Allah is sufficient as All-Knower.
hil: And Allah suffices as All-Knower.
compare: And Allah is sufficient as All-Knower.

src: Die Hölle, in der sie brennen. Welch schlimme Lagerstätte!
ref: Hell; which they shall enter; what an evil resting-place!
draft: The hell in which they are burning. What a terrible deposit!
hil: The hell in which they are burning. What a terrible repository!
compare: The hell in which they are burning. What a terrible repository!

src: Als er nun den Ort des Sonnenuntergangs erreichte, fand er, daß sie in einer verschlammten Quelle unterging.
ref: Until, when he reached the setting place of the sun, he found it setting in a spring of black muddy (or hot) water.
draft: When he reached the place of the sunset, he found that it sank into a muddy spring.
hil: When he reached the place of the sunset, he found that it sunk into a muddy spring.
compare: When he reached the place of the sunset, he found that it sank into a muddy spring.

src: Am Tag, da das Beben einsetzt
ref: The day the convulsive (first blast) shatters convulsively
draft: On the day the earthquake starts.
hil: On the day when the quake begins.
compare: On the day the earthquake starts.

src: Und ER ist Derjenige, Der vom Himmel Wasser hinabsenden ließ. So haben WIR damit Pflanzenwuchs jeder Art ermöglicht, so haben WIR daraus Grünes sprießen lassen, von dem WIR übereinander liegende Saatkörner hervorbrachten. Und aus den Dattelpalmen, aus ihrem Blütenstand (haben WIR hervorgebracht) herunterhängende Dattelbüschel und Dschannat mit Trauben, Oliven und Granatäpfeln - einander ähnelnd und nicht ähnelnd. Betrachtet ihre Früchte, wenn sie Früchte tragen und reif werden. Gewiß, darin sind zweifelsohne Ayat für Menschen, die den Iman verinnerlichen.
ref: And it is He Who sends down water from the sky; so with it We produced all things that grow; hence We produce from it vegetation from which We bring forth grains in clusters; and from the pollen of dates, dense bunches – and gardens of grapes and olives and pomegranates, similar in some ways and unlike in some; look at its fruit when it bears yield, and its ripening; indeed in it are signs for the people who believe.
draft: And HE is the One who sent down water from the sky, and thereby We caused to grow every kind of plant, and from it, We bring forth greenery, from which We bring forth grain stacked one atop the other. And from the date-palm, from its emerging branches, low-hanging clusters of dates, and gardens of grapes and olives and pomegranates, similar yet dissimilar. Look at its fruit when it produces fruit and ripens. Surely in that are signs for people who believe.
hil: And HE is the One who sent down water from the sky, and thereby We caused to grow every kind of plant, and from it, We bring forth greenery, from which We bring forth grain stacked one atop the other. And from the date-palm, from its emerging branches, low-hanging clusters of dates, and gardens of grapes and olives and pomegranates, similar yet dissimilar. Look at its fruit when it produces fruit and ripens. Surely in that are signs for people who believe.
compare: And HE is the One who sent down water from the sky, and thereby We caused to grow every kind of plant, and from it, We bring forth greenery, from which We bring forth grain stacked one atop the other. And from the date-palm, from its emerging branches, low-hanging clusters of dates, and gardens of grapes and olives and pomegranates, similar yet dissimilar. Look at its fruit when it produces fruit and ripens. Surely in that are signs for people who believe.

src: Und daß Er der Herr des Sirius ist.
ref: That He is the Lord of Sirius;
draft: And that he is the Lord of Sirius.
hil: And that he is the Lord of Sirius.
compare: And that he is the Lord of Sirius.

src: Und da sie deinem Herrn in einer Reihe vorgeführt werden: «Ihr seid zu Uns gekommen, so wie Wir euch das erste Mal erschaffen haben.
ref: And they will be set before your Lord in (lines as) rows, (and Allah will say): "Now indeed, you have come to Us as We created you the first time.
draft: And when they are brought before your Lord standing in rows, He will say: "You have come to Us just as We created you the first time."
hil: And when they are brought before your Lord standing in rows, He will say: "You have come to Us just as We created you the first time."
compare: And when they are brought before your Lord standing in rows, He will say: "You have come to Us just as We created you the first time."

src: Da löschten Wir ihre Augen aus. "Kostet nun Meine Strafe und Meine Warnungen."
ref: So We blinded their eyes, "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."
draft: We extinguished their eyes. "Now taste My punishment and My warnings."
hil: We extinguished their eyes. "Now taste My punishment and My warnings."
compare: We extinguished their eyes. "Now taste My punishment and My warnings."

src: Als zu ihnen die Gesandten von vor ihnen und von hinter ihnen kamen: "Dient niemandem außer ALLAH."
ref: Their apostles came to them one after the other (saying): "Do not worship any one but God."
draft: When the messengers came to them from before them and behind them: "Serve no one but Allah."
hil: When the messengers came to them from before them and behind them: 'Serve no one but Allah.'
compare: When the messengers came to them from before them and behind them: "Serve no one but Allah."

src: ER wird sie mit Seiner Gnade umgeben. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: God will admit them into His mercy; God is indeed most forgiving and merciful.
draft: HE will surround them with His grace. Surely, Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
hil: HE will surround them with His grace. Surely, Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Merciful.
compare: HE will surround them with His grace. Surely, Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Merciful.

src: Ist derjenige, der qanit während der Nacht sudschud- und qiyam-vollziehend ist, der sich vor dem Jenseits in Acht nimmt und der sich die Gnade seines HERRN erhofft, (etwa mit dem Kafir gleich)?!
ref: Can one who prays in the watches of the night, bowing in homage or standing attentive, fearful of the life to come, and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, (be like one who does not)?
draft: Is the person who performs qanit during the night, sudschud and qiyam, who is cautious of the Hereafter and hopes for the mercy of his Lord, (equal to the kafir)?!
hil: Is the one who is qanit during the night, performing sudschud and qiyam, and who is cautious of the Hereafter and hopeful for the mercy of his Lord, (similar to the kafir)?!
compare: Is the one who is qanit during the night, performing sudschud and qiyam, and who is cautious of the Hereafter and hopeful for the mercy of his Lord, (similar to the kafir)?!

src: Ausgenommen der auserwählten Diener Gottes.
ref: Other than the chosen creatures of God.
draft: Except for the chosen servants of God.
hil: Except for the chosen servants of God.
compare: Except for the chosen servants of God.

src: Wir werden es gewiß nicht betreten, bis sie aus ihm herausgehen.
ref: We will not enter it until they leave it.
draft: We certainly won't enter it until they come out of it.
hil: And we certainly will not enter it until they come out of it.
compare: We certainly won't enter it until they come out of it.

src: Allah verfährt barmherzig mit euch.
ref: Surely God is compassionate to you.
draft: Allah deals mercifully with you.
hil: Allah deals mercifully with you.
compare: Allah deals mercifully with you.

src: Schau, wie Wir die einen von ihnen vor den anderen auszeichnen; aber das Jenseits ist wahrlich größer an Rangstufen und größer an Auszeichnungen.
ref: "See, how We favour one over the other; and in life to come are higher ranks and favours greater still.
draft: Look how We distinguish some of them over others; but the Hereafter is truly greater in ranks and greater in distinctions.
hil: See how We honor some of them above others, but hereafter is truly greater in ranks and greater in honors.
compare: Look how We distinguish some of them over others; but the Hereafter is truly greater in ranks and greater in distinctions.

src: Beide rannten dann zur Tür und sie zerriß sein Hemd von hinten, dann stießen beide auf ihren Ehemann an der Tür.
ref: Both of them raced to the door, and she (grabbed and) rent his shirt from behind.
draft: Both of them then ran to the door and she tore his shirt from behind, then they both bumped into her husband at the door.
hil: Both of them then ran to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and then they both bumped into her husband at the door.
compare: Both of them then ran to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and then they both bumped into her husband at the door.

src: DU bist Unser Maula, so leiste uns Beistand gegen die kufr-betreibenden Leute!"
ref: And help us against the people of the unbelievers.
draft: "You are our spokesman, so give us support against the kufr-promoting people!"
hil: Ours is the Maula, so give us support against the kufr-promoting people!
compare: "You are our spokesman, so give us support against the kufr-promoting people!"

src: Nein! Vielmehr haben Wir diesen da und ihren Vätern Nießbrauch gewährt, bis sie ein langes Leben geführt haben.
ref: We allowed them and their fathers time to enjoy till the very end of their lives.
draft: No! Rather, We have granted this one and his fathers the enjoyment [of worldly life] until a prolonged period [passed].
hil: No! Rather, We have granted this one and his fathers the enjoyment [of worldly life] until a prolonged period [passed].
compare: No! Rather, We have granted this one and his fathers the enjoyment [of worldly life] until a prolonged period [passed].

src: Als die Karawane aufgebrochen war, sprach ihr Vater: "Wahrlich, ich spüre den Geruch Yusufs, auch wenn ihr mich für schwachsinnig haltet."
ref: The caravan departed (from Egypt) and Jacob said (at home): "Say not that I am in my dotage, but I get the smell of Joseph."
draft: When the caravan set out, her father said, "Truly, I sense the smell of Joseph, even if you think I am crazy."
hil: When the caravan set out, her father said, 'Truly, I sense the smell of Joseph, even if you think I am crazy.'
compare: When the caravan set out, her father said, "Truly, I sense the smell of Joseph, even if you think I am crazy."

src: So ließ der Satan sie diesbezüglich Fehler begehen, so brachte er sie hinaus von dem, wo sie sich befanden. Und WIR sagten: "Steigt ab!
ref: Then the Satan caused the twain to slip on account thereof, and drave them forth from that which the twain were in.
draft: So the Satan made them make mistakes in this regard, so he brought them out from where they were. And WE said: "Descend!
hil: The Satan made them commit mistakes in this regard and took them out from where they were. And WE said: "Descend!
compare: The Satan made them commit mistakes in this regard and took them out from where they were. And WE said: "Descend!

src: Auch Musa wurde der Lüge bezichtigt, so gewährte ICH den Kafir noch längere Zeit, dann richtete ICH sie zugrunde.
ref: Moses was also accused of lies. So I allowed the infidels respite and then seized them.
draft: Also Musa was accused of lying, so I granted the Kafir more time, then I destroyed them.
hil: Musa, too, was accused of lying, so I granted the disbelievers more time, and then I destroyed them.
compare: Musa, too, was accused of lying, so I granted the disbelievers more time, and then I destroyed them.

src: Aber sie verleugnen den Erbarmer.
ref: But they do not believe in Ar-Rahman.
draft: But they deny the Merciful.
hil: They deny the Merciful.
compare: But they deny the Merciful.

src: Soll ich etwa andere außer Ihm zu Göttern nehmen?
ref: “What! Shall I appoint Gods other than Allah?
draft: Should I take others as gods besides Him?
hil: Should I take others as gods besides Him?
compare: Should I take others as gods besides Him?

src: Und bittet euren HERRN um Vergebung, dann seid Ihm gegenüber reumütig!
ref: "Beg your Lord to forgive you, and turn to Him.
draft: And ask your LORD for forgiveness, then be repentant towards Him!
hil: And pray for forgiveness from your LORD, then be repentant towards Him!
compare: And ask your LORD for forgiveness, then be repentant towards Him!

src: Alles geschieht zu einem vorbestimmten Termin.
ref: For every age there is a law.
draft: All happens at a predetermined time.
hil: Everything happens according to a predetermined schedule.
compare: Everything happens according to a predetermined schedule.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Bemüht euch eurer Verpflichtung ALLAH gegenüber nachzukommen und seid Zeugen in gerechter Weise!
ref: O you who believe, stand up as witnesses for God in all fairness, and do not let the hatred of a people deviate you from justice.
draft: You who have internalized the faith! Strive to fulfill your obligation towards Allah and be witnesses in a just manner!
hil: "O believers! Strive to fulfill your obligation to Allah and be witnesses in a just manner."
compare: You who have internalized the faith! Strive to fulfill your obligation towards Allah and be witnesses in a just manner!

src: Darum wartet ab; seht, ich warte auch mit euch ab."
ref: So watch and wait (for the sign); I am waiting and expecting with you."
draft: Therefore wait; see, I also wait with you.
hil: Therefore wait; see, I also wait with you.
compare: Therefore wait; see, I also wait with you.

src: Dem Allvergebenden der Verfehlung und Dem Annehmenden der Reue, Dem Harten im Strafen, Dem mit den Wohltaten. Es gibt keine Gottheit außer Ihm. Zu Ihm ist das Werden.
ref: The Forgiver of sin, and the Most Acceptor of Repentance, the Severe in Punishing, the Greatly Rewarding; there is no God except Him; towards Him only is the return.
draft: To the All-forgiving of faults and to the Accepting of repentance, to the Severe in punishment, to the Bestower of favors. There is no deity except Him. To Him is the destination.
hil: To the All-forgiving of faults and to the Accepting of repentance, to the Severe in punishment, to the Bestower of favors. There is no deity except Him. To Him is the destination.
compare: To the All-forgiving of faults and to the Accepting of repentance, to the Severe in punishment, to the Bestower of favors. There is no deity except Him. To Him is the destination.

src: Allah ist dessen, was ihr tut, Kundig.
ref: This will absolve you of some of your sins; and God is cognisant of all you do.
draft: Allah is aware of what you do.
hil: Allah is aware of what you do.
compare: Allah is aware of what you do.

src: Diejenigen aber, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, befinden sich in den Gärten des Paradieses. Sie haben bei ihrem Herrn, was sie wollen.
ref: And those who believe and work righteous works will be in meadows of the Gardens theirs will be whatsoever they list, in the presence of their Lord.
draft: But those who believe and do good deeds are in the Gardens of Paradise; they shall have whatever they please with their Lord.
hil: But those who believe and do good deeds are in the Gardens of Paradise; they shall have whatever they please with their Lord.
compare: But those who believe and do good deeds are in the Gardens of Paradise; they shall have whatever they please with their Lord.

src: Derjenige, den Allah rechtleitet, ist auf dem rechten Weg. Diejenigen aber, die Er irreführt, sind wahrlich jene, die verloren haben.
ref: He alone is guided whom God shows the way; and whom He leads astray is surely lost.
draft: The one whom Allah guides is on the right path. But those whom He leads astray, they are the losers, indeed.
hil: The one whom Allah guides is on the right path. But those whom He leads astray, they are the ones who have lost.
compare: The one whom Allah guides is on the right path. But those whom He leads astray, they are the ones who have lost.

src: Ihr wendet euch jedoch davon ab.
ref: To which you pay no heed.
draft: You, however, are turning away from it.
hil: But you are turning away from it.
compare: You, however, are turning away from it.

src: Siehst du!
ref: What thinkest thou?
draft: You see!
hil: You see!
compare: You see!

src: Und sie ziehen sich den Zorn Allahs zu, und für sie ist die Armut vorgeschrieben, weil sie Allahs Zeichen verleugneten und die Propheten ungerechterweise ermordeten.
ref: That is because they have been disbelieving in the signs of Allah, and slaying the prophets without justice.
draft: And they draw upon themselves the anger of Allah, and for them is the poverty prescribed, because they denied the signs of Allah and killed the prophets unjustly.
hil: And they incurred the wrath of Allah upon themselves, and poverty is prescribed for them, as they denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets.
compare: And they draw upon themselves the anger of Allah, and for them is the poverty prescribed, because they denied the signs of Allah and killed the prophets unjustly.

src: Allah weiß, was ihr offen tut und was ihr heimlich tut.
ref: God knows what you reveal and what you hide.
draft: "Allah knows what you do openly and what you do secretly."
hil: Allah knows what you do openly and what you do secretly.
compare: "Allah knows what you do openly and what you do secretly."

src: Am Tag, da du siehst, wie den gläubigen Männern und den gläubigen Frauen ihr Licht vor ihnen und zu ihrer Rechten eilt: «Eine frohe Botschaft für euch heute: Gärten, unter denen Bäche fließen; darin werdet ihr ewig weilen. Das ist der großartige Erfolg.»
ref: The day when you will see the believing men and believing women, that their light runs before them and on their right – it being said to them, “This day, the best tidings for you are the Gardens beneath which rivers flow – abide in it forever; this is the greatest success.”
draft: On the day you see the faithful men and the faithful women - their light proceeding before them and to their right: "Good news for you today, gardens beneath which rivers flow, in which you will dwell forever." That is the great success.
hil: On the day you see the faithful men and the faithful women - their light proceeding before them and to their right: "Good news for you today, gardens beneath which rivers flow, in which you will dwell forever." That is the great success.
compare: On the day you see the faithful men and the faithful women - their light proceeding before them and to their right: "Good news for you today, gardens beneath which rivers flow, in which you will dwell forever." That is the great success.

src: (Andere) sagten: "Euer Herr kennt die (Zeit), die ihr verbracht habt, am besten.
ref: "Your Lord knows best," they said, "how long you have stayed.
draft: (Other) said: "Your Lord knows best the (time) you have spent."
hil: (Others) said, 'Your Lord knows best the (time) you have spent.'
compare: (Others) said, 'Your Lord knows best the (time) you have spent.'

src: ER ist Derjenige, Der euch die Nacht einrichtete, um darin zu ruhen, sowie den Tag mit Licht.
ref: It is He who made the night for you to rest, and made the day enlightening.
draft: HE is the One who has set up the night for you to rest in, and the day to give sight.
hil: HE is the One who has set up the night for you to rest in, and the day to give sight.
compare: HE is the One who has set up the night for you to rest in, and the day to give sight.

src: Da erhörten Wir ihn und schenkten ihm Jahya und heilten seine Frau.
ref: So We heard him and gave him John, and cured his wife (of barrenness).
draft: We listened to him and gave him Jahya and healed his wife.
hil: We listened to him and gave him Yahya and healed his wife.
compare: We listened to him and gave him Yahya and healed his wife.

src: Esst von den Tay-yibat und tut gottgefällig Gutes!
ref: Eat of the Taiyibat [all kinds of Halal (legal) foods which Allah has made legal (meat of slaughtered eatable animals, milk products, fats, vegetables, fruits, etc.], and do righteous deeds.
draft: Eat from the Tay-yibat and do good deeds pleasing to God!
hil: Eat from the good things and do deeds pleasing to God!
compare: Eat from the Tay-yibat and do good deeds pleasing to God!

src: Und sie sagen: «O weh uns! Das ist der Tag des Gerichtes!»
ref: And they will say: Ah! woe be Unto us! this is the Day of Requital.
draft: And they say, "Oh woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!"
hil: And they say, 'Oh woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!'
compare: And they say, "Oh woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!"

src: Auf Ihn ver lassen sich diejenigen, die sich (überhaupt auf jemanden) verlassen.
ref: The trusting place their trust in Him."
draft: Those who rely on someone at all rely on him.
hil: Those who rely on someone at all rely on him.
compare: Those who rely on someone at all rely on him.

src: Und wen ALLAH irre gehen läßt, für den wirst du keinen Weg (zum Iman) finden.
ref: For them who are not given the guidance by God, you will never find a way.
draft: And whom ALLAH lets go astray, you will not find a way (to faith) for him.
hil: They whom ALLAH lets go astray, you will not find a way (to faith) for them.
compare: And whom ALLAH lets go astray, you will not find a way (to faith) for him.

src: Solcherart erwecken WIR die Toten, damit ihr euch entsinnt.
ref: Similarly, We shall raise up the dead, so that you may remember or take heed.
draft: We thus awaken the dead so that you may remember.
hil: Thus We awaken the dead so that you may remember.
compare: We thus awaken the dead so that you may remember.

src: ALLAH gehört alles, was in den Himmeln und was auf Erden ist. Und gewiß, bereits haben WIR denjenigen, denen die Schrift vor euch zuteil wurde, sowie euch angewiesen: "Handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber! Und solltet ihr Kufr betreiben, so gehört ALLAH gewiß alles, was in den Himmeln und was auf Erden ist." Und ALLAH bleibt immer absolut autark, alllobenswürdig.
ref: And to Allah only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; and indeed We have commanded those who received the Books before you, and commanded you, that keep fearing Allah; and if you disbelieve, undoubtedly to Allah only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; and Allah is Independent, Worthy Of All Praise.
draft: ALLAH owns everything that is in the heavens and on earth. And surely, We have already enjoined those given the Scripture before you, and you yourselves to fear Allah. And if you disbelieve - then indeed, Allah is Free from need of you. And Allah is Free from need and Praiseworthy.
hil: ALLAH owns everything that is in the heavens and on earth. And surely, We have already enjoined those given the Scripture before you, and you yourselves to fear Allah. And if you disbelieve - then indeed, Allah is Free from need of you. And Allah is Free from need and Praiseworthy.
compare: ALLAH owns everything that is in the heavens and on earth. And surely, We have already enjoined those given the Scripture before you, and you yourselves to fear Allah. And if you disbelieve - then indeed, Allah is Free from need of you. And Allah is Free from need and Praiseworthy.

src: Dann sing das Lob deines Herrn und bitte Ihn um Vergebung. Siehe, Er wendet sich gnädig wieder zu.
ref: Then proclaim the Purity of your Lord while praising Him, and seek forgiveness from Him; indeed He is the Most Acceptor of Repentance.
draft: Then sing the praise of your Lord and ask Him for forgiveness. Behold, He turns graciously back.
hil: Then sing the praise of your Lord and ask Him for forgiveness. Behold, He turns graciously back.
compare: Then sing the praise of your Lord and ask Him for forgiveness. Behold, He turns graciously back.

src: Das sind die, von denen Gott weiß, was in ihrem Herzen ist. Wende dich von ihnen ab, ermahne sie und sprich zu ihnen über sie selbst eindringliche Worte.
ref: The secrets of their hearts are well known to Allah; so avoid them and explain to them, and speak to them clearly in their affairs.
draft: These are the ones of whom God knows what is in their hearts. Turn away from them, admonish them and speak to them with penetrating words about themselves.
hil: These are the ones of whom God knows what is in their hearts. Turn away from them, admonish them and speak to them with penetrating words about themselves.
compare: These are the ones of whom God knows what is in their hearts. Turn away from them, admonish them and speak to them with penetrating words about themselves.

src: Er hat doch einen Vater, der ein Greis ist, so nimm einen von uns an seiner Stelle fest.
ref: Verily, he has an old father (who will grieve for him); so take one of us in his place.
draft: He does have a father who is an old man, so take one of us in his place.
hil: He does have a father who is an old man, so take one of us in his place.
compare: He does have a father who is an old man, so take one of us in his place.

src: Aber nein, er ist mit der Wahrheit gekommen und hat die Gesandten bestätigt.
ref: Not in the least. He has brought the truth and confirmed the other messengers.
draft: But no, he has come with the truth and has confirmed the messengers.
hil: But no, he came with the truth and confirmed the messengers.
compare: But no, he came with the truth and confirmed the messengers.

src: Und sie fragen dich nach Dhul-qarnain.
ref: They will question thee concerning Dhool Karnain.
draft: And they ask you about Dhul-Qarnain.
hil: And they ask you about Dhul-Qarnain.
compare: And they ask you about Dhul-Qarnain.

src: Fir'auns und der Tamud?
ref: Of Pharaoh and Thamud come to you?
draft: "Fir'aun and the Tamud?"
hil: Did Fir'aun and the Tamud (people) not receive guidance?
compare: Did Fir'aun and the Tamud (people) not receive guidance?

src: Also wenn die Augen strahlen,
ref: Yet when the eyes are dazzled,
draft: "So when the eyes sparkle,".
hil: "When the eyes sparkle,"
compare: "So when the eyes sparkle,".

src: Diese haben ihre Belohnung bei ihrem HERRN. Gewiß, ALLAH ist schnell im Zur-Rechenschaft-Ziehen.
ref: Their reward is verily with their Lord; and swift is the reckoning of God!
draft: They have their reward with their LORD. Indeed, ALLAH is quick in accountability.
hil: They have their reward with their LORD. Indeed, ALLAH is quick in accountability.
compare: They have their reward with their LORD. Indeed, ALLAH is quick in accountability.

src: Sag: O ihr Menschen, wenn ihr über meine Religion im Zweifel seid, so diene ich nicht denjenigen, denen ihr anstatt Allahs dient, sondern ich diene Allah, Der euch abberuft.
ref: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "O you mankind! If you are in doubt as to my religion (Islam), then (know that) I will never worship those whom you worship, besides Allah.
draft: Say: O mankind, if you are in doubt about my religion, then I do not serve those whom you serve instead of Allah, but I serve Allah who takes you back.
hil: Say: O mankind, if you are in doubt about my religion, then I do not serve those whom you serve instead of Allah, but I serve Allah who takes you back.
compare: Say: O mankind, if you are in doubt about my religion, then I do not serve those whom you serve instead of Allah, but I serve Allah who takes you back.

src: Und dies zum Schutz vor jedem rebellischen Satan.
ref: Protecting them against every wayward devil,
draft: And this is for protection against any rebellious Satan.
hil: And this is for protection against any rebellious Satan.
compare: And this is for protection against any rebellious Satan.

src: Und WIR umhüllten ihre Herzen mit Bedeckung, damit sie ihn nicht begreifen, und machten ihre Ohren schwerhörig.
ref: And We put covers over their hearts and deafness in their ears that they should not understand it.
draft: And WE enveloped their hearts with covering, so that they should not understand it, and made their ears heavy.
hil: We enveloped their hearts with covering, so that they should not understand it, and made their ears heavy.
compare: And WE enveloped their hearts with covering, so that they should not understand it, and made their ears heavy.

src: Als die Nacht über ihn hereinbrach, sah er einen Himmelskörper.
ref: Then when the night darkened on him, he beheld a star.
draft: As the night fell upon him, he saw a celestial body.
hil: As the night fell upon him, he saw a celestial body.
compare: As the night fell upon him, he saw a celestial body.

src: So machen Wir die Zeichen klar für ein Volk, das begreift.
ref: In this wise We detail the signs for a people who reflect.
draft: So we make the signs clear for a people who understand.
hil: O you who believe! We clarify the signs for a people who understand.
compare: O you who believe! We clarify the signs for a people who understand.

src: Und die Berge, die du für fest hältst, wirst du wie Wolken dahingehen sehen: Das (ist das) Werk Allahs, Der alles vollendet hat.
ref: You will see the mountains and think they are firmly planted, but they will pass away like flying clouds: Artistry of God who perfected everything.
draft: And the mountains that you consider to be firm, you will see them passing by like clouds: that is the doing of Allah, who has perfected everything.
hil: And the mountains, which you consider to be firm, you will see them passing by like clouds: This is the work of Allah, who has perfected everything.
compare: And the mountains, which you consider to be firm, you will see them passing by like clouds: This is the work of Allah, who has perfected everything.

src: Ist nicht zu ihnen der deutliche Beweis dessen gekommen, was in den früheren Blättern steht?
ref: Have not clear proofs come to them in what is contained in the earlier Books?
draft: Has the clear proof of what is written in the earlier pages not come to them?
hil: Has not the clear evidence of what is in the earlier pages come to them?
compare: Has not the clear evidence of what is in the earlier pages come to them?

src: Als sie dann vor ihn (Yusuf) traten, da sagten sie: "O `Aziz, die Not hat uns und unsere Familie geschlagen, und wir haben Ware von geringem Wert mitgebracht; so gib uns das volle Maß und sei wohltätig gegen uns. Wahrlich, Allah belohnt die Wohltätigen."
ref: Then when they reached in the company of Yusuf they said, “O governor! Calamity has struck us and our household, and we have brought goods of little value, so give us the full measure and be generous to us; undoubtedly Allah rewards the generous.”
draft: When they appeared before him (Yusuf), they said, "O 'Aziz, we and our family have been afflicted with distress and we have brought goods of little value, so give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable."
hil: When they appeared before him (Yusuf), they said, "O 'Aziz, we and our family have been afflicted with distress and we have brought goods of little value, so give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable."
compare: When they appeared before him (Yusuf), they said, "O 'Aziz, we and our family have been afflicted with distress and we have brought goods of little value, so give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable."

src: Sie sagten: "Bitte für uns deinen Herrn, uns Klarheit zu geben, wie sie sein soll! Die Kühe erscheinen uns (alle) ähnlich.
ref: "Call on your Lord," they said, "to name its variety, as cows be all alike to us.
draft: They said: "Please ask your lord to give us clarity on how it should be! The cows all look similar to us."
hil: They said, 'Please ask your lord to give us clarity on how it should be! The cows all look similar to us.'
compare: They said: "Please ask your lord to give us clarity on how it should be! The cows all look similar to us."

src: Der Tag der Entscheidung ist wahrlich die festgesetzte Zeit für sie alle
ref: The Day of Judgement is your promised day of meeting,
draft: The day of decision is truly the appointed time for them all.
hil: The day of decision is truly the appointed time for them all.
compare: The day of decision is truly the appointed time for them all.

src: (Es ist) die Befreiung eines Sklaven
ref: To free a neck (from the burden of debt or slavery),
draft: The liberation of a slave.
hil: The liberation of a slave.
compare: The liberation of a slave.

src: Es ziemt dem Allerbarmer nicht, Sich Kinder zu nehmen.
ref: When it does not behove the Merciful to have a son.
draft: The Most Merciful should not take children.
hil: It is not appropriate for the Most Merciful to take children.
compare: It is not appropriate for the Most Merciful to take children.

src: Ist es nur eine, soll sie die Hälfte haben.
ref: If there is only one, she gets one-half.
draft: If it's only one, she should have half.
hil: If there is only one, she should have half.
compare: If it's only one, she should have half.

src: Und sollte eine Schwerbelastete um (die Entlastung von) ihrer Last rufen, der (Gerufene) wird (ihr) davon nichts abnehmen, und selbst dann nicht, wäre er von den Nahverwandten.
ref: Even if one weighted down calls for help with its burden, nothing can be lifted from it, even if they were related.
draft: And if someone heavily burdened calls (for the relief of) their load, the (person called) will not take anything off them, not even if they were close relatives.
hil: And if a heavily burdened person calls for relief from their burden, the one called will not relieve them of it, even if they were close relatives.
compare: And if a heavily burdened person calls for relief from their burden, the one called will not relieve them of it, even if they were close relatives.

src: Allah ist Allhörend, Allsehend.
ref: Truly, Allah is Ever All-Hearer, All-Seer.
draft: Allah is all-hearing, all-seeing.
hil: Allah is All-Hearing and All-Seeing.
compare: Allah is All-Hearing and All-Seeing.

src: Und wir haben bestimmt gesündigt.»
ref: We were definitely in the wrong.”
draft: "And we have certainly sinned."
hil: We have certainly sinned.
compare: "And we have certainly sinned."

src: Allah wird euer Tun sehen, und (auch) Sein Gesandter und die Gläubigen.
ref: Allah will see your deeds, and (so will) His Messenger and the believers.
draft: Allah will see your actions, and (also) His messenger and the believers.
hil: Allah will see your actions, and (also) His messenger and the believers.
compare: Allah will see your actions, and (also) His messenger and the believers.

src: Und bestimme für uns im Diesseits Gutes, und auch im Jenseits.
ref: Enjoin for us good in the world, and good in the world to come.
draft: And determine good for us in this world, and also in the hereafter.
hil: And decree for us good in this life, and in the Hereafter.
compare: And decree for us good in this life, and in the Hereafter.

src: Allah schämt Sich nicht, ein Gleichnis auch nur mit einer Mücke oder mit etwas darüber (hinaus) zu prägen. Was nun diejenigen angeht, die glauben, so wissen sie, daß es die Wahrheit von ihrem Herrn ist. Was aber diejenigen angeht, die ungläubig sind, so sagen sie: "Was will denn Allah damit als Gleichnis?" Er läßt damit viele in die Irre gehen und leitet viele damit recht, doch läßt Er damit nur die Frevler in die Irre gehen,
ref: Surely Allah is not ashamed to set forth any parable-- (that of) a gnat or any thing above that; then as for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord, and as for those who disbelieve, they say: What is it that Allah means by this parable: He causes many to err by it and many He leads aright by it! but He does not cause to err by it (any) except the transgressors,
draft: "Allah does not hesitate to use a mosquito or something beyond it to illustrate things. As for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, they say, 'What did Allah intend by this as an example?' He leads many astray and guides many aright thereby. But He leads astray thereby only those who are defiantly disobedient,".
hil: Allah is not ashamed to illustrate with a mosquito or with something above it. As for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, they say, 'What does Allah mean by this illustration?' He thereby leads many astray and guides many thereby. Yet He leaves astray thereby only those who are defiantly disobedient.
compare: Allah is not ashamed to illustrate with a mosquito or with something above it. As for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, they say, 'What does Allah mean by this illustration?' He thereby leads many astray and guides many thereby. Yet He leaves astray thereby only those who are defiantly disobedient.

src: Diejenigen aber, die ungläubig waren, (bekommen zu hören): «Sind euch nicht meine Zeichen immer wieder verlesen worden?
ref: As for the infidels, (it will be said): "Were not My messages read out to you?
draft: "But those who were unbelievers (hear): 'Have my signs not been repeatedly recited to you?'"
hil: They who were unbelievers (hear): 'Have my signs not been repeatedly recited to you?'
compare: "But those who were unbelievers (hear): 'Have my signs not been repeatedly recited to you?'"

src: Die, denen ihr anstelle Gottes dient, können euch keinen Lebensunterhalt bringen.
ref: Surely those you worship other than God have no power over your means of livelihood.
draft: Those whom you serve instead of God cannot bring you sustenance.
hil: Those whom you serve instead of God cannot bring you sustenance.
compare: Those whom you serve instead of God cannot bring you sustenance.

src: Und den, dem Wir ein langes Leben geben, setzen wir körperlichem Verfall aus.
ref: Whoever reaches old age, We reverse in natural disposition.
draft: And for those whom We grant long life, We reduce them to weakness in constitution.
hil: Whomever We bring to an old age, We reverse him in creation; so do they not understand?
compare: And for those whom We grant long life, We reduce them to weakness in constitution.

src: Diejenigen, die den ehrbaren Ehefrauen (Untreue) vorwerfen und hierauf nicht vier Zeugen beibringen, die geißelt mit achtzig Hieben und nehmt von ihnen niemals mehr eine Zeugenaussage an - das sind die (wahren) Frevler -,
ref: Those who defame chaste women and do not bring four witnesses should be punished with eighty lashes, and their testimony should not be accepted afterwards, for they are profligates,
draft: Those who accuse honorable wives of infidelity but fail to produce four witnesses, shall be flogged eighty times and their testimony shall never be accepted. They are indeed sinners.
hil: Those who accuse honorable wives of infidelity but fail to produce four witnesses, shall be flogged eighty times and their testimony shall never be accepted. They are indeed sinners.
compare: Those who accuse honorable wives of infidelity but fail to produce four witnesses, shall be flogged eighty times and their testimony shall never be accepted. They are indeed sinners.

src: Und verzehrt ihn nicht maßlos und ihrem Erwachsenwerden zuvorkommend.
ref: And do not consume it extravagantly or hastily before they grow up.
draft: And do not consume it excessively and in anticipation of their growing up.
hil: Do not consume it excessively and in anticipation of their coming of age.
compare: Do not consume it excessively and in anticipation of their coming of age.

src: Alsdann sagte einer von ihnen: "Tötet Yusuf nicht, sondern werft ihn in die Tiefe des Brunnens hinein, so finden ihn einige Reisende, solltet ihr dies tun wollen."
ref: One of them said: "If you must do so, then do not kill Joseph, but throw him into an unused well. Some passing caravan may rescue him."
draft: Then one of them said: "Do not kill Yusuf, but rather throw him into the depths of the well, so some travelers may find him if you want to do this."
hil: Then one of them said, 'Do not kill Yusuf, but throw him into the depths of the well. Some travelers may find him if you want to do this.'
compare: Then one of them said, 'Do not kill Yusuf, but throw him into the depths of the well. Some travelers may find him if you want to do this.'

src: Erklärt nicht für haram die Tay-yibat dessen, was ALLAH euch für halal erklärte, und übertretet nicht!
ref: Make not unlawful the Taiyibat (all that is good as regards foods, things, deeds, beliefs, persons, etc.) which Allah has made lawful to you, and transgress not.
draft: Do not declare as haram the Tay-yibat of what Allah has declared halal to you, and do not transgress.
hil: Do not declare as forbidden the clean things that ALLAH has declared lawful for you, and do not transgress!
compare: Do not declare as haram the Tay-yibat of what Allah has declared halal to you, and do not transgress.

src: Und sie erkundigen sich bei dir: "Ist es wahr?"
ref: Yet they want to be informed if it is true.
draft: And they ask you: "Is it true?"
hil: And they inquire of you, "Is it true?"
compare: And they ask you: "Is it true?"

src: Eine Gruppe davon pflegte er zu unterdrücken, indem er ihre Söhne erschlug und ihre Frauen leben ließ.
ref: He persecuted a group of them, slaughtering their sons, while sparing their daughters.
draft: One group he used to suppress by killing their sons and letting their wives live.
hil: One group he used to suppress by killing their sons and leaving their wives alive.
compare: One group he used to suppress by killing their sons and leaving their wives alive.

src: Ein Buch, dessen Zeichen im einzelnen dargelegt sind, als arabischer Koran, für Leute, die Bescheid wissen,
ref: A Book whose verses have been distinguished and explained, a lucid discourse for people who understand,
draft: A book, whose characters are explained in detail, like the Arabic Quran, for people who know.
hil: A book whose characters are explained in detail, like the Arabic Quran, for people who know.
compare: A book, whose characters are explained in detail, like the Arabic Quran, for people who know.

src: Und sie fragen dich nach einer Fatwa, sag: "ALLAH gibt euch Fatwa hinsichtlich der Kalala. Wenn ein Mensch stirbt, ohne daß er Kinder (oder Eltern), aber eine Schwester (väterlicherseits) hinterläßt, so bekommt sie die Hälfte dessen, was er hinterläßt, und er beerbt sie, wenn sie keine Kinder (oder Eltern) hinterläßt.
ref: They ask you for a ruling. Say, ‘Allah gives you a ruling concerning the kalalah: If a man dies and has no children [or parents], but has a sister, for her shall be a half of what he leaves, and he shall inherit from her if she has no children.
draft: And they ask you for a fatwa. Say: "ALLAH gives you a fatwa concerning the Kalala. When a person dies without leaving children (or parents) but a sister (paternal) behind, she receives half of what he leaves, and he inherits her if she does not leave children (or parents) behind.
hil: And they ask you for a fatwa. Say: 'Allah gives you a fatwa regarding Kalala. When a person dies without leaving children (or parents), but leaves a sister (paternal) behind, she will receive half of what he leaves, and he will inherit her if she does not leave children (or parents) behind.'
compare: And they ask you for a fatwa. Say: 'Allah gives you a fatwa regarding Kalala. When a person dies without leaving children (or parents), but leaves a sister (paternal) behind, she will receive half of what he leaves, and he will inherit her if she does not leave children (or parents) behind.'

src: Laß die Ungläubigen nicht meinen, sie hätten (Uns) übertroffen.
ref: The infidels should not think that they can bypass (the law of God).
draft: Let not the unbelievers think they have (out) done (Us).
hil: Let not the unbelievers think they have outdone (Us).
compare: Let not the unbelievers think they have outdone (Us).

src: "Yusuf, du Wahrhaftiger! Gib uns eine Antwort über sieben fette Kühe, die von sieben mageren Kühen gefressen werden, und über sieben grüne Ähren und (sieben) andere Vertrocknete, vielleicht kehre ich zu den Menschen zurück, vielleicht wissen sie es dann."
ref: (And coming to the prison) he said: "O Joseph the truthful, tell us (the meaning of) seven fat cows being devoured by seven lean ones, and seven green ears of corn and seven seared, that I may go back to the people and tell them."
draft: "Yusuf, you truthful one! Give us an answer about seven fat cows that are eaten by seven skinny cows, and about seven green ears of corn and (seven) others that are dried up, perhaps then I will return to the people, perhaps they will know."
hil: Yusuf, you truthful one! Give us an answer about seven fat cows that are eaten by seven skinny cows, and about seven green ears of corn and (seven) others that are dried up, perhaps then I will return to the people, perhaps they will know.
compare: "Yusuf, you truthful one! Give us an answer about seven fat cows that are eaten by seven skinny cows, and about seven green ears of corn and (seven) others that are dried up, perhaps then I will return to the people, perhaps they will know."

src: Ihr dient anstatt Allahs nur Götzen und schafft (dabei nur) ungeheuerliche Lüge. Gewiß, diejenigen, denen ihr anstatt Allahs dient, vermögen euch nicht zu versor gen.
ref: You only serve, apart from God, idols and you create a calumny; those you serve, apart from God, have no power to provide for you.
draft: You serve only idols instead of Allah and create (thereby only) monstrous lies. Indeed, those whom you serve instead of Allah are not able to provide for you.
hil: You serve only idols instead of Allah and thereby create monstrous lies. Indeed, those whom you serve instead of Allah are not able to provide for you.
compare: You serve only idols instead of Allah and thereby create monstrous lies. Indeed, those whom you serve instead of Allah are not able to provide for you.

src: Auf Ihn vertraue ich.
ref: In Him I have put my trust.
draft: I trust him.
hil: I put my trust in Him.
compare: I put my trust in Him.

src: (Und auch) acht Tiere zu Paaren: von den Schafen zwei und von den Ziegen zwei. - Sprich: Sind es die beiden Männchen, die Er verboten hat, oder die beiden Weibchen, oder was der Leib der beiden Weibchen enthält?
ref: There are eight pairs, two of the species of sheep and two of goats. Ask them which has He forbidden, the two males or the two females, or what the females carry in their wombs?
draft: (And also) eight animals to pairs: two of the sheep and two of the goats. - Say: Are they the two males that He prohibited, or the two females, or what the body of the two females contains?
hil: And also eight animals in pairs: two sheep and two goats. Say: Are they the two males that He has prohibited, or the two females, or what the body of the two females contains?
compare: And also eight animals in pairs: two sheep and two goats. Say: Are they the two males that He has prohibited, or the two females, or what the body of the two females contains?

src: Dieser (Quran) ist nichts als eine Ermahnung für die Welten.
ref: This is only a warning for mankind.
draft: This (Quran) is nothing but a reminder for the worlds.
hil: This (Quran) is nothing but a reminder for the worlds.
compare: This (Quran) is nothing but a reminder for the worlds.

src: Und den, der an Allah glaubt und recht handelt, wird Er in Gärten führen, durch die Bäche fließen, worin (er) auf ewig verweilen wird. Allah hat ihm wahrlich eine treffliche Versorgung gewährt.
ref: And those who believe in Allah and work righteousness, He will admit to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow, to dwell therein for ever: Allah has indeed granted for them a most excellent Provision.
draft: And he who believes in Allah and acts rightly, He will lead him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein he will abide forever. Allah has surely granted him a goodly provision.
hil: And he who believes in Allah and acts rightly, He will lead him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein he will abide forever. Allah has surely granted him a goodly provision.
compare: And he who believes in Allah and acts rightly, He will lead him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein he will abide forever. Allah has surely granted him a goodly provision.

src: Und sie sagen: "Er ist ja fürwahr besessen."
ref: They say: “Surely he is afflicted with madness”;
draft: And they say, "He is truly possessed."
hil: They say, 'He is truly possessed.'
compare: And they say, "He is truly possessed."

src: Gewiß, ALLAH ist allumfassend, allwissend.
ref: Allah is All-Sufficient for His creatures' needs, All-Knowing.
draft: Sure, ALLAH is all-encompassing, all-knowing.
hil: "Truly, Allah is all-encompassing, all-knowing."
compare: Sure, ALLAH is all-encompassing, all-knowing.

src: So machten Wir es zu einem warnenden Beispiel für die Zeitgenossen und die Nachfolgenden und zu einer Ermahnung für die Gottesfürchtigen.
ref: And whom We made an example for the people (of the day) and those after them, and warning for those who fear God.
draft: So we made it a cautionary tale for contemporaries and posterity, and a reminder for the God-fearing.
hil: Thus We made it a warning example for the contemporaries and the successors and a reminder for the pious.
compare: So we made it a cautionary tale for contemporaries and posterity, and a reminder for the God-fearing.

src: (Damals als Allah sie dir in deinem Traum in geringer Anzahl zeigte; und hätte Er sie dir in großer Anzahl gezeigt, wäret ihr sicherlich Versager und über die Sache uneins gewesen; Allah aber bewahrte (euch davor); wahrlich, Er kennt wohl, was in den Herzen ist.
ref: God showed (the Makkans) to be few in your dream, for if He had shown them to be many you would surely have lost courage and disagreed about the (wisdom) of the battle. But God spared you this, for He surely knows what is in the hearts of men.
draft: Back then, when Allah showed them to you in your dream in small numbers; and if He had shown them to you in large numbers, you would have certainly failed and been divided over the matter; but Allah saved you from that; surely He knows well what is in the hearts.
hil: Once, when Allah showed them to you in your dream in small numbers; and if He had shown them to you in large numbers, you would have certainly failed and been divided over the matter; but Allah saved you from that; surely He knows well what is in the hearts.
compare: Back then, when Allah showed them to you in your dream in small numbers; and if He had shown them to you in large numbers, you would have certainly failed and been divided over the matter; but Allah saved you from that; surely He knows well what is in the hearts.

src: Gewiß, für die Unrecht-Begehenden ist eine qualvolle Peinigung bestimmt.
ref: Verily, there is a painful torment for the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.)."
draft: Certainly, a torturous punishment is destined for those who commit injustices.
hil: Verily, for those who commit injustices, a painful punishment is destined.
compare: Certainly, a torturous punishment is destined for those who commit injustices.

src: Damit Gott einem jeden vergelte, was er erworben hat.
ref: That God may reward each soul for its deeds.
draft: So that God may repay each one according to what he has earned.
hil: So that God may repay each according to what he has earned.
compare: So that God may repay each one according to what he has earned.

src: So erfolgt auch das Herauskommen.
ref: Even thus will be the life after death.
draft: So also happens the coming out.
hil: Thus, the emergence also takes place.
compare: Thus, the emergence also takes place.

src: Und ER machte für euch Bekleidungen, die euch vor der Hitze schützen, und Bekleidungen, die euch vor eurer Gewalttätigkeit (gegeneinander) schützen.
ref: He has given you garments to protect you from the heat, and garments to protect you from your own violence.
draft: And HE made for you clothing that protects you from the heat, and clothing that protects you from your violence (against each other).
hil: And HE made clothing for you that protects you from the heat and clothing that protects you from your violence (against each other).
compare: And HE made for you clothing that protects you from the heat, and clothing that protects you from your violence (against each other).

src: Und wer von euch es vorsätzlich tötet, so ist die Vergeltung (dafür) Gleiches von den An'am wie das, was man getötet hat, - darüber befinden zwei Redliche von euch - als Hady-Opfertier, das bei der Ka'ba geopfert wird.
ref: Whoever of you kills any intentionally, its penalty shall be a domestic animal comparable to what he killed, as determined by two honest persons among you—an offering delivered to the Kaabah.
draft: And whoever intentionally kills it among you, then the retribution for it is in equivalence to what he killed, from the An'am (livestock), judging fairly between you. As an offering presented to Ka'ba, brought by yourself or from others, as stated in the Qur'an.
hil: And whoever intentionally kills it among you, then the retribution for it is in equivalence to what he killed, from the An'am (livestock), judging fairly between you. As an offering presented to Ka'ba, brought by yourself or from others, as stated in the Qur'an.
compare: And whoever intentionally kills it among you, then the retribution for it is in equivalence to what he killed, from the An'am (livestock), judging fairly between you. As an offering presented to Ka'ba, brought by yourself or from others, as stated in the Qur'an.

src: Das Gleichnis Seiner Erleuchtung ist wie eine Aushöhlung, in der eine Leuchte ist.
ref: The allegory of His light is that of a pillar on which is a lamp.
draft: The parable of his enlightenment is like a hollow in which there is a lamp.
hil: The parable of His enlightenment is like a hollow in which there is a lamp.
compare: The parable of his enlightenment is like a hollow in which there is a lamp.

src: Da erretteten Wir ihn und diejenigen, die mit ihm waren, im Schiff. Und Wir machten sie zu Nachfolgern und ließen diejenigen ertrinken, die Unsere Zeichen für Lüge erklärten.
ref: They denied him, but We delivered him, and those with him in the ship, and We made them generations replacing one after another, while We drowned those who belied Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.).
draft: We saved him and those who were with him in the ship. And We made them successors and drowned those who declared Our signs as falsehood.
hil: We rescued him and those who were with him in the ship, and made them successors, while We drowned those who rejected Our signs as falsehood.
compare: We saved him and those who were with him in the ship. And We made them successors and drowned those who declared Our signs as falsehood.

src: Wie kann Ihm ein Sohn gehören, wo ER niemals eine Partnerin hatte und doch alles erschuf?! Und ER ist über alles allwissend.
ref: How can He have children when He has no wife? He created all things and He is the All-Knower of everything.
draft: How can he have a son when he never had a partner and yet created everything?! And he is omniscient above all.
hil: How can He have a son when He never had a partner and yet created everything?! And He is omniscient above all.
compare: How can he have a son when he never had a partner and yet created everything?! And he is omniscient above all.

src: Sowie die Bewohner von Madyan. Auch Musa wurde der Lüge bezichtigt, so gewährte ICH den Kafir noch längere Zeit, dann richtete ICH sie zugrunde.
ref: and so did the dwellers of Midian, and Moses too was branded a liar. Initially I granted respite to the unbelievers for a while and then seized them.
draft: As well as the inhabitants of Madyan. Moses was also accused of lying, so I granted the unbelievers more time, then I destroyed them.
hil: As well as the inhabitants of Madyan. Moses was also accused of lying, so I granted the disbelievers more time, then I destroyed them.
compare: As well as the inhabitants of Madyan. Moses was also accused of lying, so I granted the disbelievers more time, then I destroyed them.

src: Sie waren gegen den Gesandten ihres Herrn ungehorsam. I) a ergriff Er sie mit einem sich steigernden heftigen Griff.
ref: When they disobeyed the apostle of their Lord He seized them with an overwhelming punishment.
draft: They were disobedient to the envoy of their lord. I) He took her with an increasingly violent grip.
hil: They were disobedient to the messenger of their Lord. I) He seized them with an increasingly violent grip.
compare: They were disobedient to the messenger of their Lord. I) He seized them with an increasingly violent grip.

src: Sollte euch ALLAHs Peinigung unerwartet oder voraussehbar überkommen, werden etwa andere damit zugrunde gerichtet außer den unrecht-begehenden Leuten?"
ref: If God's chastisement comes upon you, suddenly or openly, shall any be destroyed, except the people of the evildoers?'
draft: "If Allah's punishment overtakes you unexpectedly or predictably, will anyone be destroyed except for the wrongdoing people?"
hil: If Allah's punishment overtakes you unexpectedly or predictably, will anyone be destroyed except for the wrongdoing people?
compare: "If Allah's punishment overtakes you unexpectedly or predictably, will anyone be destroyed except for the wrongdoing people?"

src: Als sie deren Zusammenfluß erreicht hatten, vergaßen sie ihren Fisch, so nahm er seinen Weg ins Meer wie einen Tauchpfad.
ref: When they reached the confluence they forgot the fish (they had brought as food) which swiftly made its way into the sea.
draft: When they had reached its confluence, they forgot about their fish, so it took its path into the sea like a diving trail.
hil: When they had reached the confluence, they forgot about their fish, so it took its path into the sea like a diving trail.
compare: When they had reached the confluence, they forgot about their fish, so it took its path into the sea like a diving trail.

src: Und (ER gebietet euch), daß ihr eure Verantwortung den Waisen gegenüber in gerechter Weise erfüllt."
ref: Allah directs you to treat the orphans with justice.
draft: "And (HE commands you) that you fulfill your responsibility towards orphans in a just manner."
hil: And he commands you to fulfill your responsibility towards orphans in a just manner.
compare: And he commands you to fulfill your responsibility towards orphans in a just manner.

src: Und wenn ihr krank oder auf Reisen seid, oder wenn einer von euch vom Abort kommt, oder wenn ihr die Frauen berührt habt und ihr kein Wasser findet, dann sucht einen sauberen Boden und streicht euch davon über das Gesicht und die Hände. Gott will euch keine Bedrängnis auferlegen, sondern Er will euch rein machen und seine Gnade an euch vollenden, auf daß ihr dankbar seid.
ref: When you wish to stand up for prayer, wash your faces, and your hands up to the elbows, and pass wet palms over your heads and wash your feet up to the ankles; and if you need a bath, clean yourselves thoroughly; and if you are sick or on a journey, or one of you returns from answering the call of nature, or you have cohabited with women, and you do not find water, then cleanse (yourself) with clean soil – therefore stroke your soiled palms over your faces and your hands with it; Allah does not will to place you in hardship, but He wills to fully purify you and complete His favour upon you, so that you may be grateful.
draft: And if you are sick or traveling, or if one of you comes from using the bathroom, or if you have touched women and cannot find water, then seek a clean ground and wipe your faces and hands with it. God does not want to place any burden on you, but He wants to make you pure and complete His grace upon you, so that you may be grateful.
hil: If you are ill or traveling, or if one of you comes from using the bathroom, or if you have touched women and cannot find water, then seek a clean ground and wipe your faces and hands with it. God does not want to place any burden on you, but He wants to make you pure and complete His grace upon you, so that you may be grateful.
compare: And if you are sick or traveling, or if one of you comes from using the bathroom, or if you have touched women and cannot find water, then seek a clean ground and wipe your faces and hands with it. God does not want to place any burden on you, but He wants to make you pure and complete His grace upon you, so that you may be grateful.

src: ER ist Derjenige, Der Herzensruhe in die Herzen der Mumin hinabsandte, damit sie mehr Iman zu ihrem Iman gewinnen. Und ALLAH gehören die Gehilfen der Himmel und der Erde. Und ALLAH ist immer allwissend, allweise.
ref: It is He who sent down the sense of security into the hearts of believers so that their faith may increase with belief, -- God's are the armies of the heavens and the earth; and God is all-knowing and all-wise; --
draft: HE is the One who sent tranquility into the hearts of the believers so that they may increase in faith upon their faith. And to ALLAH belong the armies of the heavens and the earth. And ALLAH is Knowing and Wise.
hil: HE is the One who sent tranquility into the hearts of the believers so that they may increase in faith upon their faith. And to ALLAH belong the armies of the heavens and the earth. And ALLAH is Knowing and Wise.
compare: HE is the One who sent tranquility into the hearts of the believers so that they may increase in faith upon their faith. And to ALLAH belong the armies of the heavens and the earth. And ALLAH is Knowing and Wise.

src: Esset von ihren Früchten, wenn sie Früchte tragen, doch gebet davon am Tage der Ernte (dem Armen) seinen Anteil, seid (dabei aber) nicht verschwenderisch! Wahrlich, Er liebt diejenigen nicht, die nicht maßhalten.
ref: So eat of their fruit when they are in fruit, and give on the day of harvesting His due, and do not be extravagant, for God does not love those who are prodigal.
draft: Eat from their fruits when they bear fruit, but give their due alms on the day of harvest, and do not waste, for Allah does not like the wasteful.
hil: Eat from their fruits when they bear fruit, but give their due alms on the day of harvest, and do not waste, for Allah does not like the wasteful.
compare: Eat from their fruits when they bear fruit, but give their due alms on the day of harvest, and do not waste, for Allah does not like the wasteful.

src: (Alles) Lob gehört Allah, dem Herrn der Weltenbewohner!
ref: All praise be to God, the Lord of all the worlds.
draft: All praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of the worlds inhabitants!
hil: All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the inhabitants of the worlds!
compare: All praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of the worlds inhabitants!

src: Ihr meintet, daß der Gesandte und die Gläubigen niemals mehr zu ihren Angehörigen zurückkehren würden, und das ist euch in euren Herzen ausgeschmückt worden.
ref: You had imagined that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and this notion was embellished in your hearts.
draft: You meant that the messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and it has been embellished in your hearts.
hil: You thought that the messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and this has been embellished in your hearts.
compare: You meant that the messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and it has been embellished in your hearts.

src: Und gehorcht ALLAH und gehorcht dem Gesandten!
ref: Obey God and obey His Apostle.
draft: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger!
hil: Obey Allah and obey the Messenger!
compare: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger!

src: Als der Prophet einer seiner Gattinnen eine Mitteilung im geheimen anvertraute.
ref: The Prophet told something in confidence to one of his wives.
draft: When the prophet confided a message to one of his wives in secret.
hil: When the prophet confided a message to one of his wives in secret.
compare: When the prophet confided a message to one of his wives in secret.

src: Sie haben außer Ihm keinen Freund.
ref: How well does He hear!
draft: They have no friend except him.
hil: They have no friend except Him.
compare: They have no friend except him.

src: Demjenigen von beiden, von dem er dachte, daß er doch gerettet wird, sagte er dann: "Erwähne mich vor deinem Gebieter!"
ref: Then he said to the one he deemed should be saved of the two, 'Mention me in thy lord's presence.'
draft: To the one of both, whom he thought will still be saved, he then said: "Mention me before your master!"
hil: To the one of both, whom he knew will still be saved, he said, 'Mention me before your master!'
compare: To the one of both, whom he thought will still be saved, he then said: "Mention me before your master!"

src: Und (Wir sandten) zu Tamud ihren Bruder Salih. Er sagte: "O mein Volk, dient Allah! Keinen Gott habt ihr außer Ihm. Er hat euch aus der Erde entstehen lassen und sie euch zu besiedeln gegeben. So bittet Ihn um Vergebung, hierauf bereut vor Ihm. Mein Herr ist nahe und erhört (die Gebete)."
ref: And to the Thamud tribe, We sent their fellow man Saleh; he said, “O my people! Worship Allah, there is no other True God except Him; He created you from the earth and established you in it, so seek forgiveness from Him and incline towards Him in repentance; indeed my Lord is Close, Acceptor of Prayer.”
draft: And (We sent) their brother Salih to Thamud. He said: "O my people, worship Allah! You have no god but Him. He brought you into being from the earth and settled you in it, so ask Him for forgiveness, then turn back to Him in repentance. My Lord is Near and Responsive."
hil: We sent their brother Salih to Thamud. He said: 'O my people, worship Allah! You have no god but Him. He brought you into being from the earth and settled you in it, so ask Him for forgiveness, then turn back to Him in repentance. My Lord is Near and Responsive'.
compare: And (We sent) their brother Salih to Thamud. He said: "O my people, worship Allah! You have no god but Him. He brought you into being from the earth and settled you in it, so ask Him for forgiveness, then turn back to Him in repentance. My Lord is Near and Responsive."

src: So macht Allah euch Seine Zeichen klar, auf daß ihr begreifen möget.
ref: So does God pronounce His decrees that you may understand.
draft: So Allah makes His signs clear to you that you may understand.
hil: Thus does Allah make clear to you His signs that you may understand.
compare: So Allah makes His signs clear to you that you may understand.

src: Richte deine Augen nicht auf das, was WIR manchen von ihnen an vergänglichen Verbrauchsgütern zur Verfügung stellten. Und trauere nicht um sie, und behandle die Mumin milde!
ref: So covet not things We have bestowed on a portion of them to enjoy, and do not grieve for them, and protect those who believe;
draft: Do not focus your eyes on what WE provided some of them with perishable consumer goods. And do not mourn them, and treat the Mumin kindly!
hil: Do not direct your eyes towards the temporary consumer goods that We provided some of them with. And do not grieve over them and treat the believer kindly.
compare: Do not direct your eyes towards the temporary consumer goods that We provided some of them with. And do not grieve over them and treat the believer kindly.

src: Und diejenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht und gottgefällig Gutes getan haben, werden WIR in Dschannat eintreten lassen, die von Flüssen durchflossen sind, darin werden sie für immer und ewig bleiben. Dies ist ALLAHs Versprechen, ein Wahrhaftiges.
ref: And those who believed and did good deeds – We shall soon admit them into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding in them for ever and ever; a true promise from Allah; and whose Words are more true than those of Allah?
draft: And those who have internalized the faith and done good deeds pleasing to God, We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. This is Allah's promise, which is true.
hil: And those who have internalized the faith and done good deeds pleasing to God, We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. This is Allah's promise, which is true.
compare: And those who have internalized the faith and done good deeds pleasing to God, We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. This is Allah's promise, which is true.

src: Auf Gott sollen die Gläubigen vertrauen.
ref: The believers should only place their trust in God.
draft: The believers should trust in God.
hil: Therefore, believers should trust in God.
compare: The believers should trust in God.

src: Alsdann wird jeder Seele nach ihrem Verdienst vergolten werden, und es soll ihnen kein Unrecht geschehen.
ref: Then every person shall be paid in full what he has earned, - and they shall not be dealt with unjustly.
draft: Then every soul shall be rewarded according to its merit, and no injustice shall be done to them.
hil: Then every soul shall be rewarded according to its merit, and no injustice shall be done to them.
compare: Then every soul shall be rewarded according to its merit, and no injustice shall be done to them.

src: Als Mose zu unserem Termin kam und sein Herr zu ihm sprach, sagte er: «Mein Herr, zeige (Dich) mir, daß ich zu Dir schaue.»
ref: When Moses arrived at the appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said: "O Lord, reveal Yourself to me that I may behold You."
draft: When Moses came to our appointment, and his master spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me that I may look upon You."
hil: When Moses came to our appointment and his master spoke to him, he said, 'My Lord, show me that I may look upon You.'
compare: When Moses came to our appointment, and his master spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me that I may look upon You."

src: Ist die Ermahnung unter uns nur zu ihm allein gekommen?" Nein, sie hegen Zweifel über Meine Er mahnung. Nein, sie haben Meine Strafe nicht gekostet.
ref: What, out of all of us, has the Remembrance been sent down to him (Prophet Muhammad)' No, they are doubtful about My Remembrance, no, they have not yet tasted My punishment.
draft: "Has the admonition only come to him alone among us?" No, they have doubts about my admonition. No, they have not tasted my punishment."
hil: Has the admonition come only to him among us alone? No, they have doubts about my admonition. No, they have not experienced my punishment.
compare: Has the admonition come only to him among us alone? No, they have doubts about my admonition. No, they have not experienced my punishment.

src: Dann lächelte er doch wegen ihrer Aussage und sagte: "Mein HERR!
ref: So he [Sulaiman (Solomon)] smiled, amused at her speech and said: "My Lord!
draft: Then he smiled because of her statement and said: "My LORD!
hil: Then he smiled at her statement and said, 'My Lord!'
compare: Then he smiled at her statement and said, 'My Lord!'

src: Ihr Menschen! Bereits kam zu euch doch eine Ermahnung von eurem HERRN, eine Heilung von dem, was in den Brüsten (an Zweifel) ist, eine Rechtleitung und eine Gnade für die Mumin.
ref: O men, a warning has come to you from your Lord, a remedy for the (doubts) of the heart, and a guidance and grace for those who believe.
draft: "Your people! Yet there has come to you an admonition from your Lord, a cure for what is in the hearts (doubts), guidance, and mercy for the believers."
hil: "O people! Indeed, there has come to you an admonition from your Lord, a cure for what is in the hearts (of doubts), guidance, and mercy for the believers."
compare: "Your people! Yet there has come to you an admonition from your Lord, a cure for what is in the hearts (doubts), guidance, and mercy for the believers."

src: Übertreibt nicht in eurem Din (und sagt nichts) außer der Wahrheit und folgt nicht den Neigungen von Leuten, die bereits vorher irregegangen sind, viele in die Irre verleitet haben und vom rechten Weg abgekommen sind."
ref: Do not wrongfully commit injustice in your religion, and do not follow the people who earlier went astray, and led many others astray, and wandered away from the Straight Path.”
draft: Do not exceed the limits in your religion (and say nothing) except the truth, and do not follow the inclinations of people who have already gone astray, led many astray and deviated from the right path.
hil: Do not exceed the limits in your religion (and say nothing) except for the truth, and do not follow the inclinations of people who have already gone astray, led many astray, and deviated from the right path.
compare: Do not exceed the limits in your religion (and say nothing) except the truth, and do not follow the inclinations of people who have already gone astray, led many astray and deviated from the right path.

src: Lasse die Kinder Isra'ils mit uns gehen, und strafe sie nicht.
ref: So let the children of Israel come with us, and do not oppress them.
draft: Let the children of Israel go with us and do not punish them.
hil: Let the children of Israel go with us and do not punish them.
compare: Let the children of Israel go with us and do not punish them.

src: O ihr, die ihr glaubt, kehrt zu Gott um in aufrichtiger Umkehr. Möge Gott euch eure Missetaten sühnen und euch in Gärten eingehen lassen, unter denen Bäche fließen, am Tag, da Gott den Propheten und die, die mit ihm gläubig sind, nicht zuschanden macht!
ref: O ye who believe! Turn to Allah with sincere repentance: In the hope that your Lord will remove from you your ills and admit you to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow,- the Day that Allah will not permit to be humiliated the Prophet and those who believe with him.
draft: O you who believe, turn to God in sincere repentance. May God atone for your sins and admit you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the Day when God will not cause the Prophet and those who believe with him to be disgraced!
hil: O you who believe, turn to God in sincere repentance. May God atone for your sins and admit you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the Day when God will not cause the Prophet and those who believe with him to be disgraced!
compare: O you who believe, turn to God in sincere repentance. May God atone for your sins and admit you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the Day when God will not cause the Prophet and those who believe with him to be disgraced!

src: Und die Himmel sind zusammengerollt mit Seiner Allmacht. Gepriesen-erhaben ist ER und immer höher über das, was sie an Schirk betreiben.
ref: Hallowed be He and Exalted above that which they associate.
draft: And the skies are rolled up with His omnipotence. He is exalted and always higher than what they practice in Schirk.
hil: Already there has been a sign for you, - two groups of differing nature that clashed. One group was fighting in the cause of Allah, the other was unbelieving. They saw with their own eyes that these (enemies) were twice their number. But Allah strengthens with His aid whom He pleases. Verily in this is a lesson for those who have eyes to see.
compare: And the skies are rolled up with His omnipotence. He is exalted and always higher than what they practice in Schirk.

src: (Erinnere daran), als er zum voll beladenen Schiff floh.
ref: When he fled on the laden ship,
draft: "Remind (him/her/yourself), when he fled to the fully loaded ship."
hil: Remember when he fled to the fully loaded ship.
compare: Remember when he fled to the fully loaded ship.

src: Das bewirkt es eher, daß ihr euch vor Ungerechtigkeit bewahrt.
ref: This is better than being iniquitous.
draft: This rather ensures that you protect yourself from injustice.
hil: The inhabitants of Medina and the Arabian Bedouins in their surroundings must not lag behind the Messenger of God and prefer themselves to him. This is because they do not suffer thirst, hardship, or hunger on the way of God, nor take a step that provokes the unbelievers to anger, nor inflict harm on an enemy without a good deed being recorded for them. God does not allow the reward of the righteous to be lost.
compare: This rather ensures that you protect yourself from injustice.

src: Darum esset davon und speist den Notleidenden, den Bedürftigen.
ref: So eat thereof, and feed the hungry poor.
draft: Therefore eat of it and give food to the needy, the destitute.
hil: Therefore eat of it and feed the needy, the destitute.
compare: Therefore eat of it and feed the needy, the destitute.

src: Und pflegt keinen Verkehr mit ihnen, während ihr euch in die Moscheen zurückgezogen habt.
ref: And do not have sexual relations with them (your wives) while you are in I'tikaf (i.e. confining oneself in a mosque for prayers and invocations leaving the worldly activities) in the mosques.
draft: And do not have any intercourse with them while you have withdrawn to the mosques.
hil: And do not have any contact with them while you have retreated to the mosques.
compare: And do not have any contact with them while you have retreated to the mosques.

src: Die bittere Armut und die Krankheit suchten sie heim und sie wurden erschüttert, bis der Gesandte und diejenigen mit ihm, die den Iman verinnerlicht haben, sagten: "Wann kommt ALLAHs Beistand?" Ja!
ref: Hardship and adversity befell them and they were shaken, to the extent that the Noble Messenger and the believers along with him said, “When will the help of Allah come?”; pay heed!
draft: The bitter poverty and the illness plagued them and they were shaken until the messenger and those with him who internalized the faith said, "When will Allah's help come?" Yes!
hil: The bitter poverty and illness plagued them and shook them until the messenger and those with him who had faith said, 'When will Allah's help come?' Yes!
compare: The bitter poverty and illness plagued them and shook them until the messenger and those with him who had faith said, 'When will Allah's help come?' Yes!
