src: Sie werden, wenn sie die Pein sehen, zu wissen bekommen, wer weiter vom Weg abgeirrt ist.
ref: They will know soon who is farther away from the path when they see the punishment!
draft: You will, when you see the pain, find out who has strayed further from the path.
hil: They will, when they see the pain, find out who has strayed further from the path.
compare: They will, when they see the pain, find out who has strayed further from the path.

src: Diejenigen, die nicht umkehren, sind die, die Unrecht tun.
ref: Those who do not repent behave wickedly.
draft: Those who do not repent are those who do wrong.
hil: Those who do not turn back are those who do wrong.
compare: Those who do not repent are those who do wrong.

src: Bereits ALLAH hat uns von euren Begebenheiten kundgetan. Und ALLAH wird eure Taten sehen sowie Sein Gesandter, dann werdet ihr zum Allwissenden über das Verborgene und das Sichtbare zurückgebracht, dann wird ER euch das kundtun, was ihr zu tun pflegtet.
ref: And God will watch your actions, and so will the Messenger; then you will be returned to the Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, and He will inform you of what you used to do.”
draft: Already ALLAH has informed us about your deeds. And ALLAH will see your actions as well as His Messenger, then you will be brought back to the All-Knowing about the Hidden and the Visible, then HE will inform you about what you used to do.
hil: Allah has already informed us about your deeds. And Allah will see your actions as well as His Messenger, then you will be brought back to the All-Knowing about the hidden and the visible and then He will inform you about what you used to do.
compare: Already ALLAH has informed us about your deeds. And ALLAH will see your actions as well as His Messenger, then you will be brought back to the All-Knowing about the Hidden and the Visible, then HE will inform you about what you used to do.

src: Das ist die Rede eines edlen Gesandten,
ref: That this is indeed the word of the noble Messenger,
draft: This is the speech of a noble messenger.
hil: This is the speech of a noble messenger.
compare: This is the speech of a noble messenger.

src: Und ihnen wurde kein Aufschub gewährt.
ref: They were granted no respite.
draft: And no postponement was granted to them.
hil: And they were not granted any postponement.
compare: And no postponement was granted to them.

src: Und sie riefen: "Malik! Laß deinen HERRN uns vernichten!" Er sagte: "Gewiß, ihr müsst bleiben."
ref: And they shall call, 'O
draft: "And they cried out, 'Malik! Let your Lord destroy us!' He said, 'Indeed, you shall stay.'"
hil: And they cried out, 'Malik! Let your Lord destroy us!' He said, 'Indeed, you must remain.'
compare: "And they cried out, 'Malik! Let your Lord destroy us!' He said, 'Indeed, you shall stay.'"

src: Alif Lam Ra. Dies sind die Zeichen des weisen Buches.
ref: Alif-Lam-Ra*; these are verses of the Book of wisdom. (*alphabets of the Arabic language; Allah and to whomever He reveals, know their precise meanings.)
draft: Alif Lam Ra. These are the signs of the wise book.
hil: Alif Lam Ra. These are the signs of the wise book.
compare: Alif Lam Ra. These are the signs of the wise book.

src: Diese sind unsere Leute, sie nahmen sich anstelle von Ihm Götter. Würden sie doch dafür eine klare Bestätigung vorlegen! Und keiner begeht noch mehr Unrecht als derjenige, der im Namen ALLAHs Lügen erfindet!
ref: These, our people, have taken for themselves gods beside Him - wherefore bring they not for them an authority manifest? --and who doth greater wrong than he who fabricateth against God a lie?
draft: These are our people, they took gods in place of Him. If only they could provide clear confirmation for that! And no one does more wrong than the one who invents lies in the name of Allah!
hil: These are our people, they took gods in place of Him. If only they could provide clear confirmation for that! And no one does more wrong than the one who invents lies in the name of Allah!
compare: These are our people, they took gods in place of Him. If only they could provide clear confirmation for that! And no one does more wrong than the one who invents lies in the name of Allah!

src: Da sprach Pharao: "Bringt mir einen jeden kundigen Zauberer herbei."
ref: "Bring the cleverest magicians to me," said the Pharaoh.
draft: Pharaoh said, "Bring me every skilled magician."
hil: Then Pharaoh said, "Bring me every skilled magician."
compare: Pharaoh said, "Bring me every skilled magician."

src: Ja! Nieder mit Madyan, wie es nieder mit Thamud war.
ref: Lo! a far removal for Madyan, even as Thamud were removed afar!
draft: Yes! Down with Midian, as it was down with Thamud.
hil: Yes! Bring down Midian, as (was done) with Thamud.
compare: Yes! Bring down Midian, as (was done) with Thamud.

src: Verzeihe uns, vergib uns und erbarme Dich unser!
ref: Pardon us and grant us Forgiveness.
draft: Forgive us, pardon us and have mercy on us!
hil: Forgive us, pardon us and have mercy on us!
compare: Forgive us, pardon us and have mercy on us!

src: So war es.
ref: Thus it was.
draft: So it was.
hil: Yes, it was like that.
compare: So it was.

src: Bring du sie vom Westen.»
ref: You make it come from the West."
draft: "Bring them from the West."
hil: Bring them from the west.
compare: Bring them from the west.

src: Erbärmlich ist der Fisq-Name nach dem Iman. Und wer nicht bereut, so sind diese die Unrecht-Begehenden.
ref: And whoever does not repent – then it is they who are unjust.
draft: The Fisq-name after the imam is pathetic. And those who do not repent are the wrongdoers.
hil: "pathetic" is the "Fisq-name" after the imam. And those who do not repent, they are the wrongdoers.
compare: The Fisq-name after the imam is pathetic. And those who do not repent are the wrongdoers.

src: ER ist unser Maula!"
ref: He is our Maula (Lord, Helper and Protector)."
draft: "He is our bully!"
hil: He is our bully!
compare: "He is our bully!"

src: Ihr habt doch keine Gottheit außer Ihm und mindert nicht das Maß und das Wiegen. Ich sehe doch, daß es euch gut geht, auch gewiß, ich fürchte um euch die Peinigung eines alles umfassenden Tages.
ref: Worship Allah, you have no other Ilah (God) but Him, and give not short measure or weight, I see you in prosperity; and verily I fear for you the torment of a Day encompassing.
draft: You have no deity other than Him, and do not reduce the weight or measure. I see that you are doing well, but I fear for you the punishment of an all-encompassing day.
hil: You have no deity other than Him, and do not reduce the weight or measure. I see that you are doing well, but I fear for you the punishment of an all-encompassing day.
compare: You have no deity other than Him, and do not reduce the weight or measure. I see that you are doing well, but I fear for you the punishment of an all-encompassing day.

src: Er sagte: "Kann ich ihn euch etwa anders anvertrauen, als ich euch seinen Bruder vorher anvertraut habe? Doch ALLAH ist Der beste Beschützer und ER ist Der Allgnädigste der Gnade-Erweisenden."
ref: He said: I intrust you with him only as I intrusted you with his brother aforetime; Allah is the best Guard, and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful.
draft: He said: "Can I entrust him to you in a different way than I entrusted his brother to you before? But ALLAH is the best protector and HE is the most merciful of those who show mercy."
hil: He said, "Can I entrust him to you any differently than I entrusted his brother to you before? But ALLAH is the best protector and HE is the most merciful of those who show mercy."
compare: He said: "Can I entrust him to you in a different way than I entrusted his brother to you before? But ALLAH is the best protector and HE is the most merciful of those who show mercy."

src: Diejenigen, die ungläubig waren, sagten zu ihren Gesandten: "Wir werden euch ganz gewiß aus unserem Land vertreiben, oder aber ihr kehrt zu unserem Glaubensbekenntnis zurück!"
ref: The unbelievers said to their apostles: "We shall drive you out of our land, or else you come back to our fold."
draft: Those who were unbelievers said to their messengers: "We will certainly drive you out of our land, or you must return to our creed!"
hil: The unbelievers said to their messengers: "We will certainly drive you out of our land, or you must return to our creed!"
compare: Those who were unbelievers said to their messengers: "We will certainly drive you out of our land, or you must return to our creed!"

src: Als sie kam, da wurde gesprochen: "Ist dein Thron wie dieser?" Sie sagte: "Es ist, als wäre er ein und derselbe." Und uns wurde (davon) Wissen, schon vor ihr, verliehen; und wir hatten uns bereits (Allah) ergeben.
ref: And when she came she was asked: 'Is your throne like this' And she replied: 'It looks like it' And we were given the knowledge before her, and wereMuslims.
draft: When she arrived, it was said: "Is your throne like this?" She said, "It is as if it were the same." And knowledge had already been given to us before her, and we had already submitted to Allah.
hil: When she arrived, it was said: 'Is your throne like this?' She said, 'It is as if it were the same.' And knowledge had already been given to us before her, and we had already submitted to Allah.
compare: When she arrived, it was said: "Is your throne like this?" She said, "It is as if it were the same." And knowledge had already been given to us before her, and we had already submitted to Allah.

src: Am Tag, an dem Wir den Himmel zusammenfalten, wie das Urkundenbuch die Schriftstücke zusammenfaltet. Wie Wir eine erste Schöpfung am Anfang gemacht haben, wiederholen Wir sie.
ref: The day We shall roll up the heavens like a written scroll, We shall revert it (to nothing) as it was before We first created it.
draft: On the day on which we fold the sky together like the deed books fold the documents, we repeat the first creation that we made in the beginning.
hil: On the day when We shall roll up the heavens like a scroll rolled up for books, as We began the first creation, We shall repeat it.
compare: On the day on which we fold the sky together like the deed books fold the documents, we repeat the first creation that we made in the beginning.

src: Und den Juden haben Wir alles Getier untersagt, das Krallen hat; und von den Rindern und vom Kleinvieh haben Wir ihnen das Fett verboten, ausgenommen das, was an ihrem Rücken sitzt oder in den Eingeweiden oder mit den Knochen verwachsen ist. Damit haben Wir ihnen ihre Auflehnung vergolten. Und siehe, Wir sind Wahrhaftig.
ref: And for the Jews We forbade all animals with claws; and forbade them the fat of oxen and sheep except which is on their backs or joined to their intestines or to the bone; We awarded this to them for their rebellion; and indeed, surely, We are truthful.
draft: And We have forbidden to the Jews all animals with claws, and from the cattle and sheep We have forbidden them fat, except what is on their backs or entrails or mixed with bone. This is a penalty We have given them for their rebellion. And indeed, We are truthful.
hil: We made unlawful for the Jews all animals with claws or nails, and the fat of the oxen and sheep, except that on their backs, their intestines, or those which remains attached to their bones. This is the penalty We have given them for their rebellion. And indeed, We are truthful.
compare: And We have forbidden to the Jews all animals with claws, and from the cattle and sheep We have forbidden them fat, except what is on their backs or entrails or mixed with bone. This is a penalty We have given them for their rebellion. And indeed, We are truthful.

src: Sind diese (Mumin) etwa diejenigen, von denen ihr geschworen habt, daß ALLAH ihnen keinerlei Gnade erweisen würde?!
ref: “Are these the people (Muslims) regarding whom you swore that Allah would not have mercy on them at all?
draft: Are these (Moomin) the ones about whom you swore that ALLAH would not show them any mercy?!
hil: Is it these (Moomin) who you swore ALLAH would not show any mercy to?
compare: Are these (Moomin) the ones about whom you swore that ALLAH would not show them any mercy?!

src: Und ermahne damit diejenigen, die fürchten, zu ihrem HERRN versammelt zu werden, während es für sie (dabei) anstelle von Ihm weder Wali noch Fürbittenden gibt, damit sie Taqwa gemäß handeln.
ref: Warn those who fear, through this (Qur'an), that they will be gathered before their Lord, and they will have none to protect or intercede for them apart from Him. They may haply take heed for themselves.
draft: And thereby remind those who fear to be gathered to their Lord that for them there is no ally or intercessor other than Him, that they may become righteous.
hil: And thereby remind those who fear to be gathered to their Lord that for them there is no ally or intercessor other than Him, that they may become righteous.
compare: And thereby remind those who fear to be gathered to their Lord that for them there is no ally or intercessor other than Him, that they may become righteous.

src: Und gewiß, wir sind doch wahrhaftig."
ref: We are verily speaking the truth.'"
draft: And certainly, we are truly."
hil: And surely, we are indeed truthful.
compare: And surely, we are indeed truthful.

src: Wenn euch Gutes trifft, werden sie traurig. Wenn euch jedoch Übel überkommt, freuen sie sich darüber. Doch wenn ihr euch in Geduld übt und Taqwa gemäß handelt, wird ihre Heimtücke euch nicht im Geringsten schaden. Gewiß, ALLAH ist dessen, was sie tun, (mit Seinem Wissen) allumfassend.
ref: If good comes your way, they are vexed; but if evil befalls you they are pleased and rejoice; yet if you are patient and guard yourselves against evil, their cunning will not harm you in the least, for whatsoever they do is well within the reach of God.
draft: If something good happens to you, they feel sad, but if something bad happens to you, they rejoice. However, if you are patient and act in accordance with taqwa, their scheming will not harm you in the least. Surely, Allah encompasses their actions (with His knowledge).
hil: If something good happens to you, they feel sad, but if something bad happens to you, they rejoice. However, if you are patient and act in accordance with taqwa, their scheming will not harm you in the least. Surely, Allah encompasses their actions (with His knowledge).
compare: If something good happens to you, they feel sad, but if something bad happens to you, they rejoice. However, if you are patient and act in accordance with taqwa, their scheming will not harm you in the least. Surely, Allah encompasses their actions (with His knowledge).

src: Darin werden sie auf immer ewig weilen.
ref: Which they will enjoy for ever.
draft: They will dwell there forever and ever.
hil: They will dwell there forever and ever.
compare: They will dwell there forever and ever.

src: Dies ist für das, was ihr euch erworben habt. Und gewiß ist ALLAH den Dienern in keiner Weise ein Unrecht- Zufügender."
ref: “This is the recompense of what your own hands have sent ahead, and Allah does not oppress His bondmen.”
draft: This is for what you have earned. And indeed, Allah does not wrong the servants in any way.
hil: This is for what you have earned. And indeed, Allah does not wrong the servants in any way.
compare: This is for what you have earned. And indeed, Allah does not wrong the servants in any way.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Nehmt kein Riba in vervielfacht verdoppelter Höhe ein, und handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber, damit ihr erfolgreich seid.
ref: O you who believe, do not practice usury, charging doubled and redoubled (interest); but have fear of God: you may well attain your goal.
draft: You, who have internalized the Iman! Do not take any Riba in multiplied or doubled amounts, and act according to Taqwa towards ALLAH, so that you may be successful.
hil: O believers, do not take any Riba in multiplied or doubled amounts, and fear ALLAH so that you may be successful.
compare: O believers, do not take any Riba in multiplied or doubled amounts, and fear ALLAH so that you may be successful.

src: denjenigen, deren Leben die Engel beenden, während sie rein sind. Sie (die Engel) sagen: "Salam sei mit euch, tretet in Dschanna ein wegen dem, was ihr zu tun pflegtet."
ref: When the angels receive the souls of those who are blameless they will say: "Peace on you. Enter Paradise as recompense for what you did."
draft: Those whose lives the angels end while they are pure. They (the angels) say: "Peace be upon you, enter Paradise because of what you used to do."
hil: Those whose lives the angels end while they are pure. They (the angels) say: "Peace be upon you, enter Paradise because of what you used to do."
compare: Those whose lives the angels end while they are pure. They (the angels) say: "Peace be upon you, enter Paradise because of what you used to do."

src: Sag: "Ich suche Schutz bei Dem HERRN des Morgengrauens
ref: SAY: "I SEEK refuge with the Lord of rising day
draft: Say: "I seek refuge in the Lord of the Dawn."
hil: Say: 'I seek refuge in the Lord of the Dawn.'
compare: Say: "I seek refuge in the Lord of the Dawn."

src: Durch sie gewinnt ihr Wärme und (andere) Produkte. Und ihr ernährt euch von ihnen.
ref: He hath created them. For you in them there is warmth and other profits and of them ye eat.
draft: Through them, you gain warmth and (other) products. And you nourish yourselves from them.
hil: Through them, you gain warmth and (other) products. And you nourish yourselves from them.
compare: Through them, you gain warmth and (other) products. And you nourish yourselves from them.

src: Und wenn ihr den Iman und Taqwa verinnerlicht, läßt er euch eure Belohnung zuteil werden und verlangt von euch nicht euer Vermögen.
ref: If you believe and fear God, he will give you your reward, and will not ask for your possessions.
draft: And if you internalize the iman and taqwa, he will grant you your reward and will not demand your property from you.
hil: If you internalize the iman and taqwa, he will grant you your reward and will not demand your property from you.
compare: And if you internalize the iman and taqwa, he will grant you your reward and will not demand your property from you.

src: Diejenigen von den Leuten des Buches und von den Polytheisten, die nicht glauben, mögen es nicht gern, daß auf euch etwas Gutes von eurem Herrn herabgesandt wird. Gott aber schenkt seine Barmherzigkeit in besonderer Weise, wem Er will. Und Gott besitzt große Huld.
ref: Those who disbelieve – the People given the Book(s) or the polytheists – do not wish that any good be sent down upon you from your Lord; and Allah chooses whomever He wills by His Mercy; and Allah is the Most Munificent.
draft: Those of the people of the Book and the polytheists who disbelieve do not like good to be sent down to you from your Lord. But Allah selects for His mercy whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
hil: Those without faith among the people of the Book and those who worship idols do not wish that good should come to you from your Lord. But God chooses whom He likes for His grace, and the bounty of God is infinite.
compare: Those of the people of the Book and the polytheists who disbelieve do not like good to be sent down to you from your Lord. But Allah selects for His mercy whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.

src: Also manche von ihnen sind rechtgeleitet, und viele von ihnen sind Fasiq.
ref: Then of them some are guided ones, and many of them are transgressors.
draft: Some of them are guided, and many of them are rebellious.
hil: Some of them are guided, and many of them are rebellious.
compare: Some of them are guided, and many of them are rebellious.

src: Und gewiß, bereits vor dir wurden Gesandte der Lüge bezichtigt, so haben sie sich in Geduld geübt für das, weswegen sie der Lüge bezichtigt wurden und ihnen Schaden zugefügt wurde, bis Unser Sieg ihnen zuteil wurde. Und es gibt keinen, der ALLAHs Versprechen abändern kann.
ref: Rejected were the messengers before thee: with patience and constancy they bore their rejection and their wrongs, until Our aid did reach them: there is none that can alter the words (and decrees) of Allah.
draft: And indeed, messengers before you have already been accused of falsehood, but they were patient in the face of what they were accused of and the harm that was inflicted upon them until Our victory came to them. And there is no one who can alter the promise of Allah.
hil: And indeed, messengers before you have already been accused of falsehood, but they were patient in the face of what they were accused of and the harm that was inflicted upon them until Our victory came to them. And there is no one who can alter the promise of Allah.
compare: And indeed, messengers before you have already been accused of falsehood, but they were patient in the face of what they were accused of and the harm that was inflicted upon them until Our victory came to them. And there is no one who can alter the promise of Allah.

src: So (war es).
ref: Thus (it was)!
draft: So (it was).
hil: So it was.
compare: So (it was).

src: Sprich: Ob ihr das geheimhaltet, was in eurem Inneren ist, oder es offenlegt, Gott weiß es.
ref: Say: 'Whether you hide what is in your breasts or publish it, God knows it.
draft: Speak: Whether you conceal what is in your innermost being or reveal it, God knows it.
hil: Say: Whether you conceal what is in your innermost being or reveal it, God knows it.
compare: Speak: Whether you conceal what is in your innermost being or reveal it, God knows it.

src: Aber dann, am Tag der Auferstehung verleugnet ihr einander und verflucht ihr einander.
ref: But then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will disown one another, and curse one another.
draft: But then, on the day of resurrection, you deny each other and curse each other.
hil: And then, on the Day of Resurrection, you deny each other and curse each other.
compare: But then, on the day of resurrection, you deny each other and curse each other.

src: Und WIR schmückten den untersten Himmel mit Lampen und Bewahrendem.
ref: And We adorned the nearest (lowest) heaven with lamps (stars) to be an adornment as well as to guard (from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils).
draft: And WE adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and preservation.
hil: And WE adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and preservation.
compare: And WE adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and preservation.

src: So ertrage geduldig, was sie sagen, und lobpreise deinen Herrn vor dem Aufgang der Sonne und vor dem (Sonnen-)untergang
ref: So you bear with patience what they say, and sing the praises of your Lord before the rising of the sun and its setting,
draft: So bear patiently what they say, and praise your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting.
hil: Bear patiently what they say, and glorify your Lord before the rising of the sun and before the setting.
compare: Bear patiently what they say, and glorify your Lord before the rising of the sun and before the setting.

src: O die ihr glaubt, berauschender Trank, Glücksspiel, Opfersteine und Lospfeile sind nur ein Greuel vom Werk des Satans.
ref: O believers, this wine and gambling, these idols, and these arrows you use for divination, are all acts of Satan; so keep away from them.
draft: O ye who believe, intoxicating drinks, gambling, idolatrous sacrifices and divining arrows are abominations devised by Satan.
hil: O you who believe, intoxicating drinks, gambling, idolatrous sacrifices and divining arrows are abominations devised by Satan so that you may know that God is knowledgeable in all things.
compare: O ye who believe, intoxicating drinks, gambling, idolatrous sacrifices and divining arrows are abominations devised by Satan.

src: Diese jedoch lehrten niemanden, ohne zu sagen: «Wir sind nur eine Versuchung, so werde nicht ungläubig.»
ref: They learnt what led to discord between husband and wife.
draft: However, they taught no one without saying, "We are only a temptation, so do not become disbelievers."
hil: But they taught no one without saying, 'We are only a temptation, so do not become disbelievers.'
compare: However, they taught no one without saying, "We are only a temptation, so do not become disbelievers."

src: Und wer dies tut, der fügt sich selbst Unrecht zu.
ref: He who does so will wrong himself.
draft: And whoever does this, wrongs himself.
hil: And whoever does this wrongs himself.
compare: And whoever does this, wrongs himself.

src: Sie sagen: «Die Wahrheit.» Und Er ist der Erhabene, der Große.
ref: They say, “All that He has proclaimed is the Truth; and He is the Supreme, the Great.”
draft: They say, "The truth." And He is the Exalted, the Great.
hil: They say, 'The truth.' And He is the Exalted, the Great.
compare: They say, "The truth." And He is the Exalted, the Great.

src: Und WIR prüften sie mit gottgefälligen guten Taten und mit den gottmißfälligen Taten, damit sie umkehren.
ref: And We tried them with good (blessings) and evil (calamities) in order that they might turn (to Allah's Obedience).
draft: And WE tested them with good deeds pleasing to God and with deeds displeasing to God, so that they may repent.
hil: We tested them with good deeds pleasing to God and with deeds displeasing to God, so that they may repent.
compare: And WE tested them with good deeds pleasing to God and with deeds displeasing to God, so that they may repent.

src: Wenn Er damit die von seinen Dienern, die Er will, trifft, da sind sie froh,
ref: Then, when He makes it fall upon whom He wills of His servants, behold, they rejoice.
draft: If He thus meets those of His servants whom He wills, they are happy.
hil: "To Him is your return, all together - a true promise from Allah. Indeed, He initiates the creation, then repeats it, so that He may reward those who internalized faith and did good deeds in a fair manner. But for those who committed unbelief, there is a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment for what they used to do."
compare: If He thus meets those of His servants whom He wills, they are happy.

src: Für die Ungläubigen nicht leicht.
ref: Dolorous for the unbelievers.
draft: Not easy for unbelievers.
hil: Not easy for unbelievers.
compare: Not easy for unbelievers.

src: Und sie schreien darin laut: "Unser Herr, bringe uns heraus, so werden wir rechtschaffen handeln, anders als das, was wir zu tun pflegten." - "Haben Wir euch nicht ein so langes Leben gewährt, daß jeder, der hätte bedenken wollen, darin hätte bedenken können? Und ist nicht der Warner zu euch gekommen?
ref: And they will cry out therein, "Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!" But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you?
draft: And they cry out loud in it: "Our Lord, bring us out, and we will act righteously, other than what we used to do." - "Did We not grant you such a long life that anyone who would have thought could have thought in it? And has not the Warner come to you?
hil: They cry out loudly in it: 'Our Lord, bring us out, and we will act righteously, differently than what we used to do.' - 'Did we not grant you such a long life that anyone who would have thought could have thought in it? And has not the Warner come to you?'
compare: And they cry out loud in it: "Our Lord, bring us out, and we will act righteously, other than what we used to do." - "Did We not grant you such a long life that anyone who would have thought could have thought in it? And has not the Warner come to you?

src: Bringt mir Eisenstücke!" Als er dann (die Lücke) zwischen den beiden Wallabhängen auf gleicher Höhe zuschütten ließ, sagte er: "Blast!"
ref: Bring me ingots of iron," (which they did) until the space between two mountain sides was filled up.
draft: "Bring me pieces of iron!" When he then had (the gap) filled in at the same height between the two slopes, he said: "Blow!"
hil: "Bring me pieces of iron!" When he then had (the gap) filled in at the same height between the two slopes, he said, "Blow!"
compare: "Bring me pieces of iron!" When he then had (the gap) filled in at the same height between the two slopes, he said: "Blow!"

src: Und verrichtet das Gebet und entrichtet die Abgabe.
ref: Fulfil your devotional obligations and pay the zakat.
draft: And perform the prayer and give the alms.
hil: And establish prayer and pay the alms.
compare: And perform the prayer and give the alms.

src: Darin hören sie nichts Unnützes - (sie hören) nur den Salam-Gruß! Und ihnen ist ihre Versorgung darin morgens und abends gesichert!
ref: They will hear no vain talk there, but only salutations of peace, and they will have their sustenance morning and evening."
draft: They don't hear anything useless in it - they only hear the Salam greeting! And their provision is secured in it morning and evening!
hil: They hear nothing useless in it - they only hear the Salam greeting! And their provision is ensured in it both in the morning and in the evening!
compare: They hear nothing useless in it - they only hear the Salam greeting! And their provision is ensured in it both in the morning and in the evening!

src: Gewiß, bereits haben WIR Nuh zu seinen Leuten entsandt, dann sagte er: "Meine Leute!
ref: Indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people and he said: "O my people!
draft: Certainly, we have already sent Noah to his people, then he said: "My people!
hil: Surely, we have already sent Noah to his people, then he said: "My people!
compare: Certainly, we have already sent Noah to his people, then he said: "My people!

src: Sie sagten: "Salih! Bereits hast du unter uns Vertrauen vor dieser (Aufforderung) genossen.
ref: They said, 'Salih, thou hast hitherto been a source of hope among us.
draft: They said: "Salih! You have already enjoyed trust among us before this (request)."
hil: They said, "Salih! You have already enjoyed trust among us before this (request)."
compare: They said, "Salih! You have already enjoyed trust among us before this (request)."

src: Und wer Kufr betreibt ALLAH, Seinen Engeln, Seinen Schriften, Seinen Gesandten und dem Jüngsten Tag gegenüber, der ist bereits weit in die Irre gegangen.
ref: But he who believes not in God and His angels and the Books and the prophets and the Last Day, has wandered far away.
draft: And whoever engages in disbelief [i.e. Kufr] regarding Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Last Day has certainly misguided himself.
hil: And whoever rejects faith in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers and the Last Day, has already gone far astray.
compare: And whoever engages in disbelief [i.e. Kufr] regarding Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Last Day has certainly misguided himself.

src: Gewiß, Wir haben um ihre Hälse Fesseln gelegt.
ref: We have enchained their necks up to their chins.
draft: "Indeed, we have put shackles around their necks."
hil: Indeed, We have put shackles around their necks.
compare: Indeed, We have put shackles around their necks.

src: Das sind die, für die es die guten Dinge geben wird, und das sind diejenigen, denen es wohl ergeht.
ref: These are they for whom are goods, and these: they are the blissful.
draft: These are the ones for whom there will be good things, and these are the ones who will fare well.
hil: These are the ones for whom good things will be given, and these are those who will be well-off.
compare: These are the ones for whom there will be good things, and these are the ones who will fare well.

src: und ehrerbietig gegen meine Mutter (zu sein); Er hat mich nicht gewalttätig und unselig gemacht.
ref: And be dutiful to my mother. He has not made me haughty or rebellious.
draft: And to be respectful to my mother; he did not make me violent and unhappy.
hil: To be respectful to my mother; he did not make me violent and miserable.
compare: To be respectful to my mother; he did not make me violent and miserable.

src: Dies ist besser für euch und reiner. Und wenn ihr (es) nicht vermögt, also gewiß, ALLAH ist allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: Yet if you find not means, God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
draft: This is better for you and purer. And if you are not capable, then surely Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
hil: This is better for you and purer. And if you are not able, then surely Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
compare: This is better for you and purer. And if you are not capable, then surely Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.

src: Bei Gott steht ein großartiger Lohn bereit.
ref: Indeed God has greater rewards with Him.
draft: A great reward awaits with God.
hil: Indeed, a great reward awaits with God.
compare: Indeed, a great reward awaits with God.

src: Dann gaben Wir ihn seiner Mutter zurück, damit ihr Auge mit Freude erfüllt würde und damit sie sich nicht grämte und damit sie wüßte, daß Allahs Verheißung wahr sei. Jedoch die meisten von ihnen wissen es nicht.
ref: Thus We restored him to his mother that she may be tranquil and not grieve, and know that the promise of God is true, though most men do not know.
draft: Then We returned him to his mother, so her eye would be filled with joy and she would not grieve, and that she would know that Allah's promise is true. But most of them do not know.
hil: We restored him to his mother that she might be comforted and not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of them do not know.
compare: We restored him to his mother that she might be comforted and not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of them do not know.

src: Doch wahrlich, er (Jesus) ist ein Vorzeichen der Stunde.
ref: He is certainly the sign of the Hour (of change).
draft: But truly, he (Jesus) is a sign of the hour.
hil: But surely he (Jesus) is a sign of the hour.
compare: But truly, he (Jesus) is a sign of the hour.

src: Aber nein! Ihr werdet es bald erfahren.
ref: But you will come to know soon; --
draft: But no! You will soon find out.
hil: Oh no! You will soon find out.
compare: But no! You will soon find out.

src: Und sie haben gesagt: .Verlaßt doch nicht eure Götter; verlaßt doch nicht Wadd, noch Suwa", noch Yagut,Ya'uq und Nasr.'
ref: And said: 'Do not abandon your gods, and do not abandon Wadda or Suwa', or Yaghuth, Ya'uq or Nasr.'
draft: "They said: 'Do not leave your gods; do not leave Wadd, nor Suwa', nor Yagut, Ya'uq and Nasr.'"
hil: And they said: 'Do not abandon your gods; do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa', nor Yagut, Ya'uq, and Nasr.'
compare: "They said: 'Do not leave your gods; do not leave Wadd, nor Suwa', nor Yagut, Ya'uq and Nasr.'"

src: "Unser Herr, belange uns nicht, wenn wir (etwas) vergessen oder einen Fehler begehen. Unser Herr, lege uns keine Bürde auf, wie Du sie denjenigen vor uns auferlegt hast.
ref: Do not seize us if we forget or are mistaken; our Lord!
draft: "Our Lord, do not blame us if we forget something or make a mistake. Our Lord, do not burden us as you have burdened those before us."
hil: Our Lord, do not hold us responsible if we forget or fall into error. Our Lord, do not burden us as You burdened those before us.
compare: Our Lord, do not hold us responsible if we forget or fall into error. Our Lord, do not burden us as You burdened those before us.

src: Und so erweckten Wir sie auf, damit sie sich gegenseitig fragten. Einer von ihnen sagte: "Wie lange habt ihr verweilt?" Sie sagten: "Verweilt haben wir einen Tag oder den Teil eines Tages." Sie sagten: "Euer Herr weiß am besten, wie (lange) ihr verweilt habt. So schickt einen von euch mit diesen euren Silbermünzen in die Stadt; er soll sehen, welche ihre reinste Speise ist, und euch davon eine Versorgung bringen. Er soll behutsam sein und ja niemanden etwas von euch merken lassen.
ref: And similarly We awakened them so that they may enquire about each other; a speaker among them said, “How long have you stayed here?” Some among them said, “We have stayed a day or part of a day”; the others said, “Your Lord well knows how long you have stayed; therefore send one of you to the city with this silver coin – he may then check which food available there is purer, in order to bring some of it for you to eat – and he must be courteous and not inform anyone about you.”
draft: And so we woke them up so that they could ask each other. One of them said, "How long have you stayed?" They said, "We stayed for a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord knows best how long you stayed. So send one of you with these silver coins into the city, and have him find out which food is purest there, and bring you some of it." Let him be careful and not reveal your identity to anyone.
hil: And so we woke them up so that they could ask each other. One of them said, "How long have you stayed?" They said, "We stayed for a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord knows best how long you stayed. So send one of you with these silver coins into the city, and have him find out which food is purest there, and bring you some of it." Let him be careful and not reveal your identity to anyone.
compare: And so we woke them up so that they could ask each other. One of them said, "How long have you stayed?" They said, "We stayed for a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord knows best how long you stayed. So send one of you with these silver coins into the city, and have him find out which food is purest there, and bring you some of it." Let him be careful and not reveal your identity to anyone.

src: An jenem Tag gehört die Königsherrschaft Gott (allein). Er wird zwischen ihnen urteilen. Dann werden diejenigen, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, in den Gärten der Wonne sein.
ref: For Allah only is the kingship on that day; He will judge between them; so those who believed and did good deeds are in Gardens of content.
draft: On that day, the sovereignty belongs (solely) to God. He will judge between them. Then those who believe and do good works will be in the gardens of bliss.
hil: On that day, the sovereignty belongs (solely) to God. He will judge between them. Then those who believe and do good works will be in the gardens of bliss.
compare: On that day, the sovereignty belongs (solely) to God. He will judge between them. Then those who believe and do good works will be in the gardens of bliss.

src: Und wäre nicht über euch Allahs Huld und Seine Barmherzigkeit, nicht einer von euch wäre rein geworden; doch Allah macht rein, wen Er will.
ref: Were it not for God’s grace towards you, and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever. But God purifies whomever He wills.
draft: And were it not for Allah's grace and His mercy upon you, not one of you would have been pure, but Allah purifies whom He wills.
hil: "If it were not for the grace and mercy of Allah upon you, none of you would have become pure, but Allah purifies whom He wills."
compare: And were it not for Allah's grace and His mercy upon you, not one of you would have been pure, but Allah purifies whom He wills.

src: Und ALLAH ist immer über alles allmächtig.
ref: God is powerful over everything.
draft: And Allah is always omnipotent above all.
hil: Allah is always omnipotent above all.
compare: Allah is always omnipotent above all.

src: Auch kennt ER, was auf dem Festland und was im Meer ist.
ref: He knows what is in land and sea; not a leaf falls, but He knows it.
draft: Also, HE knows what is on the mainland and what is in the sea.
hil: Our Lord knows what is on the land and in the sea.
compare: Our Lord knows what is on the land and in the sea.

src: Sagen sie: "Wir teilten Dir mit, keiner von uns ist Zeuge."
ref: They will answer: "We profess to You not one of us can vouch for them."
draft: They say: "We informed you that none of us is a witness."
hil: They say: 'We informed you that none of us is a witness.'
compare: They say: "We informed you that none of us is a witness."

src: Und er sagte: «O meine Söhne, geht nicht durch ein einziges Tor hinein.
ref: And he said: O my sons!
draft: "And he said, 'O my sons, do not enter through a single gate.'"
hil: And he said, 'O my sons, do not enter through a single gate.'
compare: "And he said, 'O my sons, do not enter through a single gate.'"

src: Auch der Warner kam zu euch. Also erfahrt (die Peinigung)!
ref: To you the warner came; taste you now!
draft: Also the Warner came to you. So (know the torment)!
hil: "The Warner came to you. So find out the punishment!"
compare: "The Warner came to you. So find out the punishment!"

src: (Dies ist) eine Offenbarung von Ihm, Der die Erde und die hohen Himmel erschuf.
ref: A revelation from Him who created the earth and the high ascending skies,
draft: (This is) a revelation from Him who created the earth and the lofty heavens.
hil: This is a revelation from Him who created the earth and the lofty heavens.
compare: (This is) a revelation from Him who created the earth and the lofty heavens.

src: Und gebt ihnen etwas vom Vermögen Gottes, das Er euch gegeben hat. Und zwingt nicht eure Sklavinnen, wenn sie sich unter Schutz stellen wollen, zur Hurerei im Trachten nach den Gütern des diesseitigen Lebens.
ref: And constrain not your slave-girls to prostitution, if they desire to live in chastity, that you may seek the chance goods of the present life.
draft: And give them something out of the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life.
hil: Give them something out of the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution if they desire chastity, to seek thereby the temporary interests of worldly life.
compare: And give them something out of the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life.

src: Er hört alles und ist nahe.
ref: He is all-hearing and all-too-near."
draft: He hears everything and is close.
hil: He hears all and is near.
compare: He hears everything and is close.

src: Und in der Morgendämmerung baten sie um Vergebung,
ref: And every morning asked forgiveness,
draft: And at dawn they asked for forgiveness.
hil: And at dawn they asked for forgiveness.
compare: And at dawn they asked for forgiveness.

src: Weder darf die Sonne den Mond einholen, noch kommt die Nacht dem Tag zuvor.
ref: It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor does the night outstrip the day.
draft: Neither may the sun catch up with the moon, nor does the night come before the day.
hil: Neither should the sun catch up with the moon, nor should the night come before the day.
compare: Neither may the sun catch up with the moon, nor does the night come before the day.

src: Ihr dient anstatt Allahs nur Götzen und schafft (dabei nur) ungeheuerliche Lüge.
ref: You worship idols in place of God and invent lies.
draft: You serve nothing but idols instead of Allah and (thereby) create only monstrous lies.
hil: You serve only idols instead of Allah and thus create monstrous lies.
compare: You serve only idols instead of Allah and thus create monstrous lies.

src: Und Wir ließen ihn all unsere Zeichen schauen, aber er erklärte (sie) für Lüge und weigerte sich.
ref: So We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused,
draft: And We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused.
hil: And We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused.
compare: And We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused.

src: An jenem Tag trifft (die Stunde) ein, die eintreffen wird,
ref: On that Day will come what is to come.
draft: On that day arrives (the hour) that will arrive.
hil: On that day the hour will come that will arrive.
compare: On that day the hour will come that will arrive.

src: Er (David) sagte: "Wahrlich, er hat ein Unrecht an dir verübt, als er dein Mutterschaf zu seinen eigenen Mutterschafen hinzu verlangte. Und gewiß, viele Teilhaber vergehen sich gegeneinander; nur die (sind davon) ausgenommen, die glauben und gute Werke tun; und das sind wenige." Und David merkte, daß Wir ihn auf die Probe gestellt hatten; also bat er seinen Herrn um Verzeihung und fiel betend nieder und bekehrte sich.
ref: He said: Surely he has been unjust to you in demanding your ewe (to add) to his own ewes; and most surely most of the partners act wrongfully towards one another, save those who believe and do good, and very few are they; and Dawood was sure that We had tried him, so he sought the protection of his Lord and he fell down bowing and turned time after time (to Him).
draft: He (David) said: "Truly, he has wronged you by demanding to add your ewe to his own ewes. And certainly many partners wrong one another; except those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David realized that We had tried him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance.
hil: He (David) said: "Truly, he has wronged you by demanding to add your ewe to his own ewes. And certainly many partners wrong one another; except those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David realized that We had tried him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance.
compare: He (David) said: "Truly, he has wronged you by demanding to add your ewe to his own ewes. And certainly many partners wrong one another; except those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David realized that We had tried him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance.

src: Sag: "Gibt es unter den von euch (ALLAH) beigesellten Partnern einen, der zur Wahrheit rechtleitet?" Sag: "ALLAH leitet zur Wahrheit recht!"
ref: Say: 'Do any of your partners guide you to the truth' Say: 'Allah, He guides to the truth.
draft: Say, "Is there among those you associate with Allah any who guides to the truth?" Say, "Allah guides to the truth indeed!"
hil: Say, "Is there among those you associate with Allah any who guides to the truth?" Say, "Allah guides to the truth indeed!"
compare: Say, "Is there among those you associate with Allah any who guides to the truth?" Say, "Allah guides to the truth indeed!"

src: Und wer krank oder auf Reisen war, (fastet) an anderen Tagen die gleiche Anzahl.
ref: Whoever of you witnesses the month, shall fast it.
draft: And whoever was sick or traveling, fasts the same number on other days.
hil: If someone was sick or on a journey, they should fast the same number of days on other occasions.
compare: If someone was sick or on a journey, they should fast the same number of days on other occasions.

src: ER wird sie doch in einen Eingang eingehen lassen, an dem sie Wohlgefallen finden werden. Und gewiß, ALLAH ist zweifelsohne allwissend, allnachsichtig.
ref: He will certainly admit them to a place they will love; and indeed Allah is All Knowing, Most Forbearing.
draft: He will indeed allow them to enter a entrance in which they will find pleasure. And surely, Allah is undoubtedly all-knowing, all-forgiving.
hil: He will indeed let them enter an entrance in which they will find pleasure. And certainly, Allah is undoubtedly all-knowing, all-forgiving.
compare: He will indeed allow them to enter a entrance in which they will find pleasure. And surely, Allah is undoubtedly all-knowing, all-forgiving.

src: Da ergriff Ich sie.
ref: Then I seized them.
draft: I grabbed her.
hil: I grabbed her.
compare: I grabbed her.

src: Habt ihr das Was ser betrachtet, das ihr trinkt?
ref: Consider the water that you drink.
draft: Have you considered the water you are drinking?
hil: Have you considered the water you are drinking?
compare: Have you considered the water you are drinking?

src: enn sie so glauben, wie ihr glaubt, dann werden sie rechtgeleitet sein; wenn sie sich aber abwenden, so sind sie nur in Abspaltung geraten.
ref: So if they believe in the like of that which ye believe in, surely they are guided; but if they turn away, then they are but in Cleavage.
draft: If they believe as you believe, they will be guided to the right path; but if they turn away, they will only have fallen into divergence.
hil: "If they believe as you believe, they will be guided to the right path; but if they turn away, they will only have fallen into divergence."
compare: If they believe as you believe, they will be guided to the right path; but if they turn away, they will only have fallen into divergence.

src: Sie sagten: "Wir ahnen Böses von dir und von denen, die mit dir sind." Er sagte: "Euer Unheil ist bereits bei Allah. Nein, ihr seid ein Volk, das geprüft wird."
ref: They said, “We consider you an evil omen, and your companions”; he said, “Your evil omen is with Allah – in fact you people have fallen into trial.”
draft: They said, "We suspect evil from you and those who are with you." He said, "Your calamity is already with Allah. No, you are a people who are being tested."
hil: They said, 'We suspect evil from you and those who are with you.' He said, 'Your calamity is already with Allah. No, you are a people who are being tested.'
compare: They said, "We suspect evil from you and those who are with you." He said, "Your calamity is already with Allah. No, you are a people who are being tested."

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Entsinnt euch der Gabe ALLAHs euch gegenüber, als ein Volk euch Schaden zufügen wollte und ER sie von euch abgehalten hat. Und handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber. Und ALLAH gegenüber sollen die Mumin Tawakkul üben!
ref: O believers, remember God's blessing upon you, when a certain people purposed to stretch against you their hands, and He restrained their hands from you; and fear God; and in God let the believers put all their trust.
draft: You who have internalized the Imam! Remember the gift of Allah to you when a people wanted to harm you and He prevented them from doing so. And act according to taqwa towards Allah. And the faithful should have tawakkul towards Allah!
hil: You who have internalized the faith! Remember the gift of Allah to you when a people wanted to harm you and He prevented them from doing so. Act according to taqwa towards Allah and the faithful should have tawakkul towards Allah!
compare: You who have internalized the Imam! Remember the gift of Allah to you when a people wanted to harm you and He prevented them from doing so. And act according to taqwa towards Allah. And the faithful should have tawakkul towards Allah!

src: Auch vor dir schickten Wir keine Gesandten, die keine Speise aßen oder nicht auf den Märkten umhergingen. Allein, Wir machen die einen unter euch zur Prüfung für die anderen.
ref: And all the Noble Messengers We sent before you were like this – eating food and walking in the markets; and We have made some of you a test for others; so will you, O people, patiently endure?
draft: "We did not send messengers before you who did not eat food or walk around in the markets. However, We test some of you with others."
hil: We did not send messengers before you who did not eat food or walk around in the markets. However, We test some of you with others.
compare: "We did not send messengers before you who did not eat food or walk around in the markets. However, We test some of you with others."

src: So ließen WIR die 'Alaqa zu einer Mudgha werden, und WIR ließen die Mudgha zu Knochen werden, und die Knochen bedeckten WIR mit Fleisch, dann ließen WIR ihn als eine andere Schöpfung entstehen.
ref: Then We developed the lump into bones. Then We clothed the bones with flesh.
draft: So we made the 'Alaqa into a mudgha, and We made the mudgha into bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We caused him to develop into another creation.
hil: WE made the 'Alaqa into a mudgha, and WE made the mudgha into bones, and WE covered the bones with flesh; then WE caused him to develop into another creation.
compare: So we made the 'Alaqa into a mudgha, and We made the mudgha into bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We caused him to develop into another creation.

src: Und ALLAH vergibt den Mumin-Männern und den Mumin-Frauen. Und ALLAH ist immer allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: But Allah pardoneth believing men and believing women, and Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.
draft: And Allah forgives the believing men and the believing women. And Allah is always all-forgiving, all-merciful.
hil: Allah forgives believing men and women. Allah is always all-forgiving and all-merciful.
compare: And Allah forgives the believing men and the believing women. And Allah is always all-forgiving, all-merciful.

src: Dann hat er (Schu'aib) sich von ihnen abgewendet und sagte: "Meine Leute! Gewiß, bereits habe ich euch die Botschaft meines HERRN verkündet und euch Ratschläge gemacht, also weshalb soll ich kufr-betreibenden Leuten nachtrauern?!
ref: So he turned his back on them, and said, 'O my people, I have delivered to you the Messages of my Lord, and advised you sincerely; how should I grieve for a people of unbelievers?'
draft: Then he (Shuaib) turned away from them and said: "O my people! I have indeed conveyed to you the Messages of my Lord and given you good advice. Then how can I lament over the disbelieving people?"
hil: Then he (Shuaib) turned away from them and said: 'O my people! I have indeed conveyed the Messages of my Lord to you and given you advice, so why should I grieve for disbelieving people?'
compare: Then he (Shuaib) turned away from them and said: "O my people! I have indeed conveyed to you the Messages of my Lord and given you good advice. Then how can I lament over the disbelieving people?"

src: Ihr, die den Iman bekundet habt! Verinnerlicht den Iman an ALLAH, an Seinen Gesandten, an die Schrift, die ER Seinem Gesandten nach und nach hinabsandte und an die Schrift, die ER vorher hinabsandte.
ref: O believers, believe in God and His Messenger and the Book He has revealed to His Apostle, and the Books revealed before.
draft: You who have professed the faith! Internalize the faith in Allah, in His Messenger, in the Scripture that He sent down to His Messenger in stages, and in the Scripture that He sent down before.
hil: O you who have professed the faith, believe in Allah, His noble messenger, the book He sent down upon this noble messenger of His in stages, and the book He sent down before. And whoever does not have faith in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Last Day, has undoubtedly wandered far astray.
compare: You who have professed the faith! Internalize the faith in Allah, in His Messenger, in the Scripture that He sent down to His Messenger in stages, and in the Scripture that He sent down before.

src: Sie sagten: "Wir sind zu einem Volk von Übeltätern gesandt,
ref: "We have been sent," they said, "to (punish) a sinful people,
draft: They said, "We are sent to a people of evildoers,"
hil: They said, "We are sent to a people of evildoers,"
compare: They said, "We are sent to a people of evildoers,"

src: Und was euch an Dingen zuteil wurde, ist nur Verbrauchsgut des Diesseits und dessen Schmuck.
ref: Whatsoever has been given you is the stuff this life is made of, and only its embellishment.
draft: And what happened to you in terms of things, is only consumable goods of this world and its adornment.
hil: Whatever you have been given is but the usage of the life of this world and its adornment, and that which is with Allah is better and more lasting; do you not have sense?
compare: Whatever you have been given is but the usage of the life of this world and its adornment, and that which is with Allah is better and more lasting; do you not have sense?

src: Aber sie möchten nicht an das glauben, was sie zuvor geleugnet hatten. So versiegelt Allah die Herzen der Ungläubigen.
ref: Thus it is that Allah seals the hearts of those who deny the truth.
draft: But they do not want to believe in what they had previously denied. Thus Allah seals the hearts of the unbelievers.
hil: But they refuse to believe in what they previously denied. Thus Allah seals the hearts of the disbelievers.
compare: But they do not want to believe in what they had previously denied. Thus Allah seals the hearts of the unbelievers.

src: Gewiß, Wir haben die Tora hinabgesandt, in der Rechtleitung und Licht sind, womit die Propheten, die sich (Allah) ergeben hatten, für diejenigen, die dem Judentum angehören, walten, und so auch die Leute des Herrn und die Gelehrten, nach dem, was ihnen von der Schrift Allahs anvertraut worden war und worüber sie Zeugen waren. So fürchtet nicht die Menschen, sondern fürchtet Mich.
ref: Verily We sent down the Taurat wherein was a guidance and a light. By it the prophets who submitted themselves judged those who were judaised, and so did the divines and the priests by that wherewith they were entrusted of the Book of Allah and they had become witnesses thereof.
draft: Certainly, We have sent down the Torah, in which there is guidance and light, by which the prophets who had submitted to Allah judged for the Jews, as did the Lord's people and the scholars according to what had been entrusted to them of Allah's Scripture and of which they were witnesses. So do not fear people, but fear Me.
hil: Certainly, We have sent down the Torah, in which there is guidance and light, by which the prophets who had submitted to Allah judged for the Jews, as did the Lord's people and the scholars according to what had been entrusted to them of Allah's Scripture and of which they were witnesses. So do not fear people, but fear Me.
compare: Certainly, We have sent down the Torah, in which there is guidance and light, by which the prophets who had submitted to Allah judged for the Jews, as did the Lord's people and the scholars according to what had been entrusted to them of Allah's Scripture and of which they were witnesses. So do not fear people, but fear Me.

src: Und diejenigen, denen Wissen und Glauben zugekommen sind, sagen: «Nach dem Buch Gottes habt ihr bis zum Tag der Auferweckung verweilt. Und das ist der Tag der Auferweckung.
ref: Those who have received knowledge and have faith will say, "By the decree of God, you have remained for the exact period which was mentioned in the Book of God about the Day of Resurrection.
draft: And those who have received knowledge and faith say: "According to the book of God, you have stayed until the Day of Resurrection. And this is the Day of Resurrection."
hil: And those who have received knowledge and faith say: 'According to the book of God, you have stayed until the Day of Resurrection. And this is the Day of Resurrection.'
compare: And those who have received knowledge and faith say: "According to the book of God, you have stayed until the Day of Resurrection. And this is the Day of Resurrection."

src: Diejenigen von euch, die sie zu Freunden nehmen, das sind die, die Unrecht tun.
ref: Whosoever of you then befriendeth them then those! they are the wrong-doers.
draft: Those of you who take them as friends, they are the ones who do wrong.
hil: Those of you who take them as friends, they are the ones who do wrong.
compare: Those of you who take them as friends, they are the ones who do wrong.

src: Fir'aun hatte sein Volk in die Irre geführt und nicht rechtgeleitet.
ref: The Pharaoh had led his people astray, and did not rightly guide them.
draft: Pharaoh had led his people astray and did not guide them properly.
hil: Pharaoh had led his people astray and did not guide them properly.
compare: Pharaoh had led his people astray and did not guide them properly.

src: Gewiß, dieser ist ein Feind für dich und für deine Gattin. Also lasst ihn nicht euch beide aus der Dschanna herausbringen, sonst mußt du dich mühen.
ref: This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy wife, so let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that thou come to toil.
draft: Certainly, he is an enemy for you and your wife. So do not let him bring you both out of the Dschanna, otherwise you will have to make an effort.
hil: Surely, he is an enemy to you and to your wife. So do not let him lead you both out of the Jannah, otherwise you will have to make an effort.
compare: Surely, he is an enemy to you and to your wife. So do not let him lead you both out of the Jannah, otherwise you will have to make an effort.

src: ER vergibt, wem ER will, und peinigt, wen ER will.
ref: No: You are only mortals, of His creation."
draft: He forgives whomever he wants, and punishes whomever he wants.
hil: He may forgive whomever he pleases, and may afflict whomever he wishes.
compare: He may forgive whomever he pleases, and may afflict whomever he wishes.

src: Das sind die Parteien.
ref: These were the hordes.
draft: These are the parties.
hil: These are the parties.
compare: These are the parties.

src: Und sie pflegten zu sagen: "Wie?
ref: And said: "What!
draft: And they used to say: "How?
hil: "And they used to say,"How?""
compare: And they used to say: "How?

src: Das ist der Genuß im diesseitigen Leben. Doch bei Allah ist die schöne Heimstatt.
ref: That is the enjoyment of the present life; but God -- with Him is the fairest resort.
draft: "This is the enjoyment in this earthly life. But with Allah is the beautiful home."
hil: "Those who enjoy the pleasures of this earthly life should know that the beautiful abode is with Allah."
compare: "This is the enjoyment in this earthly life. But with Allah is the beautiful home."

src: So legen Wir die Zeichen ausführlich dar, - auf daß sie umkehren mögen.
ref: That is how We explain Our signs distinctly so that they may come back (to the right path).
draft: We explain the signs in detail, so that they may turn back.
hil: We explain the signs in detail, so that they may turn back.
compare: We explain the signs in detail, so that they may turn back.

src: Das ist die Frohbotschaft, die Gott seinen Dienern, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, verkündet. Sprich: Ich verlange von euch keinen Lohn dafür, es sei denn die Liebe wie zu den Verwandten.
ref: That is that whereof Allah giveth the glad tidings Unto His bondmen who believe and work righteous works, Say thou: I ask of you no hire therefor save affection in respect of kinship.
draft: "This is the good news that God proclaims to his servants who believe and do good deeds. Say: I ask of you no payment for this, except for love towards relatives."
hil: "This is the good news that God proclaims to His servants who believe and do good deeds. Say: I do not require any payment from you, except for love towards the relatives."
compare: "This is the good news that God proclaims to his servants who believe and do good deeds. Say: I ask of you no payment for this, except for love towards relatives."

src: Und vor Mir (allein) sollt ihr Ehrfurcht haben.
ref: Me, you must fear.
draft: "And before me (alone) you shall have reverence."
hil: "Before Me (alone) you shall have reverence."
compare: "And before me (alone) you shall have reverence."

src: Und Wir haben ihn als Koran in Abschnitte geteilt, damit du ihn den Menschen ohne Hast verliest. Und Wir haben ihn nach und nach hinabgesandt.
ref: And We sent down the Qur’an in parts, that you may gradually recite it to the people, and We sent it down slowly in stages.
draft: And We have divided it into sections as the Quran, gradually revealing it to you so that you may recite it to the people with ease.
hil: And We have divided it into sections as the Quran, gradually revealing it to you so that you may recite it to the people without haste.
compare: And We have divided it into sections as the Quran, gradually revealing it to you so that you may recite it to the people with ease.

src: Sollte Der Allgnade Erweisende mir Schaden zufügen, würden weder ihre Fürbitte mir etwas nützen, noch würden sie mich erretten.
ref: So that if the Most Gracious should wish me any harm, their intercession would be of no use to me, nor would they be able to save me?”
draft: If the merciful one were to harm me, neither their intercession would benefit me, nor would they save me.
hil: If the merciful one were to harm me, neither their intercession would benefit me, nor would they save me.
compare: If the merciful one were to harm me, neither their intercession would benefit me, nor would they save me.

src: Und (einen Teil) der Nacht, verbringe ihn damit, zusätzlich für dich.
ref: And in some parts of the night (also) offer the Salat (prayer) with it (i.e. recite the Quran in the prayer), as an additional prayer (Tahajjud optional prayer Nawafil) for you (O Muhammad SAW).
draft: And (a part of) the night, spend it additionally for yourself.
hil: And (a part of) the night, spend it additionally for yourself.
compare: And (a part of) the night, spend it additionally for yourself.

src: Ein anderer Teil sorgte sich jedoch nur um sich selbst, sie dachten von ALLAH alles andere als das Wahre, eben das Denken der unwissenden Gemeinschaft, sie sagten: "Haben wir in dieser Angelegenheit irgendwelchen Einfluß?!"
ref: Slumber overtook a party of you, while another party was thinking about themselves (as how to save their ownselves, ignoring the others and the Prophet SAW) and thought wrongly of Allah - the thought of ignorance.
draft: Another part, however, only cared about themselves, they thought of ALLAH anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community, they said: "Do we have any influence in this matter ?!"
hil: Another part, however, was only concerned about themselves, they thought of Allah anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community, they said: "Do we have any influence in this matter?"
compare: Another part, however, was only concerned about themselves, they thought of Allah anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community, they said: "Do we have any influence in this matter?"

src: Handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber, strebt nach dem, womit ihr Sein Wohlgefallen erreicht und leistet Dschihad fi-sabilillah, damit ihr erfolgreich werdet.
ref: Fear Allah, and seek the means towards Him, and strive in His cause, in the hope of attaining success.
draft: Act Taqwa towards Allah, strive for what earns His pleasure and perform Jihad fi-sabilillah, so that you may be successful.
hil: Act with Taqwa towards Allah, strive for that which will attain His pleasure, and engage in Jihad for the sake of Allah, so that you may be successful.
compare: Act Taqwa towards Allah, strive for what earns His pleasure and perform Jihad fi-sabilillah, so that you may be successful.

src: (Dies), außer das Wort Ibrahims zu seinem Vater: "Ich werde ganz gewiß für dich um Vergebung bitten; doch vermag ich für dich vor Allah gar nichts auszurichten.
ref: (Except that Abraham said unto his father, 'Certainly I shall ask pardon for thee; but I have no power to do aught for thee against God.')
draft: "This, except for Ibrahim's words to his father: 'I will certainly ask for forgiveness for you, but I cannot do anything for you in the sight of Allah.'"
hil: This, except for Abraham's words to his father: 'I will certainly ask for forgiveness for you, but I cannot do anything for you in the sight of Allah.'
compare: This, except for Abraham's words to his father: 'I will certainly ask for forgiveness for you, but I cannot do anything for you in the sight of Allah.'

src: Also manche von ihnen haben den Iman verinnerlicht und manche von ihnen haben Kufr betrieben. Und hätte ALLAH es gewollt, hätten sie den bewaffneten Kampf gegenseitig nicht geführt, doch ALLAH macht, was ER will.
ref: If Allah had willed, they would not have fought against one another, but Allah does what He likes.
draft: So some of them have internalized the imam and some of them have committed kufr. And if ALLAH had wanted, they wouldn't have fought each other in armed combat, but ALLAH does as HE wills.
hil: Some of them have internalized faith, and some of them have committed disbelief. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought against each other in armed battle, but Allah does as He wills.
compare: Some of them have internalized faith, and some of them have committed disbelief. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought against each other in armed battle, but Allah does as He wills.

src: Er sagte: "Gewiß, bereits tat er dir Unrecht mit seiner Forderung zur Überlassung deines Schafsweibchen zu seinen Schafsweibchen. Und gewiß, die meisten der Beteiligten begehen doch Übertretungen die einen von ihnen gegen die anderen außer denjenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht und gottgefällig Gutes getan haben. Doch diese sind wenige." Und Dawud dachte, daß WIR ihn nur einer Fitna unterzogen haben. Dann bat er seinen HERRN um Vergebung, fiel in Ruku' nieder und war umkehrend.
ref: Said he, 'Assuredly he has wronged thee in asking for thy ewe in addition to his sheep; and indeed many intermixers do injury one against the other, save those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- and how few they are!' And David thought that We had only tried him; therefore he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he fell down, bowing, and he repented.
draft: He said, "Indeed, he has already wronged you by demanding your ewe to his ewes. And indeed, many of the associates commit excess [i.e., injustice] against one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David became certain that We had tried him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to Allah].
hil: He said, 'Indeed, he has already wronged you by demanding your ewe to his ewes. And indeed, many of the associates commit excess [i.e., injustice] against one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they.' And David became certain that We had tried him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to Allah].
compare: He said, "Indeed, he has already wronged you by demanding your ewe to his ewes. And indeed, many of the associates commit excess [i.e., injustice] against one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David became certain that We had tried him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to Allah].

src: Dies (geschah deshalb), weil sie immer wieder die Zeichen Allahs leugneten und die Propheten zu Unrecht töteten; dies (geschah), weil sie sich auflehnten und immer wieder übertraten.
ref: This, because they were ever disbelieving in the signs of Allah and slaying the prophets without justice. This, because they disobeyed and were ever trespassing.
draft: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets; this happened because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.
hil: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets; this happened because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.
compare: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets; this happened because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.

src: (Hätten Wir dich nicht entsandt), würden sie sagen, wenn sie ein Unglück trifft wegen dessen, was ihre Hände vorausgeschickt haben: "Unser Herr, hättest Du doch einen Gesandten zu uns gesandt, so daß wir Deinen Zeichen hätten folgen können und zu den Gläubigen'hätten gehören können!"
ref: And in case disaster comes upon them for what they have done themselves, they should say: "O Lord, why did You not send an apostle to us that we should have followed Your commands, and been with those who are believers;"
draft: "If We had not sent you", they would say, when disaster struck them for what their hands had previously sent forth, "Why did not we send a messenger to us, so that we could have followed Your signs and been among the believers?"
hil: "If We had not sent you", they would say, when disaster struck them for what their hands had previously sent forth, "Why did not we send a messenger to us, so that we could have followed Your signs and been among the believers?"
compare: "If We had not sent you", they would say, when disaster struck them for what their hands had previously sent forth, "Why did not we send a messenger to us, so that we could have followed Your signs and been among the believers?"

src: An dem Tag, wenn ER sie allesamt erweckt, werden sie Ihm schwören, wie sie euch schwören, und sie denken, sie verfügen über etwas (Nützliches).
ref: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all together (for their account), then they will swear to Him as they swear to you (O Muslims).
draft: On the day when HE awakens them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, and they think they have something useful.
hil: On the day when HE raises them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, and they think they have something useful.
compare: On the day when HE raises them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, and they think they have something useful.

src: Vielleicht tue ich Gutes in dem, was ich hinterlassen habe.» Nein, das ist nur ein Wort, das er (so) sagt.
ref: "In order that I may work righteousness in the things I neglected." - "By no means!
draft: "Maybe I'm doing good in what I've left behind." "No, that's just a word he says."
hil: "I might do good in what I leave behind." "No, that's just a word he says."
compare: "Maybe I'm doing good in what I've left behind." "No, that's just a word he says."

src: Ich bitte euch nicht um eine Belohnung dafür. Meine Belohnung obliegt doch nur Demjenigen, Der mich erschuf.
ref: “O my people, I ask you no wage for it; my wage lies with Him who originated me.
draft: I don't ask you for a reward. My reward is only up to the One who created me.
hil: I don't ask you for a reward. My reward is only up to the One who created me.
compare: I don't ask you for a reward. My reward is only up to the One who created me.

src: Dann entsandten Wir nach ihnen Mose mit unseren Zeichen zu Pharao und seinen Vornehmen.
ref: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his elite, but they wronged them.
draft: Then We sent Moses to them with Our signs to Pharaoh and his dignitaries.
hil: Then We sent Moses with Our signs towards Firaun and his chieftains – he said, 'Indeed I am a Noble Messenger of the Lord of the Creation.'
compare: Then We sent Moses to them with Our signs to Pharaoh and his dignitaries.

src: Und Al'ahrsch von deinem HERRN tragen über ihnen an diesem Tag acht.
ref: And on that Day, eight (of them) will carry the Throne of your Lord above them.
draft: And Allah's throne will be carried above them by eight on this day, from your Lord.
hil: On this day, eight will carry Allah's throne over them from your Lord.
compare: And Allah's throne will be carried above them by eight on this day, from your Lord.

src: Wenn die Heuchler und diejenigen, in deren Herzen Krankheit ist, und diejenigen, die beunruhigende Falschmeldungen in der Stadt verbreiten, (damit) nicht aufhören, werden Wir dich bestimmt gegen sie antreiben.
ref: If the hypocrites and those who have a disease in their hearts, and those who make a commotion in the City do not desist, We will surely urge you against them.
draft: If the hypocrites and those who have sickness in their hearts, and those who spread disturbing false news in the city, do not stop, then We will certainly urge you against them.
hil: We will certainly urge you against them if the hypocrites and those who have sickness in their hearts, and those who spread disturbing false news in the city, do not stop.
compare: If the hypocrites and those who have sickness in their hearts, and those who spread disturbing false news in the city, do not stop, then We will certainly urge you against them.

src: Und die weiblichen Guten sind für die männlichen Guten, und die männlichen Guten sind für die weiblichen Guten bestimmt, diese sind unschuldig hinsichtlich dessen, was sie (die anderen an Ifk-Lüge) sagen. Für sie ist Vergebung und edles Rizq bestimmt.
ref: Good statements are for good people (or good women for good men) and good people for good statements (or good men for good women), such (good people) are innocent of (each and every) bad statement which they say, for them is Forgiveness, and Rizqun Karim (generous provision i.e. Paradise).
draft: And the female good ones are meant for the male good ones, and the male good ones are meant for the female good ones; these are innocent concerning what they say (about the others with regard to an accusation of adultery). For them is forgiveness and noble provision (i.e., Paradise).
hil: And the female good ones are meant for the male good ones, and the male good ones are meant for the female good ones; these are innocent concerning what they say (about the others with regard to an accusation of adultery). For them is forgiveness and noble provision (i.e., Paradise).
compare: And the female good ones are meant for the male good ones, and the male good ones are meant for the female good ones; these are innocent concerning what they say (about the others with regard to an accusation of adultery). For them is forgiveness and noble provision (i.e., Paradise).

src: (Es gilt) schöne Geduld (zu üben). Gott ist der, der um Hilfe gebeten wird gegen das, was ihr beschreibt.»
ref: He said: nay! your selves have embellished for you an affair; so seemly patience! and Allah is to be implored for help in that which ye ascribe
draft: "(It is necessary to) practice beautiful patience. God is the one who is asked for help against what you describe."
hil: Beautiful patience must be practiced. God is the one who is asked for help against what you describe.
compare: "(It is necessary to) practice beautiful patience. God is the one who is asked for help against what you describe."

src: Doch es ist nichts als eine Ermahnung für die Weltenbewohner.
ref: Whilst it is no more than reminder for the people of the world.
draft: But it is nothing but an admonition for the inhabitants of the worlds.
hil: And it is nothing but an admonition for the inhabitants of the worlds.
compare: And it is nothing but an admonition for the inhabitants of the worlds.

src: Doch WIR sehen mit euch nicht eure Fürbittenden, die ihr unter euch als Partner (für ALLAH) angenommen habt.
ref: We do not see your intercessors with you who, you imagined, had partnership with you.
draft: But WE do not see with you your intercessors, whom you have taken as partners (for Allah) among yourselves.
hil: We do not see with you those whom you have accepted as intercessors among yourselves as partners (for Allah).
compare: But WE do not see with you your intercessors, whom you have taken as partners (for Allah) among yourselves.

src: Seht ihr denn nicht?
ref: Can you not perceive?
draft: Can't you see?
hil: Don't you see?
compare: Can't you see?

src: Sie sagte: "Ihr Entscheidungsträger!
draft: She said, "You decision-maker!"
hil: She said, "You decision-maker!"
compare: She said, "You decision-maker!"

src: Und die Ungläubigen sagen von den Gläubigen: "Wäre er (der Quran) etwas Gutes, hätten sie ihn nicht vor uns erlangt." Und da sie sich nicht von ihm leiten lassen, sagen sie: "Dies ist eine alte Lüge."
ref: And the disbelievers said regarding the Muslims, “If there were any good in it, the Muslims would not have surpassed us in achieving it!”; and since they did not receive guidance with it, they will now say, “This is an old slander.”
