Do not be like the disbelievers who said regarding their brothers who went on a journey or on holy war, “If they had been here with us they would not have died or been killed” – so that Allah may make it as despair in their hearts; and Allah gives life and causes death; and Allah is seeing your deeds.
draft: You who have internalized the imam! Do not be like those who committed Kufr and said to their brothers when they were on trading trips or expeditions: "If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say it) so that Allah leaves bitterness (only) in their hearts. And Allah alone gives life and causes death. And Allah is seeing of what you do.
hil: You who have internalized the imam! Do not be like those who committed Kufr and said to their brothers when they were on trading trips or expeditions: "If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say it) so that Allah leaves bitterness (only) in their hearts. And Allah alone gives life and causes death. And Allah is seeing of what you do.
compare: You who have internalized the imam! Do not be like those who committed Kufr and said to their brothers when they were on trading trips or expeditions: "If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say it) so that Allah leaves bitterness (only) in their hearts. And Allah alone gives life and causes death. And Allah is seeing of what you do.

src: Und ALLAH kennt das, was ihr verheimlicht und was ihr offenlegt.
ref: God knows what you hide and disclose.
draft: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you reveal.
hil: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you reveal. He is all-hearing, all-knowing.
compare: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you reveal. He is all-hearing, all-knowing.

src: Und wer krank oder auf Reisen war, (fastet) an anderen Tagen die gleiche Anzahl. ALLAH will für euch Erleichterung, doch ER will für euch keine Erschwernis.
ref: So whosoever of you witnesseth the month, he shall fast it, and whosoever sick or journeying, for him the like number of other days.
draft: And whoever was sick or on a journey, (shall fast) the same number on other days. ALLAH intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship.
hil: Whoever was sick or traveling (shall fast) the same number of days on other occasions. Allah intends ease for you, and He does not want to make things difficult for you.
compare: And whoever was sick or on a journey, (shall fast) the same number on other days. ALLAH intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship.

src: Nun hatten Wir ihm zuvor Ammenbrüste verwehrt.
ref: We made (Moses) refuse a wet nurse.
draft: Now we had previously denied him wet nurses.
hil: We had previously denied him wet nurses.
compare: We had previously denied him wet nurses.

src: Aber diejenigen, die ihren Herrn fürchten, für sie wird es Obergemächer geben, über denen (andere) Obergemächer gebaut sind, unterhalb derer Flüsse strömen. (Das ist) Allahs Versprechen.
ref: But as for those who are wary of their Lord, for them there will be lofty abodes with [other] lofty abodes built above them, with streams running beneath them—a promise of Allah.
draft: But for those who fear their Lord, there will be high chambers with higher chambers built above them, beneath which rivers flow. (That is) the promise of Allah.
hil: But for those who fear displeasing their Lord, there are lofty mansions built above mansions, with rivers rippling past below them. This is a promise of God, and God does not go back on His promise.
compare: But for those who fear their Lord, there will be high chambers with higher chambers built above them, beneath which rivers flow. (That is) the promise of Allah.

src: Dann sag: "Wollt ihr denn nicht Taqwa gemäß handeln!"
ref: So tell them: "Why do you not fear Him?"
draft: Then say, "Do you not want to act according to Taqwa!"
hil: Then say, 'Do you not want to act according to Taqwa!'
compare: Then say, "Do you not want to act according to Taqwa!"

src: Es ist wie das Gleichnis derjenigen (, die es) nahe vor ihnen (erlebten).
ref: Like those who had tasted the gravity of their actions a little before them.
draft: It is like the parable of those who experienced it near them.
hil: It is like the parable of those who experienced it near them.
compare: It is like the parable of those who experienced it near them.

src: Und unterlaßt nicht aus Verdruß, es aufzuschreiben, ob es klein oder groß ist, (um es festzulegen) bis zu seiner Frist. Das ist für euch gerechter bei Gott und richtiger für das Zeugnis und bewirkt eher, daß ihr keine Zweifel hegt.
ref: Unless it be merchandise present that you give and take between you; then it shall be no fault in you if you do not write it down.
draft: And do not neglect out of vexation to write it down, whether it is small or large (to ascertain it) until its appointed term. That is better in the sight of Allah and makes for stronger testimony and nearer to avoiding doubt.
hil: Do not neglect to write it down, out of vexation, whether it is small or large (to ascertain it) until its appointed term
compare: Do not neglect to write it down, out of vexation, whether it is small or large (to ascertain it) until its appointed term

src: Das (allein schon) genügt als deutliche Sünde.
ref: And this is a sufficient manifest sin.
draft: That alone is sufficient as a clear sin.
hil: That alone suffices as a clear sin.
compare: That alone suffices as a clear sin.

src: Sag: "Das Schlechte und das Gute sind nicht gleich, selbst dann nicht, solltest du an dem großen Ausmaß des Schlechten Gefallen finden." So handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber - ihr Verständige! -, damit ihr erfolgreich werdet.
ref: Say, “The impure (evil) and the pure (good) are not equal, even though the abundance of the impure may attract you; therefore keep fearing Allah, O men of intellect, so that you may succeed.”
draft: Say, "The bad and the good are not equal, even if you enjoy the extent of badness." Thus, Taqwa acts according to Allah - O you who have understanding! - so that you may become successful."
hil: Say, 'The bad and the good are not equal, even if you enjoy the extent of badness.' Thus, Taqwa acts according to Allah - O you who have understanding! - so that you may become successful.'
compare: Say, "The bad and the good are not equal, even if you enjoy the extent of badness." Thus, Taqwa acts according to Allah - O you who have understanding! - so that you may become successful."

src: Dann bestimmte ER sie zu sieben Himmeln in zwei Ay-yam, und ließ in jedem Himmel seine Anweisung als Wahy zuteil werden.
ref: Then He completed and finished from their creation (as) seven heavens in two Days and He made in each heaven its affair.
draft: Then HE determined them to seven heavens in two days, and left his instruction as Wahy in each heaven.
hil: Then HE determined them to seven heavens in two days, and left His instruction as Wahy in each heaven.
compare: Then HE determined them to seven heavens in two days, and left His instruction as Wahy in each heaven.

src: Und dem, der von ihnen sagen wollte: "lch bin ein Gott neben Ihm", würden Wir es mit Gahannam vergelten. Und ebenso vergelten Wir es den Ungerechten.
ref: If any one of them said: "I am God besides Him," We should award him Hell; for this is how We requite the evil-doers.
draft: And whoever would say of himself, "I am a god beside Him", We would repay him with Gehenna, and thus do We repay the wrongdoers.
hil: And to whoever among them said: 'I am a God beside Him,' We would recompense with Hellfire, and thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
compare: And whoever would say of himself, "I am a god beside Him", We would repay him with Gehenna, and thus do We repay the wrongdoers.

src: Oder haben sie (etwa) Teilhaber?
ref: Or have they any partners?
draft: Or do they have (perhaps) partners?
hil: Or do they have (chosen) partners? Allah (alone) is the friend.
compare: Or do they have (perhaps) partners?

src: Das ist Frevel. Heute sind diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, an eurer Religion verzweifelt, so fürchtet sie nicht, sondern fürchtet Mich.
ref: Today the unbelievers have despaired of your religion; therefore fear them not, but fear you Me.
draft: "This is sacrilege. Today those who are unbelievers are despairing in your religion, so do not fear them, but fear Me."
hil: This is sacrilege. Today those who are unbelievers have despaired of your religion, so do not fear them, but fear Me.
compare: "This is sacrilege. Today those who are unbelievers are despairing in your religion, so do not fear them, but fear Me."

src: Nur ein wenig erweist ihr euch dankbar.
ref: How little are the thanks you offer!"
draft: Only a little bit do you prove yourselves grateful.
hil: You only show yourselves grateful a little bit.
compare: Only a little bit do you prove yourselves grateful.

src: Sind sie etwa nicht auf Erden umhergezogen, damit sie sehen, wie das Anschließende derjenigen vor ihnen war.
ref: Did they not travel in the land to see what sort of fate befell those before them?
draft: Are they not wandering the earth to see how the subsequent of those before them was?
hil: Are they not wandering the earth to see how the subsequent of those before them was?
compare: Are they not wandering the earth to see how the subsequent of those before them was?

src: Da kam Allah über sie, von wo sie nicht (damit) rechneten, und jagte in ihre Herzen Schrecken, so daß sie ihre Häuser mit ihren (eigenen) Händen und den Händen der Gläubigen zerstörten.
ref: But God came upon them from where they did not suspect, and filled their hearts with terror, so that they destroyed their homes with their own hands (or were destroyed) by the hands of believers.
draft: Then Allah came upon them from where they did not expect, and put terror in their hearts, so that they destroyed their own homes with their own hands and the hands of the believers.
hil: Then Allah came upon them from where they did not expect, and put terror in their hearts, so that they destroyed their own homes with their own hands and the hands of the believers.
compare: Then Allah came upon them from where they did not expect, and put terror in their hearts, so that they destroyed their own homes with their own hands and the hands of the believers.

src: Und Wir ließen sie in Unsere Barmherzigkeit eingehen; denn sie gehörten zu den Rechtschaffenen.
ref: And they were admitted to Our grace. Verily they were among the doers of good.
draft: And we let them enter Our mercy, for they belonged to the righteous.
hil: And We allowed them to enter Our mercy, for they belonged to the righteous.
compare: And we let them enter Our mercy, for they belonged to the righteous.

src: Das Urteil ist allein Allahs.
ref: Authority belongs to God alone.
draft: "The judgment is solely Allah's."
hil: "The judgment is solely Allah's."
compare: "The judgment is solely Allah's."

src: Und du hattest nicht erwartet, daß das Buch an dich gerichtet würde.
ref: (O Prophet), you never looked forward for the Book to be revealed to you.
draft: And you had not expected that the book would be addressed to you.
hil: And you had not expected that the book would be addressed to you.
compare: And you had not expected that the book would be addressed to you.

src: Das ist ein Versprechen Gottes. Gott bricht sein Versprechen nicht. Aber die meisten Menschen wissen nicht Bescheid.
ref: The promise of Allah; Allah does not renege on His promise, but most people do not know.
draft: This is a promise of God. God does not break his promises. But most people do not know.
hil: Verily, that is a promise of God. God does not break His promise, but most people are unaware.
compare: This is a promise of God. God does not break his promises. But most people do not know.

src: Schau, wie Wir die Zeichen verschiedenartig darlegen!
ref: Behold how We turn about the signs!
draft: Look how we present the signs in different ways!
hil: Looking at how we present the signs in different ways!
compare: Look how we present the signs in different ways!

src: Den Gottesfürchtigen obliegt nicht die Verantwortung für jene, sondern nur das Ermahnen, auf daß jene gottesfürchtig werden mögen.
ref: As for the heedful and devout, they are not accountable for them, but should give advice: They may haply come to fear God.
draft: The God-fearing are not responsible for them, but only for admonishing them so that they may become God-fearing.
hil: It is not the responsibility of the God-fearing to take care of them, but only to admonish them so that they may become God-fearing.
compare: The God-fearing are not responsible for them, but only for admonishing them so that they may become God-fearing.

src: Die Ungläubigen geben wahrlich ihr Vermögen (dafür) aus, um von Allahs Weg abzuhalten.
ref: Those who disbelieve spend their possessions on turning men away from God.
draft: The unbelievers truly spend their wealth to prevent (others) from the way of Allah.
hil: The unbelievers truly spend their wealth to prevent (others) from the way of Allah.
compare: The unbelievers truly spend their wealth to prevent (others) from the way of Allah.

src: Es gibt keine Gottheit außer Ihm. Gepriesen-erhaben ist ER über das, was sie an Schirk betreiben.
ref: Too holy is He for what they ascribe to Him!
draft: There is no deity except Him. He is exalted in power and wisdom.
hil: There is no deity except Him. He is exalted above what they associate with Him.
compare: There is no deity except Him. He is exalted in power and wisdom.

src: Ihr macht ja daraus Papyrusblätter, die ihr offen zeigt - und ihr haltet vieles geheim; und euch wurde beigebracht, was ihr nicht wußtet, weder ihr noch eure Väter. Sprich: Gott.
ref: Some of it ye disclose and much thereof ye conceal. And ye were taught that which ye knew not: neither ye nor your fathers.
draft: You make papyrus leaves out of it, which you show openly, and you keep much secret; and you have been taught what you did not know, neither you nor your fathers. Say: God.
hil: You have been taught what you did not know, neither you nor your fathers. Say: God.
compare: You make papyrus leaves out of it, which you show openly, and you keep much secret; and you have been taught what you did not know, neither you nor your fathers. Say: God.

src: Und darin sollen die Konkurrierenden konkurrieren,
ref: So for this let the competitors compete.
draft: And therein should the competitors compete.
hil: And therein should competitors compete.
compare: And therein should competitors compete.

src: Und es gibt nichts, dessen Schatzkammern nicht bei Uns wären.
ref: And there is not a thing, but with Us are the stores thereof.
draft: And there is nothing that is not in our treasures.
hil: And there is nothing whose treasure chambers would not be with Us.
compare: And there is nothing whose treasure chambers would not be with Us.

src: Und WIR haben dich über sie nicht als Hüter eingesetzt und du bist über sie kein Wakil.
ref: We have not appointed you their guardian, nor are you their pleader.
draft: And WE have not appointed you as their guardian and you are not a representative over them.
hil: And We have not appointed you as their guardian and you are not a representative over them.
compare: And WE have not appointed you as their guardian and you are not a representative over them.

src: Vergib mir und schenke mir eine Herrschaft, die niemandem nach mir möglich wird. Gewiß, DU bist Der reichlich Schenkende."
ref: Forgive me and bestow upon me a kingdom, which shall not befit anyone after me; indeed only You are the Great Bestower.”
draft: "Forgive me and grant me a dominion that will be impossible for anyone after me. Indeed, YOU are the abundantly giving."
hil: Forgive me and grant me a dominion that will be impossible for anyone after me. Indeed, YOU are the abundantly giving.
compare: "Forgive me and grant me a dominion that will be impossible for anyone after me. Indeed, YOU are the abundantly giving."

src: Das Ende von beiden war, daß sie nun im Feuer sind; darin werden sie ewig weilen. Und das ist die Vergeltung für die, die Unrecht tun.
ref: So the fate of them both is that they are both in the fire, to remain in it forever; and this is the proper punishment for the unjust.
draft: The end of both was that they are now in the fire; they will dwell therein forever. And that is the recompense for those who do wrong.
hil: The end of both was that they are now in the fire, where they will dwell forever. And that is the recompense for those who do wrong.
compare: The end of both was that they are now in the fire; they will dwell therein forever. And that is the recompense for those who do wrong.

src: Und nachdem sie von da weiterzogen, sagte er seinem Dienstjungen: "Bereite uns unser Mittagessen, gewiß, bereits haben wir auf dieser unserer Reise große Mühe gehabt.
ref: When they had gone past (the confluence), Moses said to his servant: "Give me my breakfast. I am exhausted from this journey."
draft: And after they moved on from there, he said to his manservant: "Prepare our lunch for us, surely, we have already had great troubles on this journey of ours.
hil: And after they moved on from there, he said to his manservant: 'Prepare our lunch for us, surely, we have already had great troubles on this journey of ours.'
compare: And after they moved on from there, he said to his manservant: "Prepare our lunch for us, surely, we have already had great troubles on this journey of ours.

src: Den Gläubigen ist dies verboten.
ref: This is forbidden the believers,
draft: "The faithful are forbidden to do this."
hil: Verily, the faithful are forbidden from doing this.
compare: "The faithful are forbidden to do this."

src: O mein Volk, seht ihr, wie ich euch zur Rettung rufe, ihr mich aber zum (Höllen)feuer ruft?
ref: O my people, what is wrong with me that I am calling you to preservation, while you invite me to the Fire!
draft: O my people, do you see how I am calling you for rescue, but you are calling me to (hell)fire?
hil: O my people, do you see how I am calling you for rescue, but you are calling me to (hell)fire?
compare: O my people, do you see how I am calling you for rescue, but you are calling me to (hell)fire?

src: Doch schön geduldig sein. Vielleicht wird Allah sie mir alle wiederbringen; denn Er ist der Allwissende, der Allweise."
ref: "You have made up the story; but patience is best; God may bring them back to me. He is all-knowing and all-wise."
draft: "But be patient and beautiful. Maybe Allah will bring them all back to me; because He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise."
hil: Be patient and beautiful. Maybe Allah will bring them all back to me; for He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.
compare: "But be patient and beautiful. Maybe Allah will bring them all back to me; because He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise."

src: Sollen wir wirklich, wenn wir gestorben und zu Staub geworden sind...? Das ist doch eine Rückkehr von weiter Entfernung.»
ref: When we are dead and turned to dust, this returning (to life) is most far-fetched."
draft: Should we really, when we have died and become dust...? That is indeed a return from far away.
hil: Should we really, when we have died and become dust...? That is indeed a return from far away.
compare: Should we really, when we have died and become dust...? That is indeed a return from far away.

src: Meine Leute! Handelt euren Standpunkten entsprechend, auch ich handle. Ihr werdet noch wissen, wen Peinigung überkommt, welche ihn erniedrigt, und wer Lügner ist. Wartet nur ab! Ich warte ebenfalls mit euch ab."
ref: “And O my people! Keep on with your works in your positions, I am doing mine; very soon you will come to know – upon whom comes the punishment that will disgrace him, and who is the liar; and wait – I too am waiting with you.”
draft: "My people! Act in accordance with your positions, just as I do. You will know who is overtaken by punishment, who is humiliated by it, and who is a liar. Just wait! I am also waiting with you."
hil: My people! Act in accordance with your positions, just as I do. You will know who is overtaken by punishment, who is humiliated by it, and who is a liar. Just wait! I am also waiting with you.
compare: "My people! Act in accordance with your positions, just as I do. You will know who is overtaken by punishment, who is humiliated by it, and who is a liar. Just wait! I am also waiting with you."

src: Als sie vorbeigegangen waren, sagte er zu seinem Burschen: "Bringe uns unser Mittagessen. Wir haben ja durch diese unsere Reise (viel) Mühsal erlitten."
ref: So when they had gone beyond that place, Moosa said to his assistant, “Bring our breakfast – we have indeed faced great exertion in this journey of ours.”
draft: After they had passed, he said to his servant: "Bring us our lunch. We have suffered a lot of hardship through this journey."
hil: After they had passed, he said to his servant: 'Bring us our lunch. We have suffered a lot of hardship through this journey.'
compare: After they had passed, he said to his servant: "Bring us our lunch. We have suffered a lot of hardship through this journey."

src: Also sag: "Das Verborgene kennt nur ALLAH, so wartet ab!
ref: Tell them: "Unknown things are only known to God.
draft: So say: "Only Allah knows the hidden, so wait and see!"
hil: Say: 'The hidden is only known by Allah, so wait!'
compare: Say: 'The hidden is only known by Allah, so wait!'

src: Und erinnert euch an das, was in euren Wohnstätten von ALLAHs Ayat und der Weisheit vorgetragen wird. Gewiß, ALLAH ist immer allgütig, allkundig.
ref: And remember that which is recited in your houses of the signs of God and the Wisdom; God is All-subtle, All-aware.
draft: And remember what is recited in your homes of Allah's verses and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Acquainted [with all things].
hil: And remember what is recited in your homes of Allah's verses and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is always All-Good, All-Knowing.
compare: And remember what is recited in your homes of Allah's verses and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Acquainted [with all things].

src: Sag: "Mein HERR kennt das Gesagte im Himmel und auf Erden.
ref: He said: "My Lord knows whatever is spoken in the heavens and the earth.
draft: Say, "My LORD knows what is said in heaven and on earth."
hil: Say, "My LORD knows what is spoken in heaven and on earth."
compare: Say, "My LORD knows what is said in heaven and on earth."

src: Ist es denn Unsere Strafe, die sie beschleunigen wollen?
ref: Do they wish Us then to hasten the punishment?
draft: Is it then our punishment that they want to accelerate?
hil: Is it our punishment they want to accelerate?
compare: Is it then our punishment that they want to accelerate?

src: Und er hält nicht aus Geiz das (ihm offenbarte) Verborgene zurück.
ref: He is not chary of making public what is unknown.
draft: And he does not withhold the (revealed) hidden out of greed.
hil: And he does not withhold the (revealed) hidden out of greed.
compare: And he does not withhold the (revealed) hidden out of greed.

src: Wenn diese dann dicke Regenwolken trugen, lassen WIR ihn (den Regen) zu einer toten Landschaft treiben, dann lassen WIR darauf das Wasser herab. Und damit lassen WIR von den verschiedenen Früchten sprießen.
ref: Then, when they have gathered up heavy clouds, We drive them to a dead land, where We make water come down, and with it We bring out all kinds of fruits.
draft: If these then carried thick rainclouds, we let it (the rain) drive to a dead landscape, then we let the water fall on it. And thus we let various fruits sprout.
hil: We let it (the rain) drive to a dead landscape, then we let the water fall on it. And thus we let various fruits sprout.
compare: If these then carried thick rainclouds, we let it (the rain) drive to a dead landscape, then we let the water fall on it. And thus we let various fruits sprout.

src: Und an ALLAH werden die Angelegenheiten gewandt.
ref: To God all matters revert.
draft: And to Allah the affairs are turned.
hil: And the affairs are referred to Allah.
compare: And the affairs are referred to Allah.

src: Und sie folgten dem, was die Satane unter der Herrschaft Salomos vortrugen.
ref: They followed what the Shayatin (devils) gave out (falsely of the magic) in the lifetime of Sulaiman (Solomon).
draft: And they followed what the Satanists brought forward under the rule of Solomon.
hil: Say: "And they followed what the devils fabricated against the kingdom of Solomon. And Solomon did not disbelieve, but the devils disbelieved, teaching people magic and that which was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut. But the two angels do not teach anyone unless they say, "We are a trial, so do not disbelieve [by practicing magic]." And from Babylon, they learned how they might divide a man and his wife. But they do not harm anyone through it except by permission of Allah. And the people learn what harms them and does not benefit them. But the Children of Israel certainly knew that whoever purchased the magic would not have in the Hereafter any share. And wretched is that for which they sold themselves, if they only knew."
compare: Say: "And they followed what the devils fabricated against the kingdom of Solomon. And Solomon did not disbelieve, but the devils disbelieved, teaching people magic and that which was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut. But the two angels do not teach anyone unless they say, "We are a trial, so do not disbelieve [by practicing magic]." And from Babylon, they learned how they might divide a man and his wife. But they do not harm anyone through it except by permission of Allah. And the people learn what harms them and does not benefit them. But the Children of Israel certainly knew that whoever purchased the magic would not have in the Hereafter any share. And wretched is that for which they sold themselves, if they only knew."

src: Und Wir werden ihnen ihren Anteil fürwahr unverringert zukommen lassen.
ref: We shall verily give them their meed without diminution.
draft: And we will surely give them their share undiminished.
hil: And We will surely grant them their share undiminished.
compare: And we will surely give them their share undiminished.

src: Seid nicht wie diejenigen, die Musa verleumdeten, dann erklärte ihn ALLAH von dem, was sie ihm unterstellten, für unschuldig. Und er war bei ALLAH hochgeschätzt.
ref: Do not be like the people who troubled Moosa – so Allah freed him from the allegations they had uttered; and Moosa is honourable in the sight of Allah.
draft: Do not be like those who slandered Musa, then Allah declared him innocent of what they accused him of. And he was highly esteemed by Allah.
hil: Do not be like those who slandered Musa, then Allah declared him innocent of what they accused him of. And he was highly esteemed by Allah.
compare: Do not be like those who slandered Musa, then Allah declared him innocent of what they accused him of. And he was highly esteemed by Allah.

src: Sodann lasse sie mit ihren schweifenden Gesprächen ihr Spiel treiben.
ref: Say: "God," and leave them to the sport of engaging in vain discourse.
draft: Then let them indulge in their rambling conversations.
hil: Then let them indulge in their rambling conversations.
compare: Then let them indulge in their rambling conversations.

src: Die Gänge der Himmel, daß ich zum Gott des Mose emporsteige.
ref: to the heavens and be able to climb up to the Lord of Moses.
draft: The corridors of heaven, that I ascend to the God of Moses.
hil: The pathways of heaven, that I ascend to the God of Moses.
compare: The corridors of heaven, that I ascend to the God of Moses.

src: Und ich war ihr Zeuge, solange ich unter ihnen weilte, doch nachdem Du mich abberufen hattest, bist Du ihr Wächter gewesen; und Du bist der Zeuge aller Dinge.
ref: And so long as I dwelt with them I was witness over their actions. And after my life had been done, You were their keeper; and You are a witness over all things.
draft: And I was their witness as long as I lived among them, but after You summoned me away, You became their guardian; and You are the witness of all things.
hil: And I was their witness as long as I lived among them, but after You summoned me away, You became their guardian; and You are the witness of all things.
compare: And I was their witness as long as I lived among them, but after You summoned me away, You became their guardian; and You are the witness of all things.

src: Sie sagte: "HERR! Wie kann ich einen Sohn haben, wo kein Mann mich jemals intim berührt hat."
ref: She said: "How can I have a son, O Lord, when no man has touched me?"
draft: She said, "Lord, how can I have a son when no man has ever touched me intimately."
hil: She said, 'Lord, how can I have a son when no man has ever touched me intimately.'
compare: She said, "Lord, how can I have a son when no man has ever touched me intimately."

src: Ich folge doch nur dem, was mir an Wahy zuteil wird."
ref: I only follow what is revealed to me.'
draft: "I'm just following what I receive as revelation."
hil: Say, 'I follow only the revelation that is granted to me.'
compare: Say, 'I follow only the revelation that is granted to me.'

src: Ihm gebührt die wahre Anrufung. Diejenigen, die sie an seiner Stelle anrufen, erhören sie in keinem Anliegen.
ref: For Him (Alone) is the Word of Truth (i.e. none has the right to be worshipped but He).
draft: He deserves the true invocation. Those who call upon it in his place will not be heard in any matter.
hil: He deserves the true invocation. Those who call upon it in his place will not be heard in any matter.
compare: He deserves the true invocation. Those who call upon it in his place will not be heard in any matter.

src: Die Bitte Abrahams um Vergebung für seinen Vater erfolgte nur aufgrund eines Versprechens, das er ihm gegeben hatte. Als es ihm aber deutlich wurde, daß er ein Feind Gottes war, sagte er sich von ihm los. Abraham war voller Trauer und langmütig.
ref: And the seeking of forgiveness for his father (paternal uncle) by Ibrahim was only because of a promise he had made to him; then when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, Ibrahim broke off ties with him; indeed Ibrahim is surely very soft-hearted, most forbearing.
draft: The request of Abraham for forgiveness for his father was only due to a promise he had given him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he dissociated himself from him. Abraham was full of sorrow and patient.
hil: Abraham’s request for forgiveness for his father was made solely on the basis of a promise he had given to him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he dissociated himself from him. Abraham was full of sorrow and patience.
compare: The request of Abraham for forgiveness for his father was only due to a promise he had given him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he dissociated himself from him. Abraham was full of sorrow and patient.

src: Da erwies Allah uns eine Wohltat und bewahrte uns vor der Strafe des Glutwindes.
ref: But God has been gracious to us, and has saved us from the torment of scorching wind.
draft: Allah granted us a favor and protected us from the punishment of the scorching wind.
hil: Allah granted us a favor and protected us from the punishment of the scorching wind.
compare: Allah granted us a favor and protected us from the punishment of the scorching wind.

src: Es entgeht Ihm nicht das Gewicht eines Stäubchens, weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde. Und es gibt nichts, was kleiner ist als dies oder größer, das nicht in einem deutlichen Buch (verzeichnet) wäre,
ref: Not even an atom's weight in the heavens and the earth, or something smaller or greater than it, is hidden from Him, and which is not recorded in the all-too-manifest Book,
draft: He is not unaware of the weight of a speck of dust, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. And there is nothing smaller than this or greater that would not be recorded in a clear book.
hil: He is not unaware of the weight of a speck of dust, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. And there is nothing smaller than this or greater that would not be recorded in a clear book.
compare: He is not unaware of the weight of a speck of dust, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. And there is nothing smaller than this or greater that would not be recorded in a clear book.

src: Und sie sagen: "Wenn doch ein Zeichen von seinem Herrn auf ihn herabgesandt würde!" Sag: Das Verborgene ist nur Allahs.
ref: And they say, “Why is not a sign sent down upon him from his Lord?”
draft: And they say, "If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!" Say, "The unseen is only for Allah to know."
hil: And they say, 'If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!' Say, 'The unseen is only for Allah to know.'
compare: And they say, "If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!" Say, "The unseen is only for Allah to know."

src: Dem vergelten WIR mit Dschahannam.
ref: I am a god beside Him, that one We should repay with hell.
draft: We repay that with Jahannam.
hil: We repay that with Jahannam.
compare: We repay that with Jahannam.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Weshalb sagt ihr, was ihr nicht macht?!
ref: O you who believe, why do you profess what you do not practise?
draft: You who have internalized the imam! Why do you say what you don't do?!
hil: O you who have internalized the faith! Why do you say what you do not do?
compare: O you who have internalized the faith! Why do you say what you do not do?

src: Dann entsprangen daraus zwölf Quellen, bereits kennt jede Gruppe ihre Trinkstelle. Esst und trinkt von ALLAHs Rizq und übertreibt nicht auf Erden als Verderben-Anrichtende!
ref: Then there gushed forth thereout twelve springs; every people already knew their drinking-place; eat and drink of the provision of Allah, and commit not evil on the earth as corrupters.
draft: Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, and each group knew their drinking place. Eat and drink from Allah's provision and do not exceed the limits on earth by acting wickedly!
hil: Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, and each group knew their drinking place. Eat and drink from Allah's provision and do not exceed the limits on earth by acting wickedly!
compare: Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, and each group knew their drinking place. Eat and drink from Allah's provision and do not exceed the limits on earth by acting wickedly!

src: Und sollte dich eine Versuchung des Satans (vom Wahren) ablenken, so suche Zuflucht bei ALLAH!
ref: And if an evil whisper comes to you from Shaitan (Satan) then seek refuge with Allah.
draft: And if a temptation of Satan (from the truth) distracts you, seek refuge in Allah!
hil: Should a temptation of Satan (from the truth) distract you, seek refuge in Allah!
compare: And if a temptation of Satan (from the truth) distracts you, seek refuge in Allah!

src: Und sporne die Gläubigen an, vielleicht wird Gott die Schlagkraft derer, die ungläubig sind, zurückhalten. Und Gott besitzt eine noch stärkere Schlagkraft und verhängt eine noch härtere Strafe.
ref: And urge on the believers; haply God will restrain the unbelievers' might; God is stronger in might, more terrible in punishing.
draft: And urge on the believers, perhaps God will restrain the force of those who disbelieve. And God has an even greater force and imposes an even harsher punishment.
hil: And urge on the believers, perhaps God will restrain the force of those who disbelieve. And God has an even greater force and imposes an even harsher punishment.
compare: And urge on the believers, perhaps God will restrain the force of those who disbelieve. And God has an even greater force and imposes an even harsher punishment.

src: Und gewiß, bereits ließen WIR Musa Wahy zuteil werden: "Brich nachts auf mit Meinen Dienern, dann schlage ihnen einen getrockneten Weg ins Meer! Habe keine Angst vor Verfolgung und fürchte dich nicht!"
ref: And We divinely inspired Moosa that, “Journey with My bondmen in a part of the night and strike a dry path in the sea for them, you shall have no fear of Firaun getting to you, nor any danger.”
draft: And surely, we already gave Moses the revelation: "Set forth with My servants by night, and strike for them a dry path through the sea. Do not fear being overtaken, and do not be afraid."
hil: Surely, we have already given Moses the revelation: 'Set forth with My servants by night, and strike for them a dry path through the sea. Do not fear being overtaken, and do not be afraid!'
compare: And surely, we already gave Moses the revelation: "Set forth with My servants by night, and strike for them a dry path through the sea. Do not fear being overtaken, and do not be afraid."

src: Am Tag, da der Geist und die Engel in einer Reihe stehen. Sie werden nicht sprechen, ausgenommen der, dem der Erbarmer es erlaubt und der das Richtige sagt.
ref: Upon the day when the Spirit and the angels stand in ranks they shall speak not, save him to whom the All-merciful has given leave, and who speaks aright.
draft: On the day when the spirit and the angels are in a row, they will not speak except for him whom the Merciful permits and he speaks rightly.
hil: On the day when the spirit and the angels are in a row, they will not speak except for him whom the Merciful permits and he speaks rightly.
compare: On the day when the spirit and the angels are in a row, they will not speak except for him whom the Merciful permits and he speaks rightly.

src: Wenn ihr ALLAH (Seiner Sache) eine Hasan-Anleihe gebt, wird ER euch vervielfachen und euch vergeben. Und ALLAH ist reichlich belohnend, allnachsichtig.
ref: If you lend an excellent loan to Allah, He will double it for you and forgive you; and Allah is Most Appreciative, Most Forbearing.
draft: If you give ALLAH (His cause) a loan of goodness, HE will multiply it for you and forgive you. And ALLAH is richly rewarding, most merciful.
hil: "If you give ALLAH a loan of goodness, HE will multiply it for you and forgive you. And ALLAH is richly rewarding, most merciful."
compare: If you give ALLAH (His cause) a loan of goodness, HE will multiply it for you and forgive you. And ALLAH is richly rewarding, most merciful.

src: Alles, was in den Himmeln, und alles, was auf Erden ist, preist Allah; und Er ist der Erhabene, der Allweise.
ref: WHATEVER IS IN the heavens and the earth sings the praises of God. He is all-mighty and all-wise.
draft: "All that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth glorifies Allah; and He is the Sublime, the Wise."
hil: "Everything that is in the heavens and on the earth glorifies Allah, and He is the Sublime, the Wise."
compare: "All that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth glorifies Allah; and He is the Sublime, the Wise."

src: Also laß von ihnen und von dem ab, was sie erlügen.
ref: Leave them to their falsehoods.
draft: So leave them and what they lie about.
hil: So leave them and what they lie about.
compare: So leave them and what they lie about.

src: Es gibt welche unter den Juden, die Worte aus ihren Stellungen verdrehen und sagen: "Wir hören und wir gehorchen nicht", und "Höre, ohne gehört zu werden", und "Sei uns nachsichtig", indem sie mit ihren Zungen lügen und den Glauben lästern. Und hätten sie gesagt: "Wir hören und wir gehorchen", und "Höre", und "Schaue gnädig auf uns", wäre es besser für sie gewesen und aufrechter. Aber Allah hat sie zur Strafe für ihren Unglauben verflucht; darum glauben sie nur wenig.
ref: Some of the Jews interchange the words from their places and say, “We hear and disobey” – and they say “Hear- may you not be able to hear” – and they say “Raena (Be considerate towards us)” distorting it with their tongues and in order to slander religion; had they said, “We hear and we obey” and “Kindly listen to us, O dear Prophet,” and “Look mercifully upon us, O dear Prophet”, it would have been much better for them and more just – but Allah has cursed them for their disbelief; so they do not believe except a little.
draft: There are some among the Jews who pervert words from their proper meaning and say, "We hear and we disobey," and "Hear but be not heard," and "Rain down upon us a blessing," twisting them with their tongues and slandering the true faith. If they had only said, "We hear and we obey," and "We hear," and "Do look upon us with favour," it would have been better for them, and more upright. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they do not believe except for a few.
hil: There are some among the Jews who distort words out of context and say, 'We have heard and do not obey,' and 'Listen without being heard,' and 'Listen to us,' twisting their tongues and reviling the faith. If they had said, 'We hear and we obey,' and 'We hear,' and 'Look upon us graciously,' it would have been better for them, and more upright. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe very little.
compare: There are some among the Jews who pervert words from their proper meaning and say, "We hear and we disobey," and "Hear but be not heard," and "Rain down upon us a blessing," twisting them with their tongues and slandering the true faith. If they had only said, "We hear and we obey," and "We hear," and "Do look upon us with favour," it would have been better for them, and more upright. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they do not believe except for a few.

src: Vielleicht möchtest du einen Teil von dem, was dir (als Offenbarung) eingegeben wird, auslassen und deine Brust ist dadurch beklommen, und dies, weil sie sagen: "Wäre doch ein Schatz auf ihn herabgesandt worden oder ein Engel mit ihm gekommen!" Du aber bist nur ein Warner. Und Allah ist Sachwalter über alles.
ref: Perhaps you are leaving part of what has been sent down to you, and your chest is straitened by it, because they say: 'Why has no treasure been sent down to him, or an angel come with him' You are only a warner, and Allah is a Guardian over everything.
draft: Maybe you are willing to omit a part of what is revealed to you, and your heart feels constricted because they say, "Why was no treasure sent down to him, or why does no angel come with him?" You are only a warner, and Allah is in charge of everything.
hil: You may omit some of what is revealed to you and be disheartened because they say, 'Why was no treasure sent down to him or an angel accompanied him?' You are only a warner, and Allah is in charge of everything.
compare: You may omit some of what is revealed to you and be disheartened because they say, 'Why was no treasure sent down to him or an angel accompanied him?' You are only a warner, and Allah is in charge of everything.

src: Abraham war weder Jude noch Christ, sondern er war Anhänger des reinen Glaubens, ein Gottergebener, und er gehörte nicht zu den Polytheisten.
ref: Neither was Abraham a Jew nor a Christian, but upright and obedient, and not an idolater.
draft: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was a follower of the pure faith, a God-fearing person, and he did not belong to the polytheists.
hil: Abraham was not a Jew or a Christian, but he was a follower of the pure faith, a God-fearing person, and he did not belong to the polytheists.
compare: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was a follower of the pure faith, a God-fearing person, and he did not belong to the polytheists.

src: Am Tag, da sie sehen, was ihnen angedroht wird, wird ihnen sein, als hätten sie nur eine Stunde vom Tag verweilt.
ref: The Day when they see what they had been warned against they will feel as though they had remained in the world no more than an hour of a day.
draft: On the day they see what is threatened to them, it will be as if they have only spent one hour of the day.
hil: On the day they see what is threatened to them, it will be as if they have spent only one hour of the day.
compare: On the day they see what is threatened to them, it will be as if they have spent only one hour of the day.

src: Oder bis du den Himmel auf uns in Stücken herabfallen läßt, wie du behauptet hast, oder Gott und die Engel vor unsere Augen bringst,
ref: Or, let chunks of sky fall over us, as you assert (you will); or, bring God and the angels as a surety;
draft: Or until you let the sky fall down on us in pieces, as you claimed, or show us God and the angels before our eyes.
hil: Or until you let the sky fall down on us in pieces, as you claimed, or show us God and the angels before our eyes.
compare: Or until you let the sky fall down on us in pieces, as you claimed, or show us God and the angels before our eyes.

src: Und wisst, daß unter euch ALLAHs Gesandter ist. Würde er auf euch in vielen der Angelegenheiten hören, würdet ihr sicherlich unter Unannehmlichkeiten leiden.
ref: Know that the Apostle of God is among you: If he agreed with you in most matters you would surely come to grief.
draft: And know that among you is the messenger of Allah. If he would listen to you in many of the matters, you would surely suffer hardship.
hil: And know that among you is the messenger of Allah. If he were to listen to you in many of the matters, you would surely suffer hardship.
compare: And know that among you is the messenger of Allah. If he were to listen to you in many of the matters, you would surely suffer hardship.

src: Und ALLAH ist immer über alles allwissend.
ref: God has knowledge of everything.
draft: And ALLAH is always omniscient above all.
hil: And Allah is Knower of everything.
compare: And Allah is Knower of everything.

src: Diejenigen, die von den Engeln abberufen werden - da sie gegen sich selber gefrevelt haben und nun unterwürfig geworden sind (sagen): "Wir pflegten ja, nichts Böses zu tun." Nein, wahrlich, Allah weiß wohl, was ihr zu tun pflegtet.
ref: whom the angels take while they were still harming themselves' Then they will offer submission, saying: 'We have done no evil' No, surely Allah knows what you have done.
draft: Those who are recalled by the angels - since they have sinned against themselves and have become submissive (say): "We used to do nothing wrong." No, truly, Allah knows well what you used to do.
hil: Those who are recalled by the angels - since they have sinned against themselves and have become submissive (say): "We used to do nothing wrong." No, truly, Allah knows well what you used to do.
compare: Those who are recalled by the angels - since they have sinned against themselves and have become submissive (say): "We used to do nothing wrong." No, truly, Allah knows well what you used to do.

src: Hätten aber die Bewohner (jener) Städte geglaubt und wären sie gottesfürchtig gewesen, so hätten Wir ihnen ganz gewiß die Segnungen von Himmel und Erde eröffnet. Doch sie leugneten; also erfaßten Wir sie um dessentwillen, was sie begangen hatten.
ref: But if the people of these regions had believed and feared God, We would surely have showered on them blessings of the heavens and the earth; but they only denied, and We punished them for their deeds.
draft: But had the inhabitants of those cities believed and been righteous, We would surely have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied; so We seized them for what they used to earn.
hil: But if the inhabitants of those cities had believed and feared God, we would surely have opened the blessings of heaven and earth to them. But they denied; therefore, We seized them for what they had done.
compare: But had the inhabitants of those cities believed and been righteous, We would surely have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied; so We seized them for what they used to earn.

src: (Er ist der) Herr der Himmel und der Erde und all dessen, was zwischen beiden liegt.
ref: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them.
draft: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them.
hil: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them.
compare: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them.

src: So ziehen sie ihn der Lüge.
ref: So they belied him, and We destroyed them.
draft: So they pull him into the lie.
hil: Thus they lead him into deception.
compare: Thus they lead him into deception.

src: Diese sind es, die eine schlimme Abrechnung haben werden, und ihre Herberge ist Gahannam.
ref: They will be subjected to a severe reckoning and Hell shall be their refuge.
draft: These are the ones who will have a bad settlement, and their lodging is Gahannam.
hil: These are the ones who will have a bad settlement, and their lodging is Gahannam.
compare: These are the ones who will have a bad settlement, and their lodging is Gahannam.

src: Und reinige mein Haus für diejenigen, die den Umlauf vollziehen, und für die, die aufrecht stehen, sich verneigen und niederwerfen.
ref: And do thou purify My House for those that shall go about it and those that stand, for those that bow and prostrate themselves;
draft: And cleanse my house for those who complete the circuit and for those who stand upright, bow and prostrate themselves.
hil: And purify my house for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand and bow and prostrate themselves.
compare: And cleanse my house for those who complete the circuit and for those who stand upright, bow and prostrate themselves.

src: Und wenn sie zu euch kommen, sagen sie: "Wir haben den Iman bekundet.", während sie selbst doch mit dem Kufr eingetreten und mit diesem fortgegangen sind.
ref: And when they come to you they say: we believe; whereas surely with infidelity they entered and surely with it they went forth.
draft: And when they come to you, they say, "We have declared faith (Iman)" while they themselves have entered with Kufr (disbelief) and gone out with it.
hil: And when they come to you, they say, "We have declared faith (Iman)" while they themselves have entered with Kufr (disbelief) and gone out with it.
compare: And when they come to you, they say, "We have declared faith (Iman)" while they themselves have entered with Kufr (disbelief) and gone out with it.

src: Und Wir trafen mit ihnen ein festes Abkommen.
ref: We made a solemn covenant with them.
draft: And we made a firm agreement with them.
hil: And We made a firm agreement with them.
compare: And we made a firm agreement with them.

src: Und WIR setzten für ihr Zugrunde-Richten einen Termin fest.
ref: And We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.
draft: And WE set a date for their condemnation.
hil: And WE set a date for their condemnation.
compare: And WE set a date for their condemnation.

src: Mein HERR! Schenke mir Weisheit und lasse mich den gottgefällig Guttuenden folgen!
ref: O Lord, give me wisdom and admit me among the righteous,
draft: My LORD! Grant me wisdom and let me follow the godly good-doers!
hil: My Lord! Grant me wisdom and let me follow the godly good-doers!
compare: My LORD! Grant me wisdom and let me follow the godly good-doers!

src: Für diejenigen, die Unrecht tun, ist ein Los bestimmt wie das Los ihrer Gefährten.
ref: Those who do wrong will indeed come to the same end as their fellows (of old).
draft: "For those who do wrong, a fate is determined like the fate of their companions."
hil: "For those who do wrong, a fate is determined like the fate of their companions."
compare: "For those who do wrong, a fate is determined like the fate of their companions."

src: Erwarten Sie denn etwas anderes, als daß die Engel zu ihnen kommen, oder daß der Befehl deines Herrn eintrifft?
ref: So what are they waiting for, except that the angels come upon them or that your Lord’s punishment comes?
draft: Do you expect anything else than that the angels come to you, or that the command of your Lord arrives?
hil: Do you expect anything other than the angels to come to them, or the command of your Lord to come?
compare: Do you expect anything else than that the angels come to you, or that the command of your Lord arrives?

src: Und wer macht die Schöpfung am Anfang und wiederholt sie? Und wer versorgt euch vom Himmel und von der Erde?
ref: Or He Who initiates the creation, then will create it again, and He Who provides you sustenance from the skies and the earth?
draft: And who creates the creation in the beginning and repeats it? And who provides for you from the sky and the earth?
hil: And who is the creator of creation in the beginning and repeats it? And who provides for you from the sky and the earth?
compare: And who is the creator of creation in the beginning and repeats it? And who provides for you from the sky and the earth?

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Wer von euch sich von seinem Din abwendet, so wird ALLAH Menschen bringen, die ER liebt und welche Ihn lieben.
ref: Believers, if any among you renounce the faith, God will replace them by others who love Him and are loved by Him, who will be kind and considerate towards believers and firm and unyielding towards those who deny the truth.
draft: You who have internalized the Imam! Whoever turns away from his Din among you, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.
hil: O you who have internalized the imam! Whoever among you turns away from his Din, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.
compare: O you who have internalized the imam! Whoever among you turns away from his Din, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.

src: Sie sagten: "Bist du zu uns gekommen, um uns von dem abzubringen, worin wir unsere Väter (vor)gefunden haben, und damit euch beiden die Oberhoheit im Land werde?
ref: "Have you come," said they, "to turn us back from what we found our ancestors doing, so that the two of you may attain supremacy in the land?
draft: They said, "Have you come to divert us from what our fathers found, and so that the two of you may have mastery in the land?"
hil: They said, 'Have you come to divert us from what our fathers found, and so that the two of you may have mastery in the land?'
compare: They said, "Have you come to divert us from what our fathers found, and so that the two of you may have mastery in the land?"

src: Und (Er läßt dies zu,) damit diejenigen, denen das Wissen gegeben wurde, erkennen, daß es die Wahrheit von deinem Herrn ist, auf daß sie daran glauben und ihre Herzen sich Ihm friedvoll unterwerfen mögen. Und siehe, Allah leitet jene, die gläubig sind, auf den geraden Weg.
ref: And so that the people given the knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, in order that they may accept faith in it, therefore their hearts may humble before Him; and indeed Allah will guide the believers on the Straight Path.
draft: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and that they may believe in it and their hearts may submit peacefully to Him. And indeed, Allah guides those who believe to the straight path.
hil: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and that they may believe in it and their hearts may submit peacefully to Him. And indeed, Allah guides those who believe to the straight path.
compare: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and that they may believe in it and their hearts may submit peacefully to Him. And indeed, Allah guides those who believe to the straight path.

src: Hätten sie gesagt: «Wir hören, und wir gehorchen», und: «Höre», und: «Schau auf uns» (unzurnaa), wäre es besser und richtiger für sie. Aber Gott hat sie wegen ihres Unglaubens verflucht, so glauben sie nur wenig.
ref: If they had said, 'We have heard and obey' and 'Hear' and 'Regard us,' it would have been better for them, and more upright; but God has cursed them for their unbelief so they believe not except a few.
draft: If they had said, "We hear and we obey," and "Listen" and "Look at us," it would be better and more correct for them. But God has cursed them because of their unbelief, so they only believe a little.
hil: If they had said, 'We hear and we obey,' and 'Listen' and 'Look at us,' it would be better and more correct for them. But God has cursed them because of their unbelief, so they only believe a little.
compare: If they had said, "We hear and we obey," and "Listen" and "Look at us," it would be better and more correct for them. But God has cursed them because of their unbelief, so they only believe a little.

src: Dann befände ich mich wahrlich in einem offenkundigen Irrtum.
ref: In that case I would surely be in clear error.
draft: Then I would truly be in an obvious error.
hil: Then I would truly be in an obvious error.
compare: Then I would truly be in an obvious error.

src: Wenn aber jemand (dazu) gezwungen ist, ohne (es) zu begehren und ohne das Maß zu überschreiten, so trifft ihn keine Schuld; wahrlich, Allah ist Allverzeihend, Barmherzig.
ref: If one is obliged by necessity to eat it without intending to transgress, or reverting to it, he is not guilty of sin; for God is forgiving and kind.
draft: If, however, someone is forced to (do so) without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not to be blamed; truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful.
hil: If, however, someone is compelled to do it without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not to be blamed; truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful.
compare: If, however, someone is forced to (do so) without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not to be blamed; truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful.

src: Sag: "Ihr Schriftbesitzer! Ihr habt nichts (vom Din), bis ihr At-taurat und Alindschil und das einhaltet, was euch von eurem HERRN hinabgesandt wurde.
ref: Say to them: "O people of the Book, you have no ground (for argument) until you follow the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to you by your Lord."
draft: Say, "O scripture holders, you have nothing (of guidance) until you uphold the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord."
hil: Say, 'O scripture holders, you have nothing (of guidance) until you uphold the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord.'
compare: Say, "O scripture holders, you have nothing (of guidance) until you uphold the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord."

src: Und (erinnere daran), als Musa zu seinen Leuten sagte: "Gewiß, ALLAH gebietet euch, eine Kuh zu schlachten."
ref: And when Moses said to his people, 'God commands you to sacrifice a cow.'
draft: And (remember) when Moses said to his people, "Certainly, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow."
hil: And (remember) when Musa said to his people, 'Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow.'
compare: And (remember) when Musa said to his people, 'Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow.'

src: Könntest du nur sehen wenn sie mit Furcht geschlagen sein werden!
ref: And couldst thou see the time when they shall be terrified!
draft: Could you only see when they are struck with fear!
hil: Could you only see them being struck with fear!
compare: Could you only see them being struck with fear!

src: ER ist Der Allhörende, Der Allwissende.
ref: He is the Hearer, the Knower.
draft: He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
hil: He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
compare: He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

src: Und ALLAHs Erde ist weit.
ref: And God’s earth is vast.
draft: And ALLAH's earth is vast.
hil: And Allah's earth is vast.
compare: And ALLAH's earth is vast.

src: Gewiß, die Unrecht-Begehenden werden nie erfolgreich werden."
ref: But surely the wicked will not prosper."
draft: "Surely, wrongdoers will never succeed."
hil: Surely, wrongdoers will never succeed.
compare: "Surely, wrongdoers will never succeed."

src: Verleihe uns Geduld und lasse uns als Muslime sterben!"
ref: Pour (bestow abundantly) patience on us, and bestow us death as Muslims.”
draft: "Lend us patience and let us die as Muslims!"
hil: Grant us patience and allow us to die as Muslims!
compare: Grant us patience and allow us to die as Muslims!

src: Könnt ihr uns vor Gottes Pein etwas nützen?»
ref: They will say: "Had Allah guided us, we would have guided you.
draft: "Can you help us in the face of God's torment?"
hil: Can you, in the face of God's torment, be of any use to us?
compare: "Can you help us in the face of God's torment?"

src: Diese erhalten einen Anteil von dem, was sie sich erworben haben. Gott ist schnell im Abrechnen.
ref: They are those who will surely have their share of whatsoever they have earned; for God is swift at the reckoning.
draft: These receive a share of what they have acquired. God is quick in settling the accounts.
hil: They receive a share of what they have acquired. God is quick in settling the accounts.
compare: These receive a share of what they have acquired. God is quick in settling the accounts.

src: (Das ist) Allahs Versprechen in Wahrheit.
ref: The Promise of Allah is true.
draft: (This is) Allah's promise in truth.
hil: Allah's promise in truth.
compare: (This is) Allah's promise in truth.

src: Sie können doch sich selbst nicht helfen, und sie werden keinen Beistand gegen Uns erhalten.
ref: But they are not able to help themselves, nor can they find protection against Us.
draft: You cannot help yourselves, and you will receive no assistance against us.
hil: They cannot help themselves and will receive no assistance from us.
compare: They cannot help themselves and will receive no assistance from us.

src: Und lauert nicht auf jedem Weg auf, um (Menschen) einzuschüchtern und von ALLAHs Weg diejenigen abzuhalten, die den Iman verinnerlicht haben - erstrebt nach dem Krümmen (dieses Weges). Und entsinnt euch, als ihr noch wenige wart, dann ließ ER euch mehr werden. Und nehmt wahr, wie das Anschließende von den Verderben-Anrichtenden war.
ref: “And do not be seated on every road in order to scare the travellers, and to prevent from Allah’s path the people who believe in Him, wishing to distort it; and remember when you were few and He increased your numbers; and see what sort of fate befell the mischievous!”
draft: And do not lie in wait on every path to frighten and turn away from Allah's way those who have believed. And seek to make the path straight, remembering when you were few and He increased you. And see how was the end of the corrupters.
hil: And do not lie in wait on every path to frighten and turn away from Allah's way those who have believed. And seek to make the path straight, remembering when you were few and He increased you. And see how was the end of the corrupters.
compare: And do not lie in wait on every path to frighten and turn away from Allah's way those who have believed. And seek to make the path straight, remembering when you were few and He increased you. And see how was the end of the corrupters.

src: ER sagte: "WIR ließen doch deine Leute nach dir der Fitna aussetzen.
ref: Said He, 'We have tempted thy people since thou didst leave them.
draft: He said, "We did expose your people to the Fitna after you."
hil: He said, "We did expose your people to the Fitna after you."
compare: He said, "We did expose your people to the Fitna after you."

src: Und verkünde denen, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, daß für sie Gärten bestimmt sind, unter denen Bäche fließen.
ref: And bear thou the glad tidings unto those who believe and do righteous works that verily for them shall be Gardens whereunder rivers flow.
draft: And declare to those who believe and do good works that gardens are destined for them beneath which rivers flow.
hil: And announce to those who believe and do good deeds that gardens have been prepared for them beneath which rivers flow.
compare: And declare to those who believe and do good works that gardens are destined for them beneath which rivers flow.

src: Und gewiß, viele führen mit ihren Gelüsten durch Mangel an Wissen zum Irrweg.
ref: Surely many (men) mislead others into following their vain desires through lack of knowledge.
draft: And certainly, many with their desires lead astray due to lack of knowledge.
hil: And indeed, many lead astray with their desires due to a lack of knowledge.
compare: And indeed, many lead astray with their desires due to a lack of knowledge.

src: So prüfen Wir sie dafür, daß sie zu freveln pflegten.
ref: We tried them in this way, for they were disobedient.
draft: So we test them for they used to be wicked.
hil: We test them because they used to be wicked.
compare: We test them because they used to be wicked.

src: Gewiß, WIR entsandten Nuh zu seinen Leuten: "Warne deine Leute, bevor zu ihnen eine qualvolle Peinigung kommt."
ref: SENT NOAH to his people to warn them before the painful punishment came upon them.
draft: Certainly, WE sent Noah to his people, "Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them."
hil: Certainly, WE sent Noah to his people, saying, 'Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.'
compare: Certainly, WE sent Noah to his people, saying, 'Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.'

src: Vielmehr sind sie Leute, die (Allah andere) gleichsetzen.
ref: Nay, but they are a people who ascribe equals (to Him)!
draft: Rather, they are people who equate (others with Allah).
hil: No! Rather, they are people who equate (others with Allah).
compare: Rather, they are people who equate (others with Allah).

src: Gewiß, ALLAH ist allwürdig, allweise.
ref: He is indeed all-mighty and all-wise.
draft: Surely, Allah is all-worthy, all-wise.
hil: And surely, Allah is all-worthy, all-wise.
compare: And surely, Allah is all-worthy, all-wise.

src: Und WIR werden euch bestimmt das Land nach ihnen bewohnen lassen. Dies ist für denjenigen, der Ehrfurcht vor der Vorstellung Mir gegenüber hat, und der Meine Androhung fürchtet."
ref: “And indeed We will establish you in the land after them; this is for him who fears to stand before Me and fears the commands of punishment declared by Me.”
draft: "And WE will certainly let you inhabit the land after them. This is for the one who fears standing before Me and fears My threat.”
hil: We will certainly let you inhabit the land after them. This is for the one who fears standing before Me and fears My threat.
compare: "And WE will certainly let you inhabit the land after them. This is for the one who fears standing before Me and fears My threat.”

src: Hast du etwa nicht diejenigen wahrgenommen, denen gesagt wurde: "Haltet euch zurück, verrichtet ordnungsgemäß das rituelle Gebet und entrichtet die Zakat"?!
ref: Have you not seen the people who were told: "Hold back your hands (from attacking), observe your devotional obligations and pay the zakat?"
draft: Did you not perceive those who were told, "Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish prayer and give zakah"?
hil: Did you not perceive those who were told, "Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish prayer and give zakah"?
compare: Did you not perceive those who were told, "Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish prayer and give zakah"?

src: "Und gewiß, als ALLAHs Diener aufstand, an Ihn Bittgebete zu richten, beinahe wären sie ihn Niederdrückende."
ref: When the devotee of God stood up to invoke Him (the jinns) crowded upon him (to listen).
draft: "And surely, when Allah's servant stood up to pray to Him, they almost suppressed him."
hil: Say: "Surely, when Allah's servant stood up to pray to Him, they almost suppressed him."
compare: Say: "Surely, when Allah's servant stood up to pray to Him, they almost suppressed him."

src: Und sie sind vor (jedem) Schrecken an jenem Tag in Sicherheit'.
ref: He will be secure from the terror of the Day of Judgment.
draft: "And they are safe from (any) terror on that day."
hil: And on that day they are safe from every terror.
compare: And on that day they are safe from every terror.

src: Gewiß ALLAH verfügt bei Sich über das Wissen der Stunde, ER läßt den helfenden (Regen) nieder und ER weiß, was in den Mutterschößen ist. Und kein Lebewesen weiß, was es morgen erwirbt, und kein Lebewesen weiß, in welchem Lande es stirbt. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allwissend, allkundig.
ref: Surely Allah is He with Whom is the knowledge of the hour, and He sends down the rain and He knows what is in the wombs; and no one knows what he shall earn on the morrow; and no one knows in what land he shall die; surely Allah is Knowing, Aware.
draft: Assuredly, Allah has knowledge of the Hour and He sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Assuredly, Allah is Knowing, Acquainted.
hil: Assuredly, Allah has knowledge of the Hour and He sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Assuredly, Allah is Knowing, Acquainted.
compare: Assuredly, Allah has knowledge of the Hour and He sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Assuredly, Allah is Knowing, Acquainted.

src: Das Königreich, das wahrhaftige - an jenem Tage wird es des Allerbarmers sein; und ein Tag soll es sein, (der) schwer für die Ungläubigen (ist)
ref: The real sovereignty will belong to Ar-Rahman. How grievous will be the day for the infidels!
draft: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will belong to the Merciful; and it shall be a day (that is) hard for the unbelievers.
hil: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will belong to the Merciful; and it shall be a day (that is) hard for the unbelievers.
compare: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will belong to the Merciful; and it shall be a day (that is) hard for the unbelievers.

src: Allah wird uns zusammenbringen.
ref: Allah will bring us all together.
draft: Allah will bring us together.
hil: Allah will bring us together.
compare: Allah will bring us together.

src: Sag: "Setzt ihr ALLAH etwa (damit) in Kenntnis über etwas, was ER weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde kennt?!" Gepriesen-erhaben sei ER über das, was sie an Schirk betreiben.
ref: Say: "Do ye indeed inform Allah of something He knows not, in the heavens or on earth?- Glory to Him! and far is He above the partners they ascribe (to Him)!"
draft: Say: "Do you inform Allah about something that He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?!" Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
hil: Say, 'Do you inform Allah about something that He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?!' Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
compare: Say: "Do you inform Allah about something that He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?!" Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

src: Du bringst das Lebendige aus dem Toten, und Du bringst das Tote aus dem Lebendigen hervor, und Du bescherst Unterhalt, wem Du willst, ohne (viel) zu rechnen.
ref: You bring forth the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living, and You give sustenance to whom You will beyond all reckoning.'
draft: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will, without counting (much).
hil: You bring the living from the dead, and you bring the dead from the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will, without counting much.
compare: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will, without counting (much).

src: Aber er ist nicht den steilen Paßweg hinaufgestürmt.
ref: But he could not scale the steep ascent.
draft: But he did not rush up the steep pass path.
hil: However, he did not rush up the steep pass path.
compare: However, he did not rush up the steep pass path.

src: Erhebt nicht eure Stimmen über die Stimme des Propheten, und seid ihm gegenüber nicht so laut mit dem Gesagten, wie die einen von euch den anderen gegenüber laut sind, sonst werden eure Handlungen zunichte, während ihr es nicht merkt.
ref: Do not raise your voices higher than the voice of the Prophet, nor speak to him loudly the way you shout to one another, lest your deeds go to waste whilst you are unaware. (Faith will go waste due to the slightest disrespect towards the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him.
draft: Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and do not speak aloud to him in speech as some of you speak aloud to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you do not perceive it.
hil: Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and do not speak aloud to him in speech as some of you speak aloud to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you do not perceive it.
compare: Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and do not speak aloud to him in speech as some of you speak aloud to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you do not perceive it.

src: Sie pflegten nicht zuzuhören und sie pflegten nicht einzublicken.
ref: They could not bear to hear (the preachers of the truth) and they used not to see (the truth because of their severe aversin, inspite of the fact that they had the sense of hearing and sight).
draft: They did not use to listen and they did not use to look inside.
hil: They used not to listen and they used not to look inside.
compare: They did not use to listen and they did not use to look inside.

src: Und WIR ließen Musa Wahy zuteil werden, als seine Leute ihn um Wasser baten: "Schlage mit deinem Stock gegen den Felsen!"
ref: And We revealed unto Musa, when his people asked him for drink: Smite the rock with thy rod.
draft: And WE gave Musa revelation when his people asked him for water: "Strike the rock with your staff!"
hil: And remember, when We gave Musa revelation when his people asked him for water: 'Strike the rock with your staff!'
compare: And WE gave Musa revelation when his people asked him for water: "Strike the rock with your staff!"

src: Und wenn der Himmel (wie ein Fell) abgezogen wird,
ref: The curtain drawn back from the skies,
draft: And when the sky (like a pelt) is pulled off,
hil: And when the sky is peeled off (like a pelt),
compare: And when the sky is peeled off (like a pelt),

src: Und daß ihr fastet, ist besser für euch, wenn ihr (es) nur wißt!
ref: And if you fast it is good for you, if you knew.
draft: And that you fast is better for you, if you only knew!
hil: And that you fast is better for you, if only you knew!
compare: And that you fast is better for you, if only you knew!

src: Und verheiße den Gläubigen die frohe Botschaft.
ref: So convey glad tidings to those who believe.
draft: And promise believers the good news.
hil: And give believers the glad tidings.
compare: And give believers the glad tidings.

src: Diejenigen, die es lieben, daß sich das Abscheuliche unter denjenigen, die glauben, verbreitet, für sie wird es schmerzhafte Strafe geben im Diesseits und Jenseits. Allah weiß, ihr aber wißt nicht.
ref: There is painful punishment in this world and the next for those who like that immorality should spread among the believers, for God knows and you do not know.
draft: Those who love that the abominable should spread among those who believe, for them there will be painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.
hil: Those who love the abominable to spread among those who believe will have a painful punishment in this life and the Hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.
compare: Those who love the abominable to spread among those who believe will have a painful punishment in this life and the Hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.

src: Sie sagen: "Allah hat Sich Kinder genommen." Preis sei Ihm! Er ist der Unbedürftige. Ihm gehört, was in den Himmeln und was auf der Erde ist. Keine Ermächtigung habt ihr dafür. Wollt ihr über Allah etwas sagen, was ihr nicht wißt?
ref: They said, “Allah has created a son for Himself”- Purity is to Him! He is the Perfect (Unwanting, free of needs); to Him only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; “You do not have any proof of this; do you say a thing concerning Allah which you do not know?”
draft: They say, "Allah has taken children to Himself." Praise be to Him! He is the self-sufficient. To Him belong what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say something about Allah which you do not know?
hil: They say, "Allah has taken children to Himself." Praise be to Him! He is the self-sufficient. To Him belong what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say something about Allah which you do not know?
compare: They say, "Allah has taken children to Himself." Praise be to Him! He is the self-sufficient. To Him belong what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say something about Allah which you do not know?

src: Und hätten sie sich doch in Geduld geübt, bis du zu ihnen herauskommst, wäre dies sicher besser für sie.
ref: If they had waited for you to come out it would have been better for them.
draft: And if they had exercised patience until you come out to them, this would certainly be better for them.
hil: If only they had practiced patience until you came out to them, it would certainly have been better for them.
compare: If only they had practiced patience until you came out to them, it would certainly have been better for them.

src: Möge sein Herr ihm, wenn er euch (alle) entläßt, zum Tausch andere Gattinnen geben, die besser sind als ihr: muslimische Frauen, die gläubig und demütig ergeben sind, bereit zur Umkehr sind, (Gott) dienen und umherziehen, ob sie früher verheiratet waren oder Jungfrauen sind.
ref: In case he divorces you, his Lord will give him better wives in return, who will be modest, true believers, obedient to God, repentant, observant of prayer and fasting, both widows and virgins.
draft: May his Lord, when He dismisses you all, give him (in exchange) wives better than you: Muslim women, faithful, obedient, penitent, reverent, devout, given to fasting, who have been married before and virgins too.
hil: May his Lord, if He dismisses you all, give him other wives in exchange who are better than you: Muslim women who are faithful, obedient, penitent, reverent, devout, given to fasting, and who roam around, whether they were previously married or virgins.
compare: May his Lord, if He dismisses you all, give him other wives in exchange who are better than you: Muslim women who are faithful, obedient, penitent, reverent, devout, given to fasting, and who roam around, whether they were previously married or virgins.

src: Das ist ein gerader Weg."
ref: This is the straight path."
draft: "The way is straight."
hil: That is a straight path.
compare: "The way is straight."

src: Da wollte er sie aus dem Land aufschrecken.
ref: So he resolved to turn them out of the land (of Egypt).
draft: He wanted to scare her out of the country.
hil: He wanted to scare her out of the country.
compare: He wanted to scare her out of the country.

src: Kostet nun die Pein dafür, daß ihr ungläubig waret.»
ref: Therefore now taste the punishment, the result of your disbelief.”
draft: "Now taste the torment of disbelief!"
hil: Taste now the torment for having been unbelievers.
compare: Taste now the torment for having been unbelievers.

src: Dachten sie etwa nicht über sich selbst nach?!
